analyzed: atha evam matiḥ yat vidhi rūpam sphurati tasya para apohaḥ pi asti iti tad pratītiḥ ucyate
translated: If this is the view: what manifests in the form of affirmation, in that there is also the exclusion of other, the understanding of that is stated.

analyzed: tadā api sambandha mātram apohasya 🔽vidhiḥ eva sākṣāt nirbhāsī api
translated: Even then, for exclusion, there is merely the relation.🔽Affirmation alone manifests directly.

analyzed: ca evam adhyakṣasya api apoha viṣaya tvam anivāryam viśeṣataḥ vikalpāt eka vyāvṛtta ullekhinaḥ khila anya vyāvṛttam īkṣamāṇasya
translated: And thus, it is unavoidable that even perception has the exclusion of others as its object, especially for one who, through the exclusion of one, notices the exclusion of all others.

original: tasmādvidhyākārāvagrahādadhyakṣavad vikalpasyāpi vidhiviṣayatvameva nānyāpohaviṣayatvamiti kathamapohaḥ śabdārtho ghuṣyate /
analyzed: tasmāt vidhi ākāra avagrahāt adhyakṣa vat vikalpasya api vidhi viṣaya tvam eva na anya apoha viṣaya tvam iti katham apohaḥ śabda arthaḥ ghuṣyate
translated: Therefore, just as in perception, so also in conceptual cognition, the form of affirmation is grasped, and hence the object of conceptual cognition is affirmation only, not the exclusion of others. How then can exclusion be proclaimed as the meaning of words?

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate  na asmābhiḥ apoha śabdena vidhiḥ eva kevalaḥ bhipretaḥ
translated: To this we reply:🔽We do not accept that the word 'exclusion' denotes only affirmation.

analyzed: na api anya vyāvṛtti mātram
translated: Nor do we accept that it denotes mere exclusion from others.

analyzed: kintu anya apoha viśiṣṭaḥ vidhiḥ śabdānām arthaḥ
translated: But the meaning of words is affirmation qualified by the exclusion of others.

analyzed: tatas ca na pratyeka pakṣa upanipāti doṣa avakāśaḥ
translated: And hence there is no scope for the faults that would apply to each of the individual positions.

original: yattu goḥ pratītau na tadātmāparātmeti sāmarthyādapohaḥ paścānniścīyata iti vidhivādināṃ matam /
analyzed: yat tu goḥ pratītau na tad ātmā aparātmā iti sāmarthyāt apohaḥ paścāt niścīyate iti vidhi vādinām matam
translated: As for the view of the proponents of affirmation that when a cow is cognized, its nature and the nature of others are excluded by implication and determined later,

original: anyāpohapratītau vā sāmarthyādanyāpoḍho 'vadhāryate iti pratiṣedhavādināṃ matam /
analyzed: anya apoha pratītau vā sāmarthyāt anya apoḍhaḥ vadhāryate iti pratiṣedha vādinām matam
translated: or the view of the proponents of negation that when the exclusion of others is cognized, what is excluded from others is determined by implication,

analyzed: tat asundaram
translated: that is not good.

analyzed: prāthamikasya api krama adarśanāt
translated: Because even the primary cognition is not seen to occur in sequence.

original: na hi vidhiṃ pratipadya kaścidarthāpattitaḥ paścādapohamavagacchati /
analyzed: na hi vidhim pratipadya kaścid arthāpattitaḥ paścāt apoham avagacchati
translated: For no one, having understood the injunction, later understands the exclusion by presumption.

analyzed: apoham vā pratipadya anya apoḍham
translated: Or having understood the exclusion, [understands] the excluded.

analyzed: tasmāt goḥ pratipattiḥ iti anya apoḍha pratipattiḥ ucyate
translated: Therefore, the understanding of a cow is said to be the understanding of what excludes others.

analyzed: yadi api ca anya apoḍha śabda anullekhaḥ uktaḥ tathā api nā apratipattiḥ eva viśeṣaṇa bhūtasya anya apohasya
translated: And although the word excluding others is not mentioned, the exclusion of others, which is the qualifier, is not not understood at all.

analyzed: a gavā apoḍhe eva go śabdasya niveśita tvāt
translated: Because the word cow is applied only to what excludes non-cows.

original: yathā nīlotpale niveśitādindīvaraśabdānnīlotpalapratītau tatkāla eva nīlimasphuraṇamanivāryaṃ
analyzed: yathā nīlotpale niveśitāt indīvara śabdāt nīlotpala pratītau tad kāle eva nīlima sphuraṇam anivāryam
translated: Just as when the word indīvara is applied to the blue lotus, the manifestation of blueness is unavoidable at the very time of understanding the blue lotus,

original: tathā gośabdādapyagavāpoḍhe niveśitād gopratītau tulyakālameva viśeṣaṇatvādago 'pohasphuraṇamanivāryam /
analyzed: tathā go śabdāt api agavā apoḍhe niveśitāt go pratītau tulya kālam eva viśeṣaṇa tvāt ago upoha sphuraṇam anivāryam
translated: in the same way, when the word cow is applied only to what excludes non-cows, the manifestation of the exclusion of non-cows is unavoidable at the very time of understanding the cow, because it is a qualifier.

analyzed: yathā pratyakṣasya prasajya rūpa abhāva agrahaṇam abhāva vikalpa utpādana śaktiḥ eva tathā vidhi vikalpānām api tad anurūpa anuṣṭhāna dāna śaktiḥ eva abhāva grahaṇam abhidhīyate
translated: Just as the non-apprehension of the negation of the form [of the object] that is suggested by perception is the very power to produce the conceptual cognition of negation, in the same way, the apprehension of negation is said to be the very power of the conceptual cognitions of affirmation to bring about the performance of actions that are in conformity with it.

analyzed: paryudāsa rūpa abhāva grahaṇam tu niyata sva rūpa saṃvedanam ubhayoḥ aviśiṣṭam
translated: But the apprehension of non-existence in the form of exclusion is the same for both, as it is the definite cognition of one's own nature.

original: anyathā yadi śabdādarthapratipattikāle kalito na parāpohaḥ kathamanyaparihāreṇa pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: anyathā yadi śabdāt artha pratipatti kāle kalitaḥ na para apohaḥ katham anya parihāreṇa pravṛttiḥ
translated: Otherwise, if exclusion of others is not implied at the time of understanding the meaning from a word, how can there be engagement through the exclusion of others?

analyzed: tatas gām badhāna iti śva ādīn api badhnīyāt
translated: Then, when prompted to tie a cow, one would also tie horses and other animals.

original: yadapyavocad vācaspatiḥ jātimatyo vyaktayo vikalpānāṃ śabdānāṃ ca gocaraḥ /
analyzed: yat api avocat vācaspatiḥ jātimatyaḥ vyaktayaḥ vikalpānām śabdānām ca gocaraḥ
translated: What Vācaspati also said: Individual things possessing universals are the domain of conceptual thoughts and words.

original: tāsāṃ ca tadvatīnāṃ rūpamatajjātīyaparāvṛttamityatastadavagaterna gāṃ badhāneti codito 'śvādīn badhnāti /
analyzed: tāsām ca tadvatīnām rūpam a tad jātīya parāvṛttam iti atas tad avagateḥ na gām badhāna iti śva ādīn badhnāti
translated: And the form of those possessing universals is distinguished from other non-homogenous things. Therefore, when that is understood, one prompted to tie a cow does not tie horses and other animals.

analyzed: tat api anena eva nirastam
translated: That too is refuted by this very [argument].

original: yato jāteradhikāyāḥ prakṣepe 'pi vyaktīnāṃ rūpamatajjātīyaparāvṛttameva cet /
analyzed: yatas jāteḥ adhikāyāḥ prakṣepe vyaktīnām rūpam a tad jātīya parāvṛttam eva ced
translated: Because even if a higher universal is introduced, if the form of individual things is only distinguished from other non-homogenous things,

analyzed: tadā tena eva rūpeṇa śabda vikalpayoḥ viṣayībhavantīnām katham a tad vaya āvṛtti parihāraḥ
translated: then how can the exclusion of non-those be avoided for them, when they become the objects of words and conceptual thoughts through that very form?

original: atha na vijātīyavyāvṝttaṃ vyaktirūpaṃ tathāpratītaṃ vā tadā jātiprasāda eṣa iti kathamarthato 'pi tadavagatirityuktaprāyam /
analyzed: atha na vijātīya vyāvṝttam vyakti rūpam tathā pratītam vā tadā jāti prasādaḥ eṣaḥ iti katham arthataḥ tad avagatiḥ iti ukta prāyam
translated: If, on the other hand, the individual form is not distinguished from what is of a different kind, or is not apprehended as such, then this is indeed the favour of the universal. How then is its apprehension even in meaning stated?

analyzed: atha jāti balāt eva anyatas vyāvṛtam
translated: If, on the other hand, it is distinguished from other things by the power of the universal,

analyzed: bhavatu jāti balāt sva hetu paramparā balāt vā anya vyāvṛtam
translated: let it be distinguished from other things by the power of the universal, or by the power of its own causal series.

analyzed: ubhayathā api vyāvṛtta pratipatau vyāvṛtti pratipattiḥ asti eva
translated: In both cases, when there is apprehension of the distinguished, there is indeed apprehension of the distinction.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: The connection

analyzed: na ca agava apoḍhe go śabda saṅketa vidhau anyīnī āśraya doṣaḥ
translated: And in the injunction to use the word 'cow' for what is devoid of non-cows, there is no fault of mutual dependence.

analyzed: sāmānye tadvati vā saṃkete tad doṣa avakāśāt
translated: Even in the case of an agreement on the universal or on what possesses it, there is room for that fault.

analyzed: na hi sāmānyam nāma sāmānya mātram abhipretam
translated: For the universal is not intended to be mere generality.

analyzed: turage pi go śabda saṃketa prasaṅgāt  kim tu go tvam
translated: Because there would be the consequence of agreement on the word 'cow' even for a horse.🔽But rather, it is cowness.

original: tāvatā ca sa eva doṣaḥ /🔽gavādiparijñāne gotvasāmānyāparijñānāt /
analyzed: tāvatā ca saḥ eva doṣaḥ  gavādi parijñāne go tva sāmānya aparijñānāt
translated: And to that extent, that very fault remains.🔽Because when cows etc. are known, cowness as a universal is not known.

analyzed: go tva sāmānya a parijñāne go śabda vācyā parijñānāt
translated: And when cowness as a universal is not known, what is denoted by the word 'cow' is known.

original: tasmādekapiṇḍadarśanapūrvako yaḥ sarvavyaktisādhāraṇa iva bahiraghyasto vikalpabuddhyākāraḥ tatrāyaṃ gauriti saṃketakaraṇe netaretarāśrayadoṣaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt eka piṇḍa darśana pūrvakaḥ yaḥ sarva vyakti sādhāraṇaḥ iva bahis aghyastaḥ vikalpa buddhi ākāraḥ tatra ayam gauḥ iti saṃketa karaṇe na itaretarāśraya doṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the cognition of the universal cow, which is superimposed externally as if common to all individuals, preceded by the perception of a single individual, when the convention is made as this is a cow, there is no fault of mutual dependence.

analyzed: abhimate ca go śabda pravṛttau a go śabdena śeṣasya api abhidhānam ucitam
translated: And when the word cow is accepted, it is proper for the word non-cow to denote the remainder.

analyzed: na ca anya apoḍha anya apohayoḥ virodhaḥ viśeṣya viśeṣaṇa bhāva kṣatiḥ vā
translated: And there is no contradiction between the exclusion of other and the exclusion of non-other, nor is there any harm to the relation of qualifier and qualified.

analyzed: paraspara vyavaccheda abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no mutual exclusion.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya sadbhāvāt
translated: Because there is co-reference.

analyzed: bhū tala ghaṭa abhāva vat
translated: Like the absence of a pot on the ground.

analyzed: sva abhāvena hi virodhaḥ na para abhāvena iti ā bāla prasiddham
translated: It is well-known from childhood that contradiction is by nature, not by exclusion of others.

original: eṣa panthāḥ śrughnamupatiṣṭhata ityatrāpyapoho gamyata eva /🔽aprakṛtapathāntarāpekṣayā eṣa eva śrudhnapratyanīkāniṣṭasthānāpekṣayā śrughnameva /🔽araṇyamārgavad vicchedābhāvādupatiṣṭhata eva /
analyzed: eṣa panthāḥ śrughnam upatiṣṭhate iti atra api apohaḥ gamyate eva  aprakṛta patha antara apekṣayā eṣaḥ eva śrudhna pratyanīka aniṣṭa sthāna apekṣayā śrughnam eva  araṇya mārga vat viccheda abhāvāt upatiṣṭhate eva
translated: Even in the sentence This path leads to Shringavata, exclusion is understood itself.🔽By disregarding other paths not under consideration, it is this very [path] that leads to Shringavata, by disregarding other undesirable places opposite to Shringavata.🔽It leads to Shringavata, because there is no interruption, like a forest path.

original: sārthadūtādivyavacchedena panthā eveti pratipadaṃ vyavacchedasya sulabhatvāt /
analyzed: sārtha dūta ādi vyavacchedena panthāḥ eva iti pratipadam vyavacchedasya sulabha tvāt
translated: Because exclusion is easily understood in every word, as [the path] itself by excluding a caravan, an envoy, etc.

original: tasmādapohadharmaṇo vidhirūpasya śabdādavagatiḥ puṇḍarīkaśabdādiva śvetimaviśiṣṭasya padmasya //
analyzed: tasmāt apoha dharmaṇaḥ vidhi rūpasya śabdāt avagatiḥ puṇḍarīka śabdāt iva śvetima viśiṣṭasya padmasya
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the form of affirmation, which has the property of exclusion, is from the word, like the cognition of a lotus distinguished by whiteness from the word 'lotus'.

analyzed: yadi evam vidhiḥ eva śabda arthaḥ vaktum ucitaḥ
translated: If it is so, it is proper to say that affirmation alone is the meaning of a word.

analyzed: katham apohaḥ gīyate iti ced  uktam atra apoha śabdena anya apoha viśiṣṭaḥ vidhiḥ ucyate
translated: How is exclusion proclaimed?🔽It has been said here that by the word 'exclusion', affirmation distinguished by the exclusion of others is meant.

analyzed: tatra vidhau pratīyamāne viśeṣaṇa tayā tulya kālam anya apoha pratītiḥ iti
translated: And when affirmation is cognized, the cognition of the exclusion of others occurs simultaneously as a qualifier.

original: na caiva pratyakṣasyāpyapohaviṣayatvavyavasthā kartamucitā /🔽tasya śābdapratyayasyeva vastuviṣayatve vivādābhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca eva pratyakṣasya api apoha viṣaya tva vyavasthā kartam ucitā  tasya śābda pratyayasya iva vastu viṣaya tve vivāda abhāvāt
translated: And in the case of perception also, it is not proper to establish that it has exclusion as its object.🔽Because there is no dispute that it, like verbal cognition, has an external object as its object.

analyzed: vidhi śabdena ca yathā adhyavasāyam a tad rūpa parāvṛttaḥ bāhyaḥ rthaḥ abhimataḥ
translated: And by the word 'affirmation', an external object that is turned away from the form of what is not that, as it is conceived, is intended.

analyzed: yathāpratibhāsam buddhi ākāraḥ ca
translated: And the form of cognition, as it appears.

analyzed: tatra bāhyaḥ rthaḥ dhyavasāyāt eva śabda vācyaḥ vyavasthāpyate
translated: There, the external object is established as denoted by the word only through conception.

analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa parisphūrtyā
translated: Not through the clear manifestation of its own characteristic.
Because, like perception, it does not clearly manifest the own characteristic that is restricted by place, time and condition.

analyzed: yat śāstram
translated: The treatise says:

analyzed: śabdena avyāpṛta akṣasya buddhau apratibhāsanāt
translated: Because when the sense faculty is not engaged with sound, the object does not appear in the cognition.

analyzed: arthasya dṛṣṭau iva
translated: As in the case of what is seen.

analyzed: iti indriya śabda svabhāva upāya bhedāt ekasya eva arthasya pratibhāsa bhedaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the difference in appearance of a single object is due to the difference in the nature of the sense faculty and sound as the means,

analyzed: atra api uktam
translated: it has been said in response:

analyzed: jātaḥ nāma āśrayaḥ nyā anyaḥ cetasām tasya vastutas
translated: The mind has a different basis, which is a different thing from the object.

original: ekasyaiva kuto rūpaṃ bhinnākārāvabhāsi tat //🔽na hi spaṣṭāspaṣṭe dve rūpe parasparaviruddhe ekasya vastunaḥ staḥ /
analyzed: ekasya eva kutas rūpam bhinna ākāra avabhāsi tat  na hi spaṣṭa aspaṣṭe dve rūpe paraspara viruddhe ekasya vastunaḥ staḥ
translated: How can a single thing have a form that appears in different ways?🔽For a single thing cannot have two mutually contradictory forms, one clear and one unclear,

analyzed: yatas ekena indriya buddhau pratibhāseta anyena vikalpe
translated: by which it would appear in the sense cognition through one [form] and in the conceptual cognition through the other.

original: tathā sati vastuna eva bhedaprāpteḥ / 🔽Nibandh na hi svarūpabhedādaparo vastubhedaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sati vastunaḥ eva bheda prāpteḥ  na hi svarūpa bhedāt aparaḥ vastu bhedaḥ
translated: If it were so, the thing itself would be multiple.🔽For there is no difference in the thing other than the difference in its own nature.

analyzed: na ca pratibhāsa bhedāt aparaḥ svarūpa bhedaḥ
translated: And there is no difference in its own nature other than the difference in appearance.

analyzed: anyathā trailokyam ekam eva vastu syāt
translated: Otherwise, the entire triple world would be a single thing.

original: dūrāsannadeśavartinoḥ puruṣayorekatra śākhini spaṣṭāspaṣṭapratibhāsabhede 'pi na śākhibheda iti cet /
analyzed: dūra āsanna deśa vartinoḥ puruṣayoḥ ekatra śākhini spaṣṭa aspaṣṭa pratibhāsa bhede na śākhi bhedaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even when there is a difference in the clear and unclear appearance of a single tree for two men, one far away and one nearby, there is no difference in the tree,

analyzed: na brūmaḥ pratibhāsa bhedaḥ bhinna vastu niyataḥ
translated: we do not say that the difference in appearance is necessarily due to a difference in the thing.

analyzed: kim tu eka viṣaya tva abhāva niyate iti
translated: But it is not necessarily restricted to the absence of a single object.

analyzed: tatas yatra artha kriyā bheda ādi sacivaḥ pratibhāsa bhedaḥ tatra vastu bhedaḥ ghaṭa vat
translated: Therefore, where there is a difference in appearance accompanied by a difference in effective action, there is a difference in substance, like a pot.

analyzed: anyatra punar niyamena eka viṣaya tām pariharati iti eka pratibhāsaḥ bhrāntaḥ
translated: But in other cases, it necessarily avoids having a single object, so the single appearance is mistaken.

original: etena yadāha vācaspatiḥ na ca śābdapratyakṣayorvastugocaratve pratyayābhedaḥ kāraṇabhedena pārokṣyāpārokṣyabhedopapatteriti /
analyzed: etena yat āha vācaspatiḥ na ca śābda pratyakṣayoḥ vastu gocara tve pratyaya abhedaḥ kāraṇa bhedena pārokṣya apārokṣya bheda upapatteḥ iti
translated: In this connection, what Vācaspati said - And when verbal cognition and perception have the same object, the difference in the cognition is due to the difference in the cause, as the difference between the manifest and the unmanifest is possible -

analyzed: tat na upayogi
translated: that is not useful.

analyzed: parokṣa pratyayasya vastu gocara tva asamartha tāt
translated: Because a hidden cognition is incapable of having a real object.

analyzed: parokṣa tā āśrayaḥ tu kāraṇa bhedaḥ indriya gocara grahaṇa viraheṇa eva kṛtārthaḥ
translated: But the basis of hiddenness, which is the difference in the cause, is served by the mere absence of the apprehension of the object of the sense organs.

analyzed: tat na  śābde pratyaye sva lakṣaṇam parisphurati
translated: That is not so.🔽In a verbal cognition, the specific individual appears.

original: kiṃ ca svalakṣaṇātmani vastuni vācye sarvātmanā pratipatteḥ vidhiniṣedhayorayogaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca sva lakṣaṇa ātmani vastuni vācye sarva ātmanā pratipatteḥ vidhi niṣedhayoḥ ayogaḥ
translated: Moreover, if the object consisting of specific individuals is denoted, then because of the complete understanding of the object, injunctions and prohibitions are not possible.

original: tasya hi sadbhāve 'stīti vyartham /🔽nāstītyasamartham /🔽asadbhāve tu nāstīti vyartham /
analyzed: tasya hi sadbhāve sti iti vyartham  na asti iti asamartham  asadbhāve tu na asti iti vyartham
translated: For, if it exists, then it exists is useless.🔽It does not exist is impossible.🔽But if it does not exist, then it does not exist is useless.

analyzed: asti iti asamartham
translated: It exists is impossible.

analyzed: asti ca asti ādi pada prayogaḥ
translated: And there is the use of words like 'exists' and 'does not exist'.

original: tasmāt śābdapratibhāsasya bāhyārthabhāvābhāvasādhāraṇyaṃ na tadviṣayatāṃ kṣamate //
analyzed: tasmāt śābda pratibhāsasya bāhya artha bhāva abhāva sādhāraṇyam na tad viṣaya tām kṣamate
translated: Therefore, the commonality of the external existence and non-existence of the verbal appearance cannot bear its objectivity.

original: yacca vācaspatinā jātimadvyaktivācyatāṃ svavācaiva prastutyāntarameva na ca śabdārthasya jāterbhāvābhāvasādhāraṇyaṃ nopapadyate /
analyzed: yat ca vācaspatinā jātimat vyakti vācyatām sva vācā eva prastutya antaram eva na ca śabda arthasya jāteḥ bhāva abhāva sādhāraṇyam nā upapadyate
translated: And what Vācaspati, having himself proposed the theory of the denotability of an individual possessing a universal, later says: And the commonality of existence and non-existence of the universal which is the meaning of a word is not possible.

analyzed: sā hi svarūpataḥ nityā api deśa kāla viprakīrṇa aneka vyakti āśraya tayā bhāva abhāva sādhāraṇībhavantī astināsti saṃbandha yogyā
translated: For that, although eternally existent in its own form, becomes common to existence and non-existence by being the substratum of many individuals scattered in space and time, and is fit to be related to existence and non-existence.

analyzed: vartamāna vyakti saṃbandhi tā hi jāteḥ astitā
translated: For the existence of a universal is its relation to a present individual.

analyzed: atīta anāgata vyakti saṃbandhi tā ca nāstitā iti sandigdha vyatireki tvāt anaikāntikam bhāva abhāva sādhāraṇyam
translated: And its relation to past and future individuals is its non-existence. Thus, the commonality of existence and non-existence is inconclusive due to the doubtful negative concomitance.

analyzed: anyathā asiddham vā iti vikalpitam
translated: Or it is fallacious due to being otherwise established - this is the alternative.

analyzed: tat aprastutam
translated: That is not relevant.

analyzed: tāvatā tāvat na prakṛta kṣatiḥ
translated: To that extent, there is no harm to the main point.

original: jātau bharaṃ nyasyatā svalakṣaṇavācyatvasya svayaṃ svīkārāt /
analyzed: jātau bharam nyasyatā sva lakṣaṇa vācya tvasya svayam svīkārāt
translated: For one who has placed the burden on the universal, by himself accepting the denotability of the particular,

analyzed: kim ca sarvatra padārthasya sva lakṣaṇa svarūpeṇa eva astitva ādikam cintyate
translated: Moreover, everywhere the existence, etc. of the object is considered in the form of its own particular nature.

analyzed: jāteḥ tu vartamāna ādi vyakti saṃvadhī stitva ādikam iti tu bāla pratāraṇam
translated: But the existence, etc. of the universal is related to the present and past individuals - this is a deception of the ignorant.

analyzed: evam jātimat vyakti vacane pi doṣaḥ
translated: Similarly, even in the statement of an individual possessing a universal, there is a fault.

original: vyakteścet pratītisiddhiḥ jātiradhikā pratīyatāṃ mā vā /
analyzed: vyakteḥ ced pratīti siddhiḥ jātiḥ adhikā pratīyatām mā vā
translated: If the cognition of the individual is established, let the universal be cognized or not.

analyzed: na tu vyakti pratīti doṣāt muktiḥ
translated: But there is no freedom from the fault of the cognition of the individual.

original: etena yaducyate kaumārilaiḥ sabhāgatvādeva vastuno na sādhāraṇyadoṣaḥ /🔽vṛkṣatvaṃ hyanirdhāritabhāvābhāvaṃ śabdādavagamyate /
analyzed: etena yat ucyate kaumārilaiḥ sa bhāga tvāt eva vastunaḥ na sādhāraṇya doṣaḥ  vṛkṣa tvam hi anirdhārita bhāva abhāvam śabdāt avagamyate
translated: In this way, what is said by the followers of Jaimini - Due to the state of being similar, there is no fault of commonality in the object.🔽For the universal 'tree' is understood from the word as having an undetermined existence and non-existence.

analyzed: tayoḥ anyatareṇa śabda antara avagatena saṃbadhyate iti
translated: It is connected with what is understood from another word, either of those two.

analyzed: tat api asaṅgatam
translated: That is also irrelevant.

analyzed: sāmānyasya nityasya  nibandh
translated: Because it is not possible for a permanent universal to have an undetermined existence and non-existence.

original: yaccedam na ca pratyakṣasyeva śabdānāmarthapratyāyanaprakāro yena taddṛṣṭa ivāstyādiśabdāpekṣā na syāt /
analyzed: yat ca idam na ca pratyakṣasya iva śabdānām artha pratyāyana prakāraḥ yena tad dṛṣṭe iva asti ādi śabda apekṣā na syāt
translated: And this - And unlike in the case of perception, there is no mode of conveying the meaning by words, by which there would be no need for words like 'exists', as if it were seen.

analyzed: vicitra śakti tvāt pramāṇānām iti
translated: Because the means of knowledge have various powers.

original: tadapyaindriyakaśābdapratibhāsayorekasvarūpagrāhitve bhinnāvabhāsadūṣaṇena dūṣitam /🔽vicitraśaktitvaṃ ca pramāṇānāṃ sākṣātkārādhyavasāyābhyāmapi caritārtham /
analyzed: tat api aindriyaka śābda pratibhāsayoḥ eka svarūpa grāhi tve bhinna avabhāsa dūṣaṇena dūṣitam  vicitra śakti tvam ca pramāṇānām sākṣātkāra adhyavasāyābhyām api caritārtham
translated: That also has been refuted by the objection that if the appearance of the word and the cognition have the same form, then the appearance of difference is contradicted.🔽And the fact that the means of knowledge have diverse powers is also accounted for by the two [means of knowledge] perception and inference.

original: tato yadi pratyakṣārthapratipādanaṃ śābdena tadvadevāvabhāsaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tatas yadi pratyakṣa artha pratipādanam śābdena tadvat eva avabhāsaḥ syāt
translated: Therefore, if the object of perception is conveyed by the word, then the appearance should be just like that.

original: abhavaṃśva na tadviṣayakhyāpanaṃ kṣamate //🔽nanu vṛkṣaśabdena vṛkṣatvāṃśe codite sattvādyaṃśaniścayanārthamastyādipadaprayoga iti cet /
analyzed: na tad viṣaya khyāpanam kṣamate  nanu vṛkṣa śabdena vṛkṣa tva aṃśe ca udite sattva ādi aṃśa niścayana artham asti ādi pada prayogaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is not so, then it cannot convey that object.🔽If it is argued that when the class 'tree' is denoted by the word 'tree', the word 'exists' is used to ascertain the class 'existence' and so on,

analyzed: niraṃśa tvena pratyakṣa samadhigatasya sva lakṣaṇasya kaḥ vakāśaḥ pada antareṇa
translated: then there is no scope for another word to denote the particular which is apprehended by perception as partless.

analyzed: dharma antara vidhi niṣedhayoḥ pramāṇa antareṇa vā
translated: Nor is there scope for another means of knowledge to enjoin or prohibit another property.

analyzed: pratyakṣe pi pramāṇa antara apekṣā dṛṣṭā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even in perception, dependence on another means of knowledge is seen,

analyzed: bhavatu tasya aniścaya ātmaka tvāt anabhyasta svarūpa viṣaye
translated: let it be so, because that [perception] has the nature of non-ascertainment and the form is not well-known.

original: vikalpastu svayaṃ niścayātmako yatra grāhī tatra kimapareṇa /
analyzed: vikalpaḥ tu svayam niścaya ātmakaḥ yatra grāhī tatra kim apareṇa
translated: But an option [i.e., a doubt] which is itself of the nature of ascertainment, grasps [its object] where it is [i.e., in the object], then what is the use of another [means of knowledge]?

analyzed: asti ca śabda liṅga antara apekṣā
translated: And there is dependence on another word or mark.

original: tato na vastusvarūpagrahaḥ //🔽nanu bhinnā jātyādayo dharmāḥ parasparaṃ dharmiṇaśceti jātilakṣaṇaikadharmadvāreṇa🔽pratīte 'pi śākhini dharmāntaravattayā na pratītiriti kiṃ na bhinnābhidhānādhīno
analyzed: tatas na vastu svarūpa grahaḥ  nanu bhinnāḥ jāti ādayaḥ dharmāḥ parasparam dharmiṇaḥ ca iti jāti lakṣaṇa eka dharma dvāreṇa  pratīte pi śākhini dharma antaravat tayā na pratītiḥ iti kim na bhinna abhidhāna adhīnaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is not the apprehension of the nature of the thing itself.🔽But it is said: The different attributes like genus, etc., are mutually different from the substratum. Therefore, even when the tree is cognized through the single attribute of genus and characteristics,🔽there is no cognition of it as possessing other attributes. So why should the cognition of other attributes like blue, moving, tall, etc.

analyzed: dharma antarasya nīla cala uccaistara tva ādeḥ avabodhaḥ
translated: depend on different expressions?

analyzed: tat etat asaṅgatam  akhaṇḍa ātmanaḥ sva lakṣaṇasya pratyakṣe pi pratibhāsāt
translated: This is irrelevant.🔽Because the unitized self-characteristic appears even in perception.

analyzed: dṛśyasya dharma dharmi bhedasya pratyakṣa pratikṣipta tvāt
translated: Because the difference between attribute and substratum, which is visible, is rejected by perception.

analyzed: anyathā sarvam sarvatra syāt iti atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the fallacy of everything being in everything.

analyzed: kālpanika bheda āśrayaḥ tu dharma dharmi vyavahāraḥ iti prasādhitam śāstre
translated: But the usage of attribute and substratum is based on imaginary difference. This has been established in the treatise.

analyzed: bhavatu vā pāramārthikaḥ dharma dharmi bhedaḥ
translated: Or let there be even a real difference between attribute and substratum.

analyzed: tathā api anayoḥ samavāya ādeḥ dūṣita tvāt upakāra lakṣaṇā eva pratyāsattiḥ eṣitavyā
translated: Even so, since inherence, etc., have been refuted, only the relation characterized by help is to be sought.

original: evaṃ ca yathendriyapratyāsattyā pratyakṣeṇa dharmipratipattau sakalataddharmapratipattistathā
analyzed: evam ca yathā indriya pratyāsattyā pratyakṣeṇa dharmi pratipattau sakala tad dharma pratipattiḥ tathā
translated: And thus, just as when a property-possessor is apprehended by perception through proximity to a sense-organ, there is apprehension of all its properties,

analyzed: śabda liṅgābhyām api vācya vācaka ādi saṃbandha pratibaddhābhyām dharmi pratipattau niravaśeṣa tad dharma pratipattiḥ bhavet
translated: so also when a property-possessor is apprehended through words and inferential marks, which are bound by the relation of denoted and denotative etc., there would be apprehension of all its properties without exception.

analyzed: pratyāsati mātrasya aviśeṣāt
translated: Because proximity alone is not distinguished.

analyzed: yat ca vācaspati
translated: And what the lord of speech (says):

original: na caikopādhinā sattvena viśiṣṭe tasmin gṛhīte upādhyantaraviśiṣṭastadgrahaḥ /
analyzed: na ca eka upādhinā sattvena viśiṣṭe tasmin gṛhīte upādhi antara viśiṣṭaḥ tad grahaḥ
translated: And when that is apprehended as qualified by the single qualifier 'existence', the apprehension of that as qualified by another qualifier does not occur.

analyzed: svabhāvaḥ hi dravyasya upādhibhiḥ viśiṣyate
translated: For the nature of a substance is distinguished by qualifiers.

original: na tūpādhayo vā viśeṣyatvaṃ vā tasya svabhāva iti /
analyzed: na tu upādhayaḥ vā viśeṣya tvam vā tasya svabhāvaḥ iti
translated: But the qualifiers or the state of being qualified is not the nature of that (substance).

analyzed: tat api plavate eva
translated: That also floats away.

analyzed: na hi abhedāt upādhi antara grahaṇam āsañjitam
translated: For the apprehension of another qualifier is not entailed by non-difference.

analyzed: bhedam puraskṛtya eva upakāraka grahaṇe upakārya grahaṇa prasañjanāt
translated: Because the apprehension of the qualified is entailed only when the helper is apprehended, keeping difference in the forefront.

original: na cāgnidhūmayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāva iva svabhāvata eva dharmadharmiṇoḥ pratipattiniyamakalpanamucitam /
analyzed: na ca agni dhūmayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāve iva svabhāvataḥ eva dharma dharmiṇoḥ pratipatti niyama kalpanam ucitam
translated: And it is not proper to imagine a rule of apprehension for the property and property-possessor, just as for fire and smoke, by their very nature as cause and effect.

analyzed: tayoḥ api pramāṇa asiddha tvāt
translated: Because even their relation is not established by a means of knowledge.

analyzed: pramāṇa siddhe ca svabhāva upavarṇanam iti nyāyaḥ
translated: And it is proper to describe the nature of what is established by valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: yat ca atra nyāyabhūṣaṇena sūrya ādi grahaṇe tad upakārya aśeṣa vastu rāśi grahaṇa prasañjanam uktam
translated: And what the Nyāyabhūṣaṇa has said here, that in the apprehension of the sun etc., there is the implication of the apprehension of the entire mass of things that are benefited by it,

analyzed: tad abhiprāya an avagāhana phalam
translated: that is the result of not understanding the intention.

analyzed: tathā hi tvad mate dharma dharmiṇoḥ bhedaḥ
translated: For thus, in your view, there is a difference between the property and the possessor of the property.

original: upakāralakṣaṇaiva ca pratyāsattistadopakārakagrahaṇe samānadeśasyaiva dharmarūpasyaiva copakāryasya grahaṇamāsañjitam /
analyzed: upakāra lakṣaṇā eva ca pratyāsattiḥ tadā upakāraka grahaṇe samāna deśasya eva dharma rūpasya eva ca upakāryasya grahaṇam āsañjitam
translated: And the proximity characterized by benefit is itself implied in the apprehension of what benefits, the apprehension of what is to be benefited, which is in the same place and has the form of a property, is implied.

original: tatkathaṃ sūryopakāryasya bhinnadeśasya dravyāntarasya vā dṛṣṭavyabhicārasya grahaṇaprasaṅgaḥ saṅgataḥ /
analyzed: tat katham sūrya upakāryasya bhinna deśasya dravya antarasya vā dṛṣṭa vyabhicārasya grahaṇa prasaṅgaḥ saṅgataḥ
translated: So how is the implication of the apprehension of what is benefited by the sun, which is in a different place or is a different substance, which is seen to be deviant, relevant?

original: tasmādekadharmadvāreṇāpi vastusvarūpapratipattau sarvātmapratīteḥ kva śabdāntareṇa vidhiniṣedhāvakāśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt eka dharma dvāreṇa api vastu svarūpa pratipattau sarva ātma pratīteḥ kva śabda antareṇa vidhi niṣedha avakāśaḥ
translated: Therefore, even through the door of one property, when the nature of a thing is understood, since the entire self is understood, where is the scope for affirmation and negation by another word?

analyzed: asti ca  tasmāt na sva lakṣaṇasya śabda vikalpa liṅga pratibhāsi tvam iti sthitam
translated: And it exists.🔽Therefore, it is established that the specific characteristic is not manifested by word, conceptual construction, or inference.

analyzed: nā api sāmānyam śābda pratyaya pratibhāsi
translated: Nor is the universal manifested in the appearance of verbal cognition.

original: saritaḥ pāre gāvaścarantīti gavādiśabdāt sāsnāśṛṅgalāṅgūlādayo 'kṣarākāraparikaritāḥ sajātīyabhedāparāmarśanāt sampiṇḍitaprāyāḥ pratibhāsante
analyzed: saritaḥ pāre gāvaḥ caranti iti go ādi śabdāt sāsnā śṛṅga lāṅgūla ādayaḥ kṣara ākāra parikaritāḥ sajātīya bheda a parāmarśanāt sampiṇḍita prāyāḥ pratibhāsante
translated: When it is said cows are grazing on the other side of the river, from the word cows and so on, the dewlaps, horns, tails, and so on appear as if combined, due to the non-apprehension of distinctions within the same class.

analyzed: na ca tat eva sāmānyam
translated: And that itself is not the universal.

analyzed: varṇa ākṛti akṣara ākāra śūnyam go tvam hi kathyate
translated: For cowhood is said to be devoid of color, shape, and letters.

original: tadeva ca sāsnāśṛṅgādimātramakhilavyaktāvatyantavilakṣaṇamapi svalakṣaṇenaikīkriyamāṇaṃ sāmānyamityucyate tādṛśasya bāhyasyāprāpterbhrāntirevāsau
analyzed: tat eva ca sāsnā śṛṅga ādi mātram akhila vyaktau atyanta vilakṣaṇam api sva lakṣaṇena ekīkriyamāṇam sāmānyam iti ucyate tādṛśasya bāhyasya aprāpteḥ bhrāntiḥ eva asau  /
translated: And that very thing, which is completely different from all the manifest things with dewlaps, horns, and so on, is called the universal when it is identified with its own characteristics. That is mere illusion, due to the non-apprehension of an external object of that kind.

analyzed: keśa pratibhāsavat
translated: Like the appearance of hair.

analyzed: tasmāt vāsanā vaśāt buddheḥ eva tad ātmanā vivartaḥ yamaḥ tu
translated: Therefore, let this be the mere transformation of consciousness itself into that form, under the influence of impressions.

analyzed: asat eva vā tat rūpam khyātu
translated: Or let that form appear as unreal.

original: vyaktaya eva vā svajātīyabhedatiraskāreṇānyathā bhāsantāmanubhavavyavadhānāt smṛtipramoṣo vābhidhīyatām /
analyzed: vyaktayaḥ eva vā sva jātīya bheda tiraskāreṇa anyathā bhāsantām anubhava vyavadhānāt smṛti pramoṣaḥ vā abhidhīyatām
translated: Or let the individual things themselves appear differently, by setting aside distinctions within their own class. Let it be called the loss of memory due to the interruption of experience.

analyzed: sarvathā nirviṣayaḥ khalu ayam sāmānya pratyayaḥ
translated: In any case, this cognition of the universal is indeed devoid of an object.

analyzed: kva sāmānya vārtā
translated: Where is the talk of a universal?

analyzed: yat punar sāmānya abhāve sāmānya pratyayasya ākasmika tvam uktam tat ayuktam
translated: As for the assertion that in the absence of the universal, the cognition of the universal would be accidental, that is incorrect.

analyzed: yatas pūrva piṇḍa darśana smaraṇa sahakāriṇā atiricyamāna viśeṣa pratyaya janikā sāmagrī nirviṣayam sāmānya vikalpam utpādayati
translated: Because the collection of causes that produces the cognition of a distinct universal, aided by the prior perception and recollection of the individual, produces a conceptual cognition of a universal that is devoid of an object.

original: tadevaṃ na śābde pratyaye jātiḥ pratibhāti /
analyzed: tat evam na śābde pratyaye jātiḥ pratibhāti
translated: Thus, the universal does not appear in verbal cognition.

analyzed: na api pratyakṣe
translated: Nor in perception.

analyzed: na ca anumānataḥ siddhiḥ
translated: Nor is it established by inference.

analyzed: adṛśya tve pratibaddha liṅga adarśanāt
translated: Because when it is not visible, the inferential mark is not seen.

original: nāpondriyavadasyāḥ siddhiḥ jñānakāryataḥ kādācitkasyaiva nimittāntarasya siddheḥ /
analyzed: na apaḥ indriya vat asyāḥ siddhiḥ jñāna kāryataḥ kādācitkasya eva nimitta antarasya siddheḥ
translated: Its establishment is not like that of the sense faculties, because the occasional effect of knowledge establishes another cause.

original: yadā piṇḍāntare antarāle vā gobuddherabhāvaṃ darśayet tadā śāvaleyādisakalagopiṇḍānāmevābhāvādabhāvo gobuddherupapadyamānaḥ kathamarthāntaramākṣipet🔽atha gotvādeva gopiṇḍaḥ /🔽anyathā turago 'pi gopiṇḍaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadā piṇḍa antare antarāle vā go buddheḥ abhāvam darśayet tadā śāvaleya ādi sakala go piṇḍānām eva abhāvāt abhāvaḥ go buddheḥ upapadyamānaḥ katham artha antaram ākṣipet  atha go tvāt eva go piṇḍaḥ  anyathā turagaḥ pi go piṇḍaḥ syāt
translated: When it shows the absence of the cognition of a cow in another individual or in between, then the absence of the cognition of a cow is logically possible due to the absence of all cow individuals such as the Shabala cow, etc. How could it imply something else?🔽If the individual of a cow is due to cowness itself,🔽then even a horse would be an individual of a cow.

original: yadyevaṃ gopiṇḍādeva gotvamanyathā turagatvamapi gotvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi evam go piṇḍāt eva go tvam anyathā turaga tvam api go tvam syāt
translated: If it is so, then cowness would be due to the individual of a cow itself, otherwise the cowness of a horse would also be cowness.

analyzed: tasmāt kāraṇa paramparātaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, it is only from the series of causes

original: Nibandh gopiṇḍo gotvaṃ tu bhavatu mā vā /
analyzed: go piṇḍaḥ go tvam tu bhavatu mā vā
translated: Let the universal be the cow-ness, or not be.

original: nanu sāmānyapratyayajananasāmarthyaṃ yadyekasmāt piṇḍādabhinnaṃ tadā vijātīyavyāvṝttaṃ piṇḍāntaramasamartham /
analyzed: nanu sāmānya pratyaya janana sāmarthyam yadi ekasmāt piṇḍāt abhinnam tadā vijātīya vyāvṝttam piṇḍa antaram asamartham
translated: But if the capacity to produce the cognition of the universal is not different from the individual, then the other individual, distinguished from the heterogeneous, is incapable.

analyzed: atha bhinnam
translated: If it is different,

analyzed: tadā tat eva sāmānyam
translated: then that itself is the universal.

analyzed: nāmni param vivādaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is only a dispute over the name,

analyzed: abhinnā eva sā śaktiḥ prativastu
translated: that capacity is indeed undifferentiated for each entity.

original: yathā tvekaḥ śaktasvabhāvo bhāvastathānyo 'pi bhavan kīdṛśaṃ doṣamāvahati /
analyzed: yathā tu ekaḥ śakta svabhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ tathā anyaḥ bhavan kīdṛśam doṣam āvahati
translated: Just as one existent with the nature of capacity, so another existent, what kind of fault does it bring?

analyzed: yathā bhavatām jātiḥ ekā api samāna dhvani prasava hetuḥ
translated: Just as for you, a single universal is the cause of the production of the same sound,

analyzed: anyā api svarūpeṇa eva jāti antara nirapekṣā
translated: another also, independent of another universal by its own nature.

original: tathāsmākaṃ vyaktirapi jātinirapekṣā svarūpeṇaiva bhinnā hetuḥ //
analyzed: tathā asmākam vyaktiḥ api jāti nirapekṣā svarūpeṇa eva bhinnā hetuḥ
translated: In the same way, for us also, an individual, independent of the universal, is a cause distinguished by its own nature alone.

original: yattu trilocanaḥ aśvatvagotvādīnāṃ sāmānyaviśeṣāṇāṃ svāśraye samavāyaḥ sāmānyaṃ sāmānyamityabhidhānapratyayayornimittamiti /
analyzed: yat tu trilocanaḥ aśva tva go tva ādīnām sāmānya viśeṣāṇām svāśraye samavāyaḥ sāmānyam sāmānyam iti abhidhāna pratyayayoḥ nimittam iti
translated: But Trilocana says that the inherence of horse-ness, cow-ness, etc., which are universals and particularities, in their substrata, is the universal of universals, the cause of the designation and cognition as universal of universals.

analyzed: yadi evam vyaktiṣu api ayam eva tathā abhidhāna pratyaya hetuḥ astu
translated: If it is so, let this alone be the cause of such designation and cognition in individuals.

analyzed: kim sāmānya svīkāra pramādena
translated: What is the use of the mistake of accepting a universal?

analyzed: na ca samavāyaḥ saṃbhavī
translated: And inherence is not possible.

analyzed: iha iti buddheḥ samavāya siddhiḥ iha iti dhīḥ ca dvaya darśanena
translated: The establishment of inherence is from the cognition of 'here', and the cognition of 'here' is from the perception of two things.

original: na ca kvacit tadviṣaye tvapekṣā svakalpanāmātramato 'bhyupāyaḥ //
analyzed: na ca kvacid tad viṣaye tu apekṣā sva kalpanā mātram atas bhyupāyaḥ
translated: And nowhere is there dependence on that object. Therefore, the means is merely one's own conception.

original: etena seyaṃ pratyayānuvṛttiranuvṛttavastvanuyāyinī kathamatyantabhedinīṣu vyaktiṣu vyāvṛttaviṣayapratyayabhāvānupātinīṣu bhavitumarhatītyūhāpravartanamasya
analyzed: etena sā iyam pratyaya anuvṛttiḥ anuvṛtta vastu anuyāyinī katham atyanta bhedinīṣu vyaktiṣu vyāvṛtta viṣaya pratyaya bhāva anupātinīṣu bhavitum arhati iti ūha a pravartanam asya
translated: By this, this persistence of cognition is following a persisting entity. How can it be in the case of individuals that are absolutely different, which do not follow the state of cognition with a differentiated object? The non-operation of reasoning in this case

analyzed: pratyākhyātam
translated: is refuted.

analyzed: jātiṣu eva paraspara vyāvṛtta tayā vyaktīyamānāsu anuvṛtta pratyayena vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation in the case of universals themselves, which are appearing as mutually exclusive, by the persistent cognition.

analyzed: yat punar anena viparyaye bādhakam uktam
translated: And what this [Dharmakīrti] has said as the counter-argument in the case of the opposite [of his thesis],

analyzed: abhidhāna pratyaya anuvṛttiḥ kutaścid nivṛttya kvacid eva bhavantī nimittavatī
translated: The persistence of designation and cognition, which occurs only in some places after ceasing from somewhere else, has a cause.

analyzed: na ca anyat nimittam ityādi
translated: And there is no other cause, etc.

analyzed: tat na samyak
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: anuvṛttam antareṇa api abhidhāna pratyaya anuvṛtteḥ a tad rūpa parāvṛtta svarūpa viśeṣāt avaśyam svīkārasya sādhita tvāt tasmāt
translated: Because the persistence of designation and cognition is necessarily accepted due to the specific nature that is the exclusion of that [non-universal] form, even without persistence. Therefore,

original: tulye bhede yayā jātiḥ pratyāsattyā prasarpati /
analyzed: tulye bhede yayā jātiḥ pratyāsattyā prasarpati
translated: By what proximity the universal pervades the individual, even when there is difference,

original: kvacinnānyatra saivāstu śabdajñānanibandhanam //🔽yat punaratra nyāyabhūṣaṇoktaṃ na hyevaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kvacid nā anyatra sā evā astu śabda jñāna nibandhanam  yat punar atra nyāyabhūṣaṇa uktam na hi evam bhavati
translated: When a universal inheres in a particular by a certain relation, and inheres in one particular and not in another, let that very relation be the basis of the use of words and cognition.🔽What is the use of postulating a universal?

original: yayā pratyāsattyā daṇḍasūtrādikaṃ prasarpati kvacinnānyatra saiva pratyāsattiḥ puruṣasphaṭikādiṣu daṇḍisūtritvādivyavahāranibandhanamastu /
analyzed: yayā pratyāsattyā daṇḍa sūtra ādikam prasarpati kvacid na anyatra sā eva pratyāsattiḥ puruṣa sphaṭika ādiṣu daṇḍi sūtri tva ādi vyavahāra nibandhanam astu
translated: The Nyāyabhūṣaṇa has argued as follows: “It is not true that the relation by virtue of which the stick inheres in the man and not in the cloth, is the basis of the use of the word and the idea of ‘the man with the stick’;—the same relation may be the basis of the use of the word and the idea of ‘the man with the stick’ in regard to the man and the crystal, etc. also.

analyzed: kim daṇḍa sūtra ādinā iti
translated: Why should it be the stick alone that is the basis?”

analyzed: tat asaṅgatam
translated: This argument of his is irrelevant.

original: daṇḍasūtrayorhi puruṣasphaṭikapratyāsannayoḥ dṛṣṭayo daṇḍisūtritva pratyayahetutvaṃ nāpalapyate /
analyzed: daṇḍa sūtrayoḥ hi puruṣa sphaṭika pratyāsannayoḥ dṛṣṭayaḥ daṇḍi sūtri tva pratyaya hetu tvam na apalapyate
translated: In the case of the stick and the crystal, when they are in contact with the man, the fact that they are the basis of the idea of ‘the man with the stick’ is not denied.

analyzed: sāmānyam tu svapne na dṛṣṭam
translated: As regards the Universal, it is not seen even in a dream.

original: tad yadīdaṃ parikalpanīyaṃ tadā varaṃ pratyāsattireva sāmānyapratyayahetuḥ parikalpyatām /🔽kiṃ gurvyā parikalpanayetyabhiprāyāparijñānāt /
analyzed: tat yadi idam parikalpanīyam tadā varam pratyāsattiḥ eva sāmānya pratyaya hetuḥ parikalpyatām  kim gurvyā parikalpanayā iti abhiprāya aparijñānāt
translated: If it is to be assumed, then it is far better to assume the relation itself as the basis of the idea of the Universal;

analyzed: nibandh
translated: what is the use of assuming anything else?”—This is what he means. But he does not understand the real purport of the other party.🔽The relation of inherence is not the basis of the idea of the universal ‘cow’ in regard to the variegated cow, etc.;

analyzed: atha idam jāti prasādhakam anumānam abhidhīyate
translated: Now, the following argument is put forward in proof of the Universal:

analyzed: yad viśiṣṭa jñānam tad viśeṣaṇa grahaṇa nāntarīyakam
translated: “That cognition which appears in a particular form must have its basis in something that partakes of the same nature;

analyzed: yathā daṇḍi jñānam
translated: Like the cognition of a stick-holder.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñānam ca idam gauḥ ayam iti arthataḥ kārya hetuḥ
translated: And this cognition of a qualified object, this is a cow, is a causal inference in meaning.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa anubhava kāryam hi dṛṣṭānte viśiṣṭa buddhiḥ siddhā iti
translated: For in the example, the cognition of a qualified object is established as the effect of the experience of the qualifier.

analyzed: atra anuyogaḥ
translated: Here is the application.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa buddheḥ bhinna viśeṣaṇa grahaṇa nāntarīyaka tvam vā sādhyam viśeṣaṇa mātra anubhava nāntarīyaka tvam vā
translated: Either the inseparability of the cognition of a qualified object from the apprehension of a different qualifier is to be proven, or the inseparability from the mere experience of the qualifier.

analyzed: prathama pakṣe pakṣasya pratyakṣa bādhā sādhana avadhānam anavakāśayati
translated: In the first case, the subject is contradicted by perception, and the attention to the proof is not possible.

analyzed: vastu grāhiṇaḥ pratyakṣasya ubhaya pratibhāsa abhāvāt
translated: Because perception, which grasps the real object, does not appear as both [qualifier and qualified].

analyzed: viśiṣṭa buddhi tvam ca sāmānya hetuḥ anaikāntikaḥ
translated: And the reason being a cognition of a qualified object is inconclusive.

analyzed: bhinna viśeṣaṇa grahaṇam antareṇa api darśanāt
translated: Because it is seen even without the apprehension of a different qualifier.

analyzed: yathā svarūpavān ghaṭaḥ
translated: For example, the pot has its own nature.

analyzed: go tvam sāmānyam iti vā
translated: Or cow-ness is a universal.

analyzed: dvitīya pakṣe tu siddha sādhanam
translated: But in the second case, the proof is established.

original: svarūpavān ghaṭa ityādivat gotvajātimān piṇḍa iti parikalpitaṃ bhedamupādāya viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvasyeṣṭatvādagovyāvṛttānubhavabhāvitvād gaurayamiti 🔽vyavahārasya /
analyzed: sva rūpavān ghaṭaḥ ityādi vat go tva jātimān piṇḍaḥ iti parikalpitam bhedam upādāya viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvasya iṣṭatvāt a go vyāvṛtta anubhava bhāvi tvāt gauḥ ayam iti 🔽vyavahārasya
translated: Because the relation of qualifier and qualified is accepted based on the imagined difference, as in the pot has its own nature, etc., and because the usage this is a cow is produced by the experience of what is excluded from non-cows.

analyzed: tat evam na sāmānya siddhiḥ
translated: Thus, there is no establishment of universals.

original: bādhakaṃ ca sāmānyaguṇakarmādyupādhicakrasya kevalavyaktigrāhakaṃ paṭupratyakṣaṃ dṛśyānupalambho vā prasiddhaḥ /
analyzed: bādhakam ca sāmānya guṇa karma ādi upādhi cakrasya kevala vyakti grāhakam paṭu pratyakṣam dṛśya anupalambhaḥ vā prasiddhaḥ
translated: And the well-known means of refuting the circle of limiting adjuncts such as universal, quality, action, etc. is either the keen perception that apprehends only the individual, or non-apprehension of the visible.

analyzed: tat evam vidhiḥ eva śabda arthaḥ
translated: Thus, the meaning of a word is only an injunction.

analyzed: sa ca bāhyaḥ rthaḥ buddhi ākāraḥ ca vivakṣitaḥ
translated: And that is intended to be either an external object or the form of cognition.

original: tatra na buddhyākārasya tattvataḥ saṃvṛtyā vā vidhiniṣedhau /
analyzed: tatra na buddhi ākārasya tattvataḥ saṃvṛtyāḥ vā vidhi niṣedhau
translated: Among them, there is neither affirmation nor negation of the form of cognition, either in reality or conventionally.

analyzed: sva saṃvedana pratyakṣa gamya tvāt
translated: Because it is known by self-cognition perception.

analyzed: anadhyavasāyāt ca
translated: And because it is not ascertained.

analyzed: nā api tattvataḥ bāhyasya api vidhi niṣedhau
translated: Nor is there affirmation or negation of the external object in reality.

analyzed: tasya śābde pratyaye pratibhāsanāt
translated: Because it appears in verbal cognition.

analyzed: atas eva sarva dharmāṇām tattvataḥ na abhilāpya tvam pratibhāsa adhyavasāya abhāvāt
translated: For this very reason, all dharmas are truly inexpressible, because of the absence of appearance and ascertainment.

analyzed: tasmāt bāhyasya eva sāṃvṛtau vidhi niṣedhau
translated: Therefore, affirmation and negation are only conventional regarding the external object.

analyzed: anyathā saṃvyavahāra hāni prasaṅgāt tat evam
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the loss of conventional usage. Thus,

analyzed: na ākārasya na bāhyasya tattvataḥ vidhi sādhanam
translated: the form is not the means of affirming the external object in reality.

original: bahireva hi saṃvṛtyā saṃvṛtyāpi tu nākṛteḥ //
analyzed: bahis eva hi saṃvṛtyā saṃvṛtya api tu na ākṛteḥ
translated: But only the external object is the means of affirmation conventionally, and even conventionally, not the form.

original: etena yad dharmottaraḥ āropitasya bāhyatvasya vidhiniṣedhāvityalaukikamanāgamamatārkikīyaṃ kathayati /
analyzed: etena yat dharma uttaraḥ āropitasya bāhya tvasya vidhi niṣedhau iti alaukikam anāgamam atārkikī iyam kathayati
translated: By this, Dharmakīrti's statement that injunctions and prohibitions apply to external objects superimposed by conceptual cognition, which is non-worldly, non-scriptural, and non-logical, is also refuted.

analyzed: tat api apahastitam
translated: That too is rejected.

original: nanvavyavasāye yadyadhyavaseyaṃ vastu na sphurati tadā tadadhyavasitamiti ko 'rthaḥ /
analyzed: nanu avyavasāye yadi adhyavaseyam vastu na sphurati tadā tat adhyavasitam iti kaḥ rthaḥ

analyzed: apratibhāse pi pravṛtti viṣayīkṛtam iti yaḥ rthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is made the object of engagement even though it does not appear.

original: apratibhāsāviśeṣe viṣayāntaraparihāreṇa kathaṃ niyataviṣayā pravṛttiriti cet /
analyzed: apratibhāsa aviśeṣe viṣaya antara parihāreṇa katham niyata viṣayā pravṛttiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked how engagement with a determined object is possible when there is no difference in non-appearance,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

translated: Even though the entire universe is not grasped, still, because conceptual cognition is produced by a determined set of conditions, it has a determined form.

analyzed: niyata śakti tvāt niyatā eva jala ādau pravṛttiḥ
translated: And because it has a determined power, engagement is determined only in water and so on.

analyzed: dhūmasya parokṣa agni jñāna janana vat  nibandh
translated: Like smoke generating the knowledge of a hidden fire.

original: niyataviṣayā hi bhāvāḥ pramāṇapariniṣṭhitasvabhāvā na śaktisāṃkaryaparyanuyogabhājaḥ /
analyzed: niyata viṣayāḥ hi bhāvāḥ pramāṇa pariniṣṭhita svabhāvāḥ na śakti sāṃkarya paryanuyoga bhājaḥ
translated: For things with determined objects, whose nature is established by valid cognition, do not fall under the scrutiny of the mixing of powers.

analyzed: tasmāt tad adhyavasāyi tvam ākāra viśeṣa yogāt tad pravṛtti janaka tvam
translated: Therefore, because of the connection with a particular form, there is the production of engagement in that [object] due to the ascertainment of that [object].

analyzed: na ca sādṛśyāt āropeṇa pravṛttim brūmaḥ
translated: And we do not say that activity is due to superimposition through similarity.

original: yenākāre bāhyasya bāhye vā ākārasyāropadvāreṇa dūṣaṇābakāśaḥ /
analyzed: yena ākāre bāhyasya bāhye vā ākārasya āropa dvāreṇa dūṣaṇa abakāśaḥ
translated: By which, whether in the external form or in the external, there is scope for refutation through the door of superimposition.

original: kiṃ tarhi svavāsanāvipākavaśādupajāyamānaiva buddhirapaśyantyapi bāhyaṃ bāhye pravṛttimātanotīti viplutaiva /
analyzed: kim tarhi sva vāsanā vipāka vaśāt upajāyamānā eva buddhiḥ apaśyantī api bāhyam bāhye pravṛttim ātanoti iti viplutā eva
translated: What then? The cognition, which arises only by the power of the ripening of its own latent impressions, even though not seeing the external, produces activity towards the external. Thus it is deluded.

analyzed: tat evam anya abhāva viśiṣṭaḥ vijāti vyāvṛttaḥ rthaḥ vidhiḥ
translated: Thus, the object qualified by the absence of others, distinguished from other species, is the affirmation.

original: sa eva cāpohaśabdavācyaḥ śabdānāmarthaḥ pravṛttinivṛttiviṣayaśceti sthitam /
analyzed: saḥ eva ca apoha śabda vācyaḥ śabdānām arthaḥ pravṛtti nivṛtti viṣayaḥ ca iti sthitam
translated: And that alone is the meaning of words denoting apoha, and the object of engagement and disengagement of words, thus it is established.

analyzed: atra prayogaḥ  yat vācakam tat sarvam adhyavasita a tad rūpa parāvṛta vastu mātra gocaram
translated: Here is the argument:

analyzed: yathā iha kūpe jalam iti vacanam
translated: Whatever is expressive has as its domain only the thing that is determined as excluded from that form, like the statement water in this well.

analyzed: vācakam ca idam gavādi śabda rūpam iti svabhāva hetuḥ
translated: And this form of words such as cow is expressive. Thus it is an inference based on identity.

analyzed: na ayam asiddhaḥ
translated: This is not unestablished.

analyzed: pūrva uktena nyāyena pāramārthika vācya vācaka bhāvasya abhāve pi adhyavasāya kṛtasya eva sarva vyavahāribhiḥ avaśyam svīkarttavya tvāt
translated: By the previously stated reasoning, even though the ultimately real relation of expressed and expresser does not exist, it must be necessarily accepted by all practical people only because of the determination.

analyzed: anyathā sarva vyavahāra uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the consequence of the cessation of all practical usage.

analyzed: na api viruddhaḥ

analyzed: sapakṣe bhāvāt

analyzed: na ca anaikāntikaḥ  tathā hi śabdānām adhyavasita vijāti vyāvṛtta vastu mātra viṣaya tvam an icchadbhiḥ paraiḥ
translated: And it is not inconclusive.🔽Thus, those who do not wish for words to have as their object merely a thing that is excluded from other similar classes,

original: vācyaṃ svalakṣaṇamupādhirupādhiyogaḥ sopādhirastu yadi vā kṛtirastu buddhaḥ /🔽gatyantarābhāvāt /
analyzed: vācyam sva lakṣaṇam upādhiḥ upādhi yogaḥ sa upādhiḥ astu yadi vā kṛtiḥ astu buddhaḥ  gati antara abhāvāt
translated: either the real object, the individual characteristic, or the property, the connection with the property, or the activity, must be accepted as the meaning, because there is no other way.

analyzed: aviṣaya tve ca vācaka tva ayogāt
translated: And because if they were not objects, they could not be denotative.

original: tatra ādyantayorna samayaḥ phalaśaktihānermadhye 'pyupādhivirahāt tritayena yuktaḥ //
analyzed: tatra ādi antayoḥ na samayaḥ phala śakti hāneḥ madhye pi upādhi virahāt tritayena yuktaḥ
translated: And there is no convention at the beginning or end, because the power of the result is lost, and even in the middle, because of the absence of the property. It is proper with the three.

original: tadevaṃ vācyāntarasyābhāvāt viṣayavattvalakṣaṇasya vyāpakasya nivṛttau vipakṣato nivarttamānaṃ vācakatvamadhyavasitabāhyaviṣayatvena vyāpyata
analyzed: tat evam vācya antarasya abhāvāt viṣayavat tva lakṣaṇasya vyāpakasya nivṛttau vipakṣataḥ nivarttamānam vācaka tvam adhyavasita bāhya viṣaya tvena vyāpyata

analyzed: iti vyāpti siddhiḥ
translated: Thus, the establishment of the pervasion.

analyzed: tam apoha prakaraṇam samāptam
translated: The chapter on the exclusion of that, composed by the great scholar Ratnakīrti, is complete.
The treatise...🔽The proof of momentariness.
In the form of concomitance.

analyzed: ṃamaḥ tārāyai

analyzed: ākṣipta vyatirekā yā vyāptiḥ anvaya rūpiṇī
translated: The pervasion that implies the excluded, which is in the form of concomitance,

analyzed: yat sat tat kṣaṇikam

analyzed: yathā ghaṭaḥ

And the things under dispute are existent.

analyzed: hetvābhāsāḥ ca aśiddha viruddha anaikāntika prabhedena trividhāḥ

analyzed: tatra na tāvat ayam asiddhaḥ hetuḥ

analyzed: utpāda vyaya dhrauvya yogi tvam

being an object of valid cognition, being the domain of the valid cognition that perceives it,

analyzed: vyapadeśa viṣaya tvam ityādi

analyzed: kevalam tat etat arthakriyā kāri tvam sarva jana prasiddham āste tat khalu atra sattva śabdena abhisandhāya sādhana tvena upāttam  tat ca yathāyogam pratyakṣa anumāna pramāṇa prasiddha sadbhāveṣu bhāveṣu pakṣi kṛteṣu pratyakṣa ādinā pramāṇena pratītam iti na svarūpeṇa āśraya dvāreṇa

analyzed: bā asiddhi saṃbhāvanā api

analyzed: tathātvena aniścayāt

analyzed: nā api sattva anumānataḥ

analyzed: punar nidarśana antara apekṣāyām anavasthāna prasaṅgāt

analyzed: na ca anyat anumānam asti

translated: If it were possible, then the momentariness would be established in the subject by that itself, so there is no need for an inference of existence. If this is argued,

analyzed: anyām vā

translated: Or it does not perform any action at all. These are the three alternatives.

analyzed: na atra prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: The first alternative is not appropriate here.

analyzed: kṛtasya karaṇa ayogāt
translated: Because what is done cannot be done again.

analyzed: atha dvitīyaḥ bhyupagamyate
translated: If the second alternative is accepted,

analyzed: yadi śaktaḥ tadā vartamāna kṣaṇa bhāvi kārya vat atīta anāgata kṣaṇa bhāvi api kāryam tadā eva kuryāt

analyzed: tatra api śakta tvāt

analyzed: śaktasya ca kṣepa ayogāt
translated: And because what is able cannot be delayed.

analyzed: anyathā kāryasya akaraṇa prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the absurd consequence that it does not perform its function in the present moment either.

analyzed: pūrva apara kālayoḥ api śakta tvena aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference in being able to produce at both earlier and later times.

analyzed: samarthasya ca sahakāri apekṣāyāḥ ayogāt
translated: And because it is not proper for something that is able to produce to require cooperating causes.

analyzed: atha a śaktaḥ
translated: If, on the other hand, it is unable,

analyzed: na api tṛtīyaḥ pakṣaḥ saṅgacchate
translated: Nor is the third alternative tenable.

analyzed: śakta svabhāva anuvṛtteḥ eva
translated: Because of the persistence of the nature of being able to produce.

analyzed: anyathā vārtamānikasya api kāryasya akaraṇam syāt iti uktam

analyzed: akurvat ca na janana vyavahāra bhājanam

analyzed: yathā antyā kāraṇa sāmagrī sva kāryam

analyzed: atīta anāgata kṣaṇa bhāvi kārya janana vyavahāra yogyaḥ ca ayam ghaṭaḥ vartamāna kṣaṇa bhāvi kārya karaṇa kāle sakala kriyā atikrama kāle pi iti svabhāva hetu prasaṅgaḥ  asya ca dvitīya ādi kṣaṇa bhāvi kārya karaṇa vyavahāra gocara tvasya prasaṅga sādhanasya vārtamānika kārya karaṇa kāle

translated: then by that very [fact] it follows that the previous ones do not exist, so the potentiality of even one thing is not established.

original: nanu kāryatvasattvayorbhinnavyāvṛttikatvāt sattāsiddhāvapi kāryatvasiddhau kā kṣatiriti cet /
analyzed: nanu kāryatva sattvayoḥ bhinna vyāvṛttika tvāt sattā siddhau api kāryatva siddhau kā kṣatiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that since the fact of being an effect and the fact of being a real entity have different exclusions, what harm is there in establishing existence even if the fact of being an effect is established?

analyzed: tat asaṅgatam
translated: That is irrelevant.

analyzed: sati api kārya tva sattvayoḥ vyāvṛtti bhede sattā siddho kutas kārya tva siddhiḥ
translated: Even though the fact of being an effect and the fact of being a real entity have different exclusions, how is the establishment of the fact of being an effect from the establishment of existence?

analyzed: kārya tvam hi a bhūtvā abhāvi tvam
translated: For the fact of being an effect is the state of having existed after not existing.

analyzed: bhavanam ca sattā
translated: And existence is being.

analyzed: sattā ca saugatānām sāmarthyam eva
translated: And existence is just the capacity of the Buddhists.

analyzed: tatas ca sāmarthya sandehe bhavati iti eva vaktum aśakyam
translated: And therefore, when capacity is doubtful, it is impossible to say it exists.

analyzed: katham a bhūtvā abhāvi tvam kārya tvam setsyati
translated: How will the property of being an effect, which is to be produced after not having existed, be established?

analyzed: apekṣita para vyāpāra tvam kārya tvam iti api na asataḥ dharmaḥ
translated: And the property of being dependent on another's operation is also not a property of what does not exist.

analyzed: sattvam ca sāmarthyam
translated: And existence is capacity.

analyzed: tat ca sandigdham iti kutas kārya tva siddhiḥ
translated: And that is doubtful. So how can the establishment of being an effect be known?

original: tadasiddhau pūrvasya sāmarthyaṃ na sidhyatīti sandigdhāsiddho hetuḥ //
analyzed: tad asiddhau pūrvasya sāmarthyam na sidhyati iti sandigdha asiddhaḥ hetuḥ
translated: When that is not established, the capacity of the prior [moment] is not established. Therefore the reason is inconclusive.

analyzed: tathā viruddhaḥ pi ayam
translated: Similarly, this [reason] is contradictory.

original: tathā hi kṣaṇikatve sati na tāvadajātasyānanvayaniruddhasya vā kāryārambhakatvaṃ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi kṣaṇika tve sati na tāvat ajātasya ananvaya niruddhasya vā kārya ārambhaka tvam saṃbhavati
translated: For thus, if [a thing] is momentary, it cannot be the producer of an effect either before it is born or after it has ceased.

original: na ca niṣpannasya tāvān kṣaṇo 'sti yamupādāya kasmaicit kāryāya vyāpāryeti /
analyzed: na ca niṣpannasya tāvān kṣaṇaḥ asti yam upādāya kasmaicid kāryāya vyāpārya iti
translated: And for what has been produced, there is not that much time, relying on which it could be operated for any effect.

analyzed: atas kṣaṇika pakṣe eva artha kriyā anupapatteḥ viruddha tā
translated: Therefore, because the performance of an effect is not possible just on the side of momentariness, [the reason] is contradictory.

original: atha vā vikalpena yadupanīyate tat sarvamavastu /
analyzed: atha vā vikalpena yat upanīyate tat sarvam avastu
translated: Or else, whatever is brought up by conceptual construction, all that is unreal.

analyzed: tatas ca yaḥ tu ātmake kṣaṇikatve sādhye vastu upasthāpayan anumāna vikalpaḥ viruddhaḥ
translated: And therefore, when momentariness is to be established in the self, the inferential concept that posits a non-entity is contradictory.

original: yadvā sarvasyaiva hetoḥ kṣaṇikatve sādhye viruddhatvaṃ deśakālāntarānanugame sādhyasādhanabhāvābhāvāt /
analyzed: yat vā sarvasya eva hetoḥ kṣaṇika tve sādhye viruddha tvam deśa kāla antara ananugame sādhya sādhana bhāva abhāvāt
translated: Or, for all reasons, when momentariness is to be established, there is contradiction, because the relation of probandum and probans does not exist when there is no extension in space and time.

original: anugame ca nānākālamekamakṣaṇikaṃ kṣaṇikatvena virudhyata iti //
analyzed: anugame ca nānā kālam ekam akṣaṇikam kṣaṇika tvena virudhyate iti
translated: And when there is extension, the non-momentary, which is of many times, is contradicted by momentariness.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: Bondage

analyzed: anaikāntikaḥ pi ayam
translated: This is also inconclusive.

analyzed: sattva sthairyayoḥ virodha abhāvāt iti
translated: Because there is no contradiction between existence and stability.

original: atrocyate / yattāvaduktaṃ sāmarthyaṃ na pratīyata iti /
analyzed: atra ucyate yat tāvat uktam sāmarthyam na pratīyate iti
translated: To this it is said. What was said first, that capability is not cognized,

analyzed: tat kim sarvathā eva na pratīyate
translated: is that not cognized at all?

analyzed: kṣaṇabhaṅga pakṣe vā
translated: Or, in the case of momentariness?

analyzed: prathama pakṣe sakala kāraka jñāpaka hetu cakra ucchedāt mukha spandana mātrasya api akaraṇa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: In the first case, there would be the undesirable consequence of the cessation of the entire cycle of causes that produce effects, and even the mere movement of the mouth would not be possible.

original: anyathā yenaiva vacanena sāmarthyaṃ nāstīti pratipādyate tasyaiva tatpratipādanasāmarthyamavyāhatamāyātam /
analyzed: anyathā yena eva vacanena sāmarthyam na asti iti pratipādyate tasya eva tad pratipādana sāmarthyam avyāhatam āyātam
translated: Otherwise, by the very statement that there is no capability, the capability of that [statement] to convey that [meaning] would be unobstructed.

analyzed: tasmāt parama puruṣa artha samīhayā vastu tattva nirūpaṇa pravṛttasya śakti svīkāra pūrvikā eva pravṛttiḥ
translated: Therefore, one who is engaged in determining the truth of reality with the desire for the highest human goal, his engagement is preceded by the acceptance of potency.

original: tadasvīkāre tu na kaścit kvacit pravarteteti nirīhaṃ jagajjāyeta /
analyzed: tad asvīkāre tu na kaścid kvacid pravarteta iti nirīham jagat jāyeta
translated: If that is not accepted, no one would engage in anything anywhere, so the world would arise without any activity.

analyzed: atha dvitīyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: Now, if the second alternative is accepted,

analyzed: tadā asti tāvat sāmarthya pratītiḥ
translated: then the cognition of potency exists to some extent.

original: sā ca kṣaṇikatve yadi nopapadyate tadā viruddhaṃ vaktumucitam /
analyzed: sā ca kṣaṇika tve yadi na upapadyate tadā viruddham vaktum ucitam
translated: And if that is not possible in the case of momentariness, then it is proper to state what is contradictory.

analyzed: asiddham iti tu nyāya bhūṣaṇīyaḥ pāpaḥ vilāpaḥ
translated: But the lament that it is unestablished is a sinful ornament of logic.

analyzed: na ca sati api kṣaṇika tve sāmarthya pratīti vyāghātaḥ
translated: And even if momentariness exists, there is no contradiction in the cognition of potency.

original: tathā hi kāraṇagrāhijñānopādeyabhūtena kāryagrāhiṇā jñānena tadarpitasaṃskāragarbheṇa asya bhāve asya bhāva ityanvayaniścayo janyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kāraṇa grāhi jñāna upādeya bhūtena kārya grāhiṇā jñānena tad arpita saṃskāra garbheṇa asya bhāve asya bhāvaḥ iti anvaya niścayaḥ janyate
translated: This is how it is: by the cognition apprehending the effect, which is to be accepted by the cognition apprehending the cause, and which contains the impressions deposited by that [cause], the ascertainment of the form when this exists, that exists is produced.

original: tathā kāraṇāpekṣayā bhūtalakaivalyagrāhijñānopādeyabhūtena kāryāpekṣayā bhūtalakaivalyagrāhiṇā jñānena tadarpitasaṃskāragarbheṇa asyābhāve
analyzed: tathā kāraṇa apekṣayā bhū tala kaivalya grāhi jñāna upādeya bhūtena kārya apekṣayā bhū tala kaivalya grāhiṇā jñānena tad arpita saṃskāra garbheṇa asya abhāve
translated: Similarly, by the cognition apprehending the mere ground in relation to the cause, which is to be accepted by the cognition apprehending the mere ground in relation to the effect, and which contains the impressions deposited by that [cause], the ascertainment of the form when this does not exist,

analyzed: asya abhāvaḥ iti vyatireka niścayaḥ janyate
translated: that does not exist is produced.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ  eka avasāya samanantara jātam anya vijñānam anvaya vimarśam upādadhāti
translated: As the teachers say:🔽The other cognition that arises immediately after the ascertainment of one thing presents the reflection of the other thing.

analyzed: evam tad eka viraha anubhava udbhava anya vyāvṛtti dhīḥ prathayati vyatireka buddhim
translated: Thus, the cognition of the exclusion of one thing arising from the experience of the absence of the other thing manifests the cognition of the exclusion.

analyzed: evam sati gṛhīta anusandhāyakaḥ eva ayam vikalpaḥ
translated: In this case, this conceptual cognition is only a recollector of what is grasped.

analyzed: upādāna upādeya bhūta krami pratyakṣa dvaya gṛhīta anusandhānāt
translated: Because it recollects what is grasped by the two successive perceptions that are the substratum and the superstratum.

analyzed: yat āha alaṅkāraḥ
translated: As Alaṅkāra says:

analyzed: yadi nāma ekam adhyakṣam na pūrva apara vittimat
translated: If the one perception does not know the prior and posterior,

analyzed: adhyakṣa dvaya sadbhāve prāc parāvedanam katham iti
translated: how can there be the knowledge of the prior and posterior when there are two perceptions?

analyzed: na api dvitīyaḥ siddha prabhedaḥ
translated: Nor is the second one, the division based on the unestablished, true.

analyzed: sāmarthyam hi sattvam iti saugatānām sthitiḥ eṣā
translated: For the Buddhists, existence is indeed potentiality, this is their position.

analyzed: na ca etad prasādhana artham asmākam idānīm eva prārambhaḥ
translated: And this is not our beginning now for the sake of establishing that.

original: kiṃ tu yatra pramāṇapratītebījādau vastubhūte dharmiṇi pramāṇapratītaṃ sāmarthyaṃ tatra kṣaṇabhaṅgaprasādhanāya /
analyzed: kim tu yatra pramāṇa pratīte bīja ādau vastu bhūte dharmiṇi pramāṇa pratītam sāmarthyam tatra kṣaṇa bhaṅga prasādhanāya
translated: But rather, where the existent thing like the seed etc. is the subject cognized by a means of valid knowledge, and the potentiality cognized by a means of valid knowledge, there for the sake of establishing momentariness.

analyzed: tatas ca aṅkura ādīnām kārya adarśanāt āhatya sāmarthya sandehe pi paṭu pratyakṣa prasiddham asat parāvṛttam sanmātra tvam avāryam eva
translated: And then, because the effect, such as the sprout, is not seen, even if there is doubt about the potency of the seed, the mere existence that is the exclusion of non-being, which is well-known through sharp perception, must be accepted.

analyzed: anyathā aṅkura ādau sattā mātra anabhyupagame pratidarśanam lakṣaṇa bheda praṇayana ayogāt
translated: Otherwise, if the mere existence of the sprout, etc. is not accepted, it would be impossible to posit a different characteristic for each instance.

analyzed: sarvatra sat vyavahāra abhāva prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because the consequence would be the absence of the designation existent in all cases.

analyzed: tasmāt śāstrīya sattva lakṣaṇa sandehe
translated: Therefore, when there is doubt about the definition of existence according to the scriptures,

original: Nibandh 'pi paṭupratyakṣabalāvalambitavastubhāve 'ṅkurādau kāryatvamupalabhyamānaṃ bījādeḥ sāmarthyamupasthāpayatīti nāsiddhidoṣāvakāśaḥ
analyzed: paṭu pratyakṣa bala avalambita vastu bhāve ṅkura ādau kāryatvam upalabhyamānam bīja ādeḥ sāmarthyam upasthāpayati iti na asiddhi doṣa avakāśaḥ
translated: even in the case of a sprout, etc., which is the mere entity supported by the power of sharp perception, the observed effect establishes the potency of the seed, etc., so there is no opportunity for the fault of non-establishment.

analyzed: nā api kṣaṇika tve sāmarthya kṣatiḥ
translated: Nor is there any harm to potency in momentariness.

analyzed: yatas viruddha tā syāt
translated: Because there would be contradiction.

analyzed: kṣaṇikatva niyata prāgbhāvi tva lakṣaṇa kāraṇatvayoḥ virodha abhāvāt sāmarthya saṃbhavāt iti na ādimaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Because there is no contradiction between momentariness and the characteristic of being the prior cause, even an entity that lasts for a moment can have potency, so the first type of contradiction does not exist.

analyzed: nā api dvitīyaḥ virodha prabhedaḥ
translated: Nor is there the second type of contradiction.

original: avastuno vastuno vā svākārasya grāhyatvepi adhyavaseyavastvapekṣayaiva sarvatra prāmāṇyapratipādanād vastusvabhāvasyaiva kṣaṇikatvasya siddhiriti
analyzed: avastunaḥ vastunaḥ vā su ākārasya grāhya tve pi adhyavaseya vastu apekṣayā eva sarvatra prāmāṇya pratipādanāt vastu svabhāvasya eva kṣaṇika tvasya siddhiḥ iti
translated: Even if the form of a non-entity or an entity is grasped, the validity is established everywhere only in relation to the entity to be ascertained, so the nature of an entity, which is momentariness, is established.

analyzed: kva virodhaḥ
translated: So where is the contradiction?

original: yacca gṛhyate yaccādhyavasīyate te dve apyanyanivṛttī na vastunī /
analyzed: yat ca gṛhyate yat ca adhyavasīyate te dve api anya nivṛttī na vastunī
translated: And even if the two, what is grasped and what is ascertained, are not entities in the form of the exclusion of other,

analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa avagāhi tve bhilāpa saṃsarga anupapatteḥ iti ced na
translated: if it is argued that when [the cognition] penetrates the particular characteristic, the connection with verbal expression is not possible, [we say:] no.

analyzed: adhyavasāya svarūpa aparijñānāt  agṛhīte vastuni mānasya ādi pravṛtti kāraka tvam vikalpasya adhyavasāyi tvam
translated: Because the nature of ascertainment is not understood.🔽Even when the entity is not grasped, the option that causes engagement in the desire for example is the ascertainment of the option.

analyzed: apratibhāse pi pravṛtti viṣayīkṛta tvam adhyavaseya tvam
translated: Even when it does not appear, being the object of engagement is the state of being ascertained.

analyzed: etat ca adhyavaseya tvam sva lakṣaṇasya eva yujyate na anyasya
translated: And this state of being ascertained is appropriate only for the particular characteristic, not for anything else.

analyzed: artha kriyā arthi tvāt arthi pravṛtteḥ
translated: Because the engagement of the seeker is for the sake of the function of the object.

analyzed: evam ca adhyavasāye sva lakṣaṇasya asphuraṇam eva
translated: And in this way, the particular characteristic does not appear in the ascertainment.

analyzed: na ca sarvatra aviśeṣeṇa pravṛtti ākṣepa prasaṅgaḥ  pratiniyata sāmagrī prasūtāt
translated: And even if it does not appear, there is no problem of engagement being projected everywhere without distinction.🔽[It is projected] from what is produced by a specific collection of causes.

analyzed: pratiniyata su ākārāt
translated: From what has a specific form of its own.

analyzed: pratiniyata śakti yogāt
translated: Because of the connection with a restricted power.

analyzed: pratiniyate eva a tad rūpa parāvṛtte pratīte pi pravṛtti sāmarthya darśanāt
translated: Even when something that is not of that form and is excluded from that is not cognized, the capacity for activity is seen.

analyzed: yathā sarvasya asattve pi bījāt aṅkurasya eva utpattiḥ
translated: Just as, even when everything is non-existent, a sprout arises only from a seed.

analyzed: dṛṣṭasya niyata hetu phala bhāvasya pratikṣeptum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because it is impossible to reject what is seen to have a definite causal relation.

analyzed: param bāhyena arthena sati pratibandhe prāmāṇyam
translated: The difference is that when there is a connection with an external object, there is validity,

analyzed: anyathā tu aprāmāṇyam iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: but otherwise there is invalidity.

analyzed: tathā tṛtīyaḥ pi pakṣaḥ prayāsa phalaḥ
translated: Similarly, the third position also has the result of effort.

original: nānākālasyaikasya vastuno vastuto 'saṃbhave 'pi sarvadeśakālavartinoratadrūpaparāvṛttayoreva sādhyasādhanayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa vyāptigrahaṇāt /
analyzed: nānā kālasya ekasya vastunaḥ vastutaḥ saṃbhave sarva deśa kāla vartinoḥ a tad rūpa parāvṛttayoḥ eva sādhya sādhanayoḥ pratyakṣeṇa vyāpti grahaṇāt
translated: Even though a single thing existing at different times is not actually possible, the pervasion between the probandum and the probans, which are excluded from what is not of that form and which exist in all places and times, is grasped by perception.

analyzed: dvividhaḥ hi pratyakṣasya viṣayaḥ grāhyaḥ dhyavaseyaḥ ca
translated: For there are two kinds of objects of perception: the grasped and the inferred.

original: sakalātadrūpaparāvṛttaṃ vastumātraṃ sākṣādasphuraṇāt pratyakṣasya grāhyo viṣayo mā bhūt /
analyzed: sakala a tad rūpa parāvṛttam vastu mātram sākṣāt asphuraṇāt pratyakṣasya grāhyaḥ viṣayaḥ mā
translated: Let perception not have as its grasped object the mere thing that is completely excluded from what is not of its form, because it does not directly manifest.

analyzed: tad eka deśa grahaṇe tu tanmātrayoḥ vyāpti niścāyaka vikalpa jananāt adhyavaseyaḥ viṣayaḥ bhavati eva
translated: But when a part of it is grasped, the conceptual cognition that ascertains the pervasion of just that arises, so the inferred object does exist.
