analyzed: kṣaṇa grahaṇe santāna niścaya vat
translated: As in the case of the ascertainment of a continuum in the apprehension of a moment.

analyzed: rūpa mātra grahaṇe rūpa rasa gandha sparśa ātmaka ghaṭa niścaya vat ca
translated: And as in the case of the ascertainment of a pot consisting of form, taste, smell, and touch in the apprehension of form alone.

analyzed: anyathā sarva anumāna uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of all inference.

analyzed: tathā hi vyāpti grahaḥ sāmānyayoḥ
translated: This is because the apprehension of pervasion is between universals,

analyzed: viśeṣayoḥ
translated: between particulars,

analyzed: sāmānya viśiṣṭa sva lakṣaṇayoḥ sva lakṣaṇa viśiṣṭa sāmānyayoḥ vā iti vikalpāḥ
translated: between a particular characterized by a universal, or between a universal characterized by a particular. These are the alternatives.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ vikalpaḥ
translated: The first alternative is not correct.

analyzed: sāmānyasya bādhya tvāt
translated: Because a universal is contradicted.

analyzed: abādhya tve pi adṛśya tvāt
translated: Even if it is not contradicted, because it is not perceptible.

analyzed: dṛśya tve pi puruṣa artha anupayogi tayā tasya anumeya tva ayogāt
translated: Even if it is perceptible, because it is not useful for human goals, it is not suitable to be inferred.

analyzed: na api anumitāt sāmānyāt viśeṣa anumānam
translated: Nor is there the inference of a particular from an inferred universal.

analyzed: sāmānya sarvasva lakṣaṇayoḥ vakṣyamāṇa nyāyena pratibandha pratipatteḥ ayogāt
translated: Because, as will be explained later, the relation between a universal and all particulars is not suitable to be known.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: Bondage

analyzed: na api dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second is also not correct.

analyzed: viśeṣasya ananugāmi tvāt
translated: Because a particular is not pervasive.

original: antime tu vikalpadvaye sāmānyādhāratayā dṛṣṭa eva viśeṣaḥ sāmānyasya viśeṣyo viśeṣaṇaṃ vā karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: antime tu vikalpa dvaye sāmānya ādhāra tayā dṛṣṭaḥ eva viśeṣaḥ sāmānyasya viśeṣyaḥ viśeṣaṇam vā karttavyaḥ
translated: But in the last two alternatives, either a particular that is seen as the substratum of a universal should be made the object of the universal or the qualifier of the universal,

analyzed: a dṛṣṭaḥ eva vā deśa kāla antara vartī
translated: or one that exists in a different place or time and is not seen.

analyzed: yat vā dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa ātmakaḥ deśa kāla antar varttya tad rūpa parāvṛttaḥ sarvaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: Or, a particular is that which exists in space and time, and is the exclusion of that which is not it, whether seen or unseen.

analyzed: na prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ nanugāmi tvāt
translated: The first alternative is not correct, because it is not universal.

analyzed: na api dvitīyaḥ
translated: Nor is the second,

analyzed: a dṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: because it is not seen.

analyzed: na ca tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Nor is the third,

analyzed: prastuta eka viśeṣa darśane deśa kāla antara vartinām viśeṣāṇām adarśanāt
translated: because even when one particular is seen, other particulars existing in different places and times are not seen.

analyzed: atha teṣām sarveṣām eva viśeṣāṇām sadṛśa tvāt
translated: If it is argued that all those particulars are similar,

analyzed: sadṛśa sāmagrī prasūta tvāt
translated: because they are produced by a similar assemblage of causes,

original: sadṛśakāryakāritvāditi pratyāsattyā ekaviśeṣagrāhakaṃ pratyakṣamatadrūpaparāvṛttamātre niścayaṃ janayadatadrūpaparāvṛttaviśeṣamātrasya vyavasthāpakam
analyzed: sadṛśa kārya kāri tvāt iti pratyāsattyā eka viśeṣa grāhakam pratyakṣam a tad rūpa parāvṛtta mātre niścayam janayat a tad rūpa parāvṛtta viśeṣa mātrasya vyavasthāpakam
translated: and because they perform similar effects, then perception, which grasps only one particular through proximity, generates certainty only in the exclusion of that which is not it, and thus establishes the mere particular that is the exclusion of that which is not it.

original: yathaikasāmagrīpratibaddharūpamātragrāhakaṃ pratyakṣaṃṃ ghaṭe niścayaṃ janayad ghaṭagrāhakaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: yathā eka sāmagrī pratibaddha rūpa mātra grāhakam pratyakṣam ghaṭe niścayam janayat ghaṭa grāhakam vyavasthāpyate
translated: Just as perception, which grasps only the form that is bound to a single assemblage of causes, generates certainty in the pot and is thus established as the grasper of the pot.

original: anyathā ghaṭo 'pi ghaṭasantāno 'pi pratyakṣato na sidhyate /
analyzed: anyathā ghaṭaḥ pi ghaṭa santānaḥ pi pratyakṣataḥ na sidhyate
translated: Otherwise, even the pot and even the continuum of pots would not be established by perception,

analyzed: sarva ātmanā grahaṇa abhāvāt
translated: because there is no grasping of the whole.

analyzed: tad eka deśa grahaṇam tu a tad rūpa parāvṛtte pi a viśiṣṭam
translated: But the grasping of a part of it is not distinguished even in the exclusion of that which is not it.

original: yadyevamanenaiva krameṇa sarvasya viśeṣasya viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvavat vyāptipratipattirapyastu /
analyzed: yadi evam anena eva krameṇa sarvasya viśeṣasya viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva vat vyāpti pratipattiḥ api astu
translated: If this is so, let the cognition of the pervasion of all particularities by the relation of qualifier and qualified occur in the same order.

original: tat kimarthaṃ nānākālamekamakṣaṇikamabhyupagantavyaṃ yena kṣaṇikatva sādhanasya viruddhatvaṃ syāditi na kaścidvirodha prabhedaprasaṅgaḥ //
analyzed: tat kimartham nānākālam ekam akṣaṇikam abhyupagantavyam yena kṣaṇikatva sādhanasya viruddha tvam syāt iti na kaścid virodha prabheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Then, for what purpose should one accept a single non-momentary thing as existing at different times, by which the proof of momentariness would be contradictory? Thus, there is no possibility of contradiction or division.

analyzed: na ca ayam anaikāntikaḥ hetuḥ
translated: And this reason is not inconclusive either.

original: pūrvoktakrameṇa sādharmyadṛṣṭānte prasaṅgaviparyayahetubhyāmanvayarūpavyāpteḥ prasādhanāt /🔽nanu yadi prasaṅgaviparyayahetudvayabalato ghaṭedṛṣṭānte kṣaṇabhaṅgaḥ sidhyet tadā sattvasya niyamena kṣaṇikatvena vyāptisiddheranaikāntikatvaṃ
analyzed: pūrva ukta krameṇa sādharmya dṛṣṭānte prasaṅga viparyaya hetubhyām anvaya rūpa vyāpteḥ prasādhanāt  nanu yadi prasaṅga viparyaya hetu dvaya balataḥ ghaṭa idṛṣṭānte kṣaṇabhaṅgaḥ sidhyet tadā sattvasya niyamena kṣaṇika tvena vyāpti siddheḥ anaikāntika tvam
translated: Because in the example of similarity stated earlier, the pervasion in the form of concomitance is established by the reasons of reductio ad absurdum and reversal.

analyzed: nasyāt iti yuktam
translated: If the momentariness of the pot were to be established in the example by the power of the two reasons of reductio ad absurdum and reversal, then it would be correct to say that the reason is not inconclusive because the existence would be established as invariably pervaded by momentariness.

analyzed: kevalam idam eva asambhavi
translated: But this alone is impossible.

original: tathā hi śakto 'pi ghaṭaḥ kramikasahakāryapekṣayā kramikāryaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi śaktaḥ api ghaṭaḥ kramika sahakāri apekṣayā krami kāryam kariṣyati
translated: For thus, even though capable, the pot would produce its effect in succession, depending on the successive auxiliaries.

analyzed: na ca etat vaktavyam
translated: And this should not be said:

analyzed: samarthaḥ rthaḥ sva rūpeṇa karoti
translated: A capable object produces by its own nature.

original: svarūpaṃ ca sarvadāstītyanupakāriṇī sahakāriṇyapekṣā na yujyata iti /
analyzed: sva rūpam ca sarvadā asti iti anupakāriṇī sahakāriṇī apekṣā na yujyate iti
translated: And since the form is always present, it is not reasonable to suppose that it requires auxiliaries which do not help it.

original: satyapi svarūpeṇa kārakatve sāmarthyābhāvāt kathaṃ karotu /🔽sahakārisākalyaṃ hi sāmarthyam /
analyzed: sati api svarūpeṇa kāraka tve sāmarthya abhāvāt katham karotu  sahakāri sākalyam hi sāmarthyam
translated: Even if it is an agent by its own nature, how can it produce, since it is devoid of power?🔽For the presence of the auxiliaries is power,

analyzed: tad vaikalyam ca asāmarthyam
translated: and the absence of the auxiliaries is the absence of power.

original: na ca tayorāvirbhāvatirobhāvābhyāṃ tadvataḥ kācit kṣatiḥ /
analyzed: na ca tayoḥ āvirbhāva tirobhāvābhyām tadvataḥ kācid kṣatiḥ
translated: And the presence or absence of these does not in any way affect that which possesses them,

analyzed: tasya tābhyām anya tvāt  tasmāt arthaḥ samarthaḥ pi syāt
translated: because it is different from them.🔽Therefore, even if the object is powerful,

analyzed: na ca karoti iti sandigdha vyatirekaḥ prasaṅga hetuḥ
translated: it does not produce. Thus the reason is inconclusive because of the absence of the consequence.

analyzed: atrā ucyate bhavatu tāvat sahakāri sākalyam eva sāmarthyam
translated: To this we reply: Let it be that the presence of the auxiliaries is itself power.

original: tathāpi so 'pi tāvad bhāvaḥ svarūpeṇa kārakaḥ /🔽tasya ca yādṛśaścaramakṣaṇe 'kṣepakriyādharmā svabhāvastādṛśa eva cet prathamakṣaṇe tadā tadāpi prasahya kurvāṇo brahmaṇāpyanivāryaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api saḥ pi tāvat bhāvaḥ sva rūpeṇa kārakaḥ  tasya ca yādṛśaḥ carama kṣaṇe kṣepa kriyā dharmā svabhāvaḥ tādṛśaḥ eva ced prathama kṣaṇe tadā tadā api prasahya kurvāṇaḥ brahmaṇā api anivāryaḥ
translated: Even so, that entity is an agent by its own nature.🔽And if its nature is such that it has the property of projecting action in the final moment, and if it is the same in the first moment, then it would produce forcibly even then, and could not be prevented even by Brahman.

original: na ca so 'pyakṣepakriyādharmā svabhāvaḥ sākalye sati jāto bhāvād bhinna evābhidhātuṃ
analyzed: na ca saḥ pi akṣepa kriyā dharmā svabhāvaḥ sākalye sati jātaḥ bhāvāt bhinnaḥ evā abhidhātum
translated: And that nature which has the property of projecting action cannot be said to be different from the entity when the auxiliaries are present.

analyzed: nibandh śakyaḥ
translated: It cannot be bound.

analyzed: bhāvasya akartṛ tva prasaṅgāt
translated: because it would follow that the entity would not be the agent.

analyzed: evam yāvat dharma antara parikalpaḥ tāvat tāvat udāsīnaḥ bhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way, as long as there is the postulation of another entity, the entity remains neutral.

original: tasmād yadrūpamādāya svarūpeṇāpi janayatītyucyate tasya prāgapi bhāve kathamajaniḥ kadācit /
analyzed: tasmāt yat rūpam ādāya sva rūpeṇa api janayati iti ucyate tasya prāk api bhāve katham ajaniḥ kadācid
translated: Therefore, if it is said that it produces even by its own nature, taking that form, how can it ever be unproduced even before?

original: akṣepakriyāpratyanīkasvabhāvasya vā prācyasya paścādanuvṛttau kathaṃ kadācidapi kāryasaṃbhavaḥ //
analyzed: akṣepa kriyā pratyanīka svabhāvasya vā prācyasya paścāt anuvṛttau katham kadācid api kārya saṃbhavaḥ
translated: Or, if the prior nature, which is opposed to the action of projection, continues later, how is the production of the effect possible even at some time?

original: nanu yadi sa evaikaḥ kartā syād yuktametat /
analyzed: nanu yadi saḥ eva ekaḥ kartā syāt yuktam etat
translated: But if it were the only agent, this would be appropriate.

analyzed: kim tu sāmagrī janikā
translated: However, the collection is the producer.

original: tataḥ sahakāryantaravirahavelāyāṃ balīyaso 'pi na kāryaprasava iti kimatra viruddham /
analyzed: tatas sahakāri antara viraha velāyām na kārya prasavaḥ iti kim atra viruddham
translated: Therefore, at the time of the absence of another cooperating factor, even for the powerful one, the production of the effect is not possible. What is contradictory here?

original: na hi bhāvaḥ svarūpeṇa karotīti svarūpeṇaiva karoti /
analyzed: na hi bhāvaḥ sva rūpeṇa karoti iti sva rūpeṇa eva karoti
translated: For an entity does not produce by its own nature. It produces only by its own nature.

analyzed: sahakāri sahitāt eva tatas kārya utpatti darśanāt
translated: Because the production of the effect is seen only from it along with the cooperating factors.

analyzed: tasmāt vyāpti vat kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ pi ekatra anya yoga vyavacchedena anyatra ayoga vyacchedena avaboddhavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, like the pervasion, the relation of cause and effect should be understood in one case by the exclusion of connection with another, and in another case by the exclusion of non-connection.

analyzed: tathā eva laukika parīkṣakāṇām saṃpratipatteḥ iti
translated: Because the agreement of the worldly and the investigators is just like that.

original: atrocyate / yadā militāḥ santaḥ kāryaṃ kurvate tadaikārthakaraṇalakṣaṇaṃ sahakāritvameṣāmastu /
analyzed: atrā ucyate yadā militāḥ santaḥ kāryam kurvate tadā ekārtha karaṇa lakṣaṇam sahakāri tvam eṣām astu
translated: To this we reply: When they come together and perform an action, let them have the quality of cooperation, which is characterized by the performance of a single purpose.

analyzed: kaḥ niṣeddhā
translated: Who can deny that?

original: militaireva tu tat kāryaṃ karttavyamiti kuto labhyate /
analyzed: militaiḥ eva tu tat kāryam karttavyam iti kutas labhyate
translated: But how is it understood that the action must be performed only by those that have come together?

analyzed: pūrva aparayoḥ eka svabhāva tvāt bhāvasya sarvadā janana ajananayoḥ anyatara niyama prasaṅgasya durvāra tvāt
translated: Because it is impossible to avoid the consequence that the entity, being of a single nature in the past and future, would always produce or never produce, as the case may be.

analyzed: tasmāt sāmagrī janikā
translated: Therefore, the collection is the producer.

analyzed: na ekam janakam iti sthira vādinām manorathasya api aviṣayaḥ
translated: Not a single one is the producer. This is also not the object of the wish of those who maintain [the existence of] a permanent [entity].

analyzed: dṛśyate tāvat idam iti ced
translated: If it is said that this is seen,

analyzed: dṛśyatām
translated: let it be seen.

original: kiṃ tu pūrvasthitādeva sāmagrīmadhyapraviṣṭād bhāvāt kāryotpattiranyasmādeva vā viśiṣṭād bhāvādutpannāditi vivādapadam /
analyzed: kim tu pūrva sthitāt eva sāmagrī madhya praviṣṭāt bhāvāt kārya utpattiḥ anyasmāt eva vā viśiṣṭāt bhāvāt utpannāt iti vivāda padam
translated: But whether the effect arises from the entity that existed before and has entered the collection, or from another distinct entity that has arisen, this is a matter of dispute.

original: tatra prāgapi saṃbhave sarvadaiva kāryotpattirna vā kadācidapīti virodhamasamādhāya cakṣuṣī nimīlya tata eva kāryotpattidarśanāditi sādhyānuvādamātrapravṛttaḥ
analyzed: tatra prāk api saṃbhave sarvadā eva kārya utpattiḥ na vā kadācid api iti virodham a samādhāya cakṣuṣī nimīlya tatas eva kārya utpatti darśanāt iti sādhya anuvāda mātra pravṛttaḥ
translated: There, if it were possible even before [the effect arises], then the effect would arise all the time, or never at any time. Without resolving this contradiction, closing the eyes, and proceeding with the mere statement of the conclusion that the effect arises from that [collection] alone because it is seen,

analyzed: kṛpām arhati iti
translated: he deserves compassion.

analyzed: na ca pratyabhijñā ādi balāt eka tva siddhiḥ
translated: And the establishment of oneness by the power of recognition, etc., is not possible.

analyzed: tat pauruṣasya lūna punar jāta keśa nakha ādau api upalambhataḥ nirdalanāt
translated: Because that is refuted even in the case of hair and nails that are cut and grow back again, due to perception.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa bhedasya ca darśayitum aśakya tvāt
translated: And because it is impossible to show a difference in characteristics.

analyzed: sthira siddha dūṣaṇe ca asmābhiḥ prapañcataḥ nirasta tvāt  tasmāt sākṣāt kārya kāraṇa bhāva apekṣayā ubhayatra api anya yoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: And because the establishment of permanence has been refuted by us in detail.🔽Therefore, in both cases, the exclusion of other is based on the direct relation of cause and effect, in terms of the relation of cause and effect.

original: vyāptau tu sākṣāt paramparayā kāraṇamātrāpekṣayā kāraṇe vyāpake 'yogavyavacchedaḥ /
analyzed: vyāptau tu sākṣāt paramparayā kāraṇa mātra apekṣayā kāraṇe vyāpake yoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: But in the case of pervasion, the exclusion of the incompatible is in the pervader, which is the mere cause, directly or indirectly, in terms of the relation to the cause.

analyzed: kārye vyāpye ni ayoga vyavacchedaḥ  tathā tad a tad svabhāve vyāpake yoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: And the exclusion of the incompatible is in the pervaded, which is the effect.🔽Similarly, there is the exclusion of the incompatible in the pervader, which has that and that nature.

analyzed: tad svabhāve ca vyāpye ni ayoga vyavacchedaḥ
translated: And there is the exclusion of other in the pervaded, which has that nature.

analyzed: vikalpa ārūḍha rūpa apekṣayā vyāptau dvividham avadhāraṇam
translated: The twofold determination in the case of pervasion is based on the form superimposed by conceptualization.

original: nanu yadi pūrvāparakālayorekasvabhāvo bhāvaḥ sarvadā janakatvenājanakatvena vā vyāpta upalabdhaḥ syāt /🔽tadāyaṃ prasaṅgaḥ saṃgacchate /
analyzed: nanu yadi pūrva apara kālayoḥ eka svabhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ sarvadā janaka tvena ajanaka tvena vā vyāptaḥ upalabdhaḥ syāt 🔽tadā ayam prasaṅgaḥ saṃgacchate
translated: If an entity has the same nature at earlier and later times and is always pervaded by being a producer or by not being a producer, then this consequence would be appropriate.

analyzed: na ca kṣaṇabhaṅga vādinā pūrva apara kālayoḥ ekaḥ
translated: And for one who asserts momentariness, there is no single [entity] in the earlier and later times.

analyzed: kaścid upalabdhaḥ iti ced
translated: And if it is said that no single connecting link is perceived between past and future moments by one who maintains the doctrine of momentariness,

analyzed: tat etat atigrāmyam
translated: this is a very foolish statement.

original: tathā hi pūrvāparakālayorekasvabhāvatve satītyasyāyamarthaḥ /🔽parakālabhāvī janako yaḥ svabhāvo bhāvasya sa eva yadi pūrvakālabhāvī /
analyzed: tathā hi pūrva apara kālayoḥ eka svabhāva tve sati iti asya ayam arthaḥ  para kāla bhāvī janakaḥ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ bhāvasya saḥ eva yadi pūrva kāla bhāvī
translated: For this is the meaning of the phrase if there were identity of nature between past and future moments:🔽if the very same nature of a thing which exists in the future and produces [its effect] existed in the past,

original: pūrvakālabhāvī vā yo 'janakaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa eva yadi parakālabhāvī tadopalabdhameva jananamajananaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: pūrva kāla bhāvī vā yaḥ janakaḥ svabhāvaḥ saḥ eva yadi para kāla bhāvī tadā upalabdham eva jananam ajananam vā syāt
translated: or if the very same nature which existed in the past and did not produce [its effect] existed in the future, then production or non-production would be perceived [even then].

original: tathā ca sati siddhayoreva svabhāvayorekatvārope siddhameva jananamajananaṃ vāsajyata iti /
analyzed: tathā ca sati siddhayoḥ eva svabhāvayoḥ ekatva ārope siddham eva jananam ajananam vā āsajyate iti
translated: And if that were so, the identity of two established natures would be superimposed, and either production or non-production would be established.

analyzed: nanu kāryam eva sahakāriṇam amekṣate
translated: But surely an effect takes into account a cooperating [cause],

analyzed: na tu kārya utpatti hetuḥ
translated: but not a cause of the production of an effect.

original: yasmād dvividhaṃ sāmarthyaṃ nijamāgantukaṃ na sahakāryantaram /
analyzed: yasmāt dvividham sāmarthyam nijam āgantukam na sahakāri antaram
translated: Because there are two kinds of power, inherent and adventitious, not a further cooperating [cause].

original: tato 'kṣaṇikasyāpi kramavat sahakārinānātvādapi kramavat kāryanānātvopapatteraśakyaṃ bhāvānāṃ pratikṣaṇamanyānyatvamupapādayitumiti cet /
analyzed: kṣaṇikasya api krama vat sahakāri nānātvāt api krama vat kārya nānātva upapatteḥ aśakyam bhāvānām pratikṣaṇam anya anya tvam upapādayitum iti ced
translated: Therefore, even for what is not momentary, the diversity of effects is possible in sequence due to the diversity of cooperating [causes] in sequence, so it is not possible to establish the difference of things in each moment. If this is argued,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

analyzed: bhavatu tāvat nija āgantuka bhedena dvividham sāmarthyam
translated: Let there be, for the present, two kinds of capacity, divided into inherent and adventitious.

analyzed: tathā api yat prātisvikam vastu sva lakṣaṇam artha kriyā dharmakam avaśyam abhyupagantavyam
translated: Even so, that which is the individual specific characteristic of an entity, which must necessarily be accepted as having the property of causal efficiency,

original: tat kiṃ prāgapi paścādeva veti vikalpya yaddūṣaṇamudīritaṃ tatra kimuktamaneneti na pratīmaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim prāk api paścāt eva vā iti vikalpya yat dūṣaṇam udīritam tatra kim uktam anena iti na pratīmaḥ
translated: is that to be accepted as existing before as well as after? Having raised this alternative, the objection that has been raised, we do not understand what is meant by this.

original: yattu kāryeṇaiva sahakāriṇo 'pekṣyanta ityupaskṛtaṃ tadapi nirupayogam /
analyzed: yat tu kāryeṇa eva upekṣyante iti upaskṛtam tat api nirupayogam
translated: And that which has been stated as a supplement, that the auxiliaries are required only along with the effect, that too is useless.

original: yadi hi kāryameva svajanmani svatantraṃ syād yuktametat /
analyzed: yadi hi kāryam eva sva janmani svatantram syāt yuktam etat
translated: For if the effect itself were independent in its own production, this would be appropriate.

analyzed: kevalam evam sati sahakāri sākalya sāmarthya kalpanam aphalam
translated: But in that case alone, the postulation of the capacity of the completeness of auxiliaries is fruitless.

analyzed: svatantrāt eva hi kāryam kādācitkam bhaviṣyati
translated: For the effect will be occasional only from what is independent.

original: tathā ca sati santo hetavaḥ sarvathāsamarthāḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca sati santaḥ hetavaḥ sarvathā asamarthāḥ
translated: And in that case, the existing causes are completely incapable.

analyzed: asat etat kāryam svatantram iti viśuddhā buddhiḥ
translated: This is not correct that the effect is independent. The understanding is pure.

original: atha kāryasyaivāyamaparādho yadidaṃ samarthe kāraṇe satyapi kadācinnopapadyata iti cet /
analyzed: atha kāryasya eva ayam aparādhaḥ yat idam samarthe kāraṇe sati api kadācid nā upapadyate iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this is the fault of the effect itself, that even when the capable cause exists, it sometimes does not occur,

analyzed: na tat tarhi tat kāryam svātantryāt
translated: then it is not the effect of that, because of its independence.

analyzed: yat bhāṣyam
translated: As for the commentary,

original: sarvāvasthāsamāne 'pi kāraṇe yadyakāryatā /🔽svatantraṃ kāryamevaṃ syānna tatkāryaṃ tathā sati //
analyzed: sarva avasthā samāne pi kāraṇe yadi akārya tā  svatantram kāryam evam syāt na tat kāryam tathā sati
translated: If an effect were not to be produced even when the cause is present in all conditions,🔽then the effect would be independent. If that were so,

analyzed: atha na tad bhāve bhavati iti tat kāryam ucyate
translated: If it is said that it is called the effect of that because it does not exist when that does not exist,

analyzed: kiṃtu tad abhāve na bhavati eva iti
translated: but it does not exist even when that does not exist,

analyzed: vyatireka prādhānyāt iti ced na
translated: if it is said that the absence is primary, no (it is not so).

original: yadi hi svayaṃ bhavan bhāvayedeva hetuḥ svakāryam /
analyzed: yadi hi svayam bhavan bhāvayet eva hetuḥ sva kāryam
translated: For if the cause, existing by itself, would produce its own effect,

analyzed: tadā tad abhāva prayuktaḥ sya abhāvaḥ iti pratītiḥ syāt
translated: then there would be the cognition that its absence is due to the absence of that.

original: no ced yathā kāraṇe satyapi kārya svātantryānna bhavati /
analyzed: no ced yathā kāraṇe sati api kārya svātantryāt na bhavati
translated: If not, then just as the effect does not exist even when the cause is present due to its own independence,

original: tathā tadabhāve 'pi svātantryādeva na bhūtamiti śaṅkā kena nivāryeta /
analyzed: tathā tad abhāve pi svātantryāt eva na bhūtam iti śaṅkā kena nivāryeta
translated: in the same way, even when that is absent, it does not exist due to its own independence. By what is this doubt to be warded off?

analyzed: yat bhāṣyam
translated: The commentary says:

analyzed: tad bhāve pi na bhāvaḥ ced abhāve bhāvi tā kutas
translated: If it does not exist even when that exists, how can it be non-existent when absent?

analyzed: tad abhāva prayuktaḥ sya saḥ bhāvaḥ iti tat kutas
translated: How can it be said that its non-existence is due to the absence of that?

original: tasmād yathaiva tadabhāve niyamena na bhavati tathaiva tadbhāve niyamena bhavedeva /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā eva tad abhāve niyamena na bhavati tathā eva tad bhāve niyamena bhavet eva
translated: Therefore, just as it does not exist invariably when that is absent, in the same way it would exist invariably when that exists.

analyzed: abhavat ca na tad kāraṇa tām ātmanaḥ kṣamate
translated: And what does not exist cannot bear the status of being its cause.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: The connection

analyzed: yat ca uktam prathama kārya utpādana kāle hi uttara kārya utpādana svabhāvaḥ
translated: And what was said, that at the time of producing the first effect, it has the nature of producing the subsequent effect,

analyzed: atas prathama kāle eva aśeṣāṇi kāryāṇi kuryāt iti
translated: therefore it would produce all the effects at the very first moment.

analyzed: tat idam mātā me bandhyā ityādi vat sva vacana virodhāt ayuktam
translated: This is unreasonable because it contradicts one's own statement, like saying My mother is barren.

original: yo hi uttarakāryajananasvabhāvaḥ sa kathamādau kāryaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ hi uttara kārya janana svabhāvaḥ sa katham ādau kāryam kuryāt
translated: For how could that which has the nature of producing the subsequent effect produce the first effect at the beginning?

analyzed: na tarhi tad kārya karaṇa svabhāvaḥ
translated: Then it does not have the nature of producing that effect.

analyzed: na hi nīla utpādana svabhāvaḥ pīta ādikam api karoti iti
translated: For that which has the nature of producing the blue does not produce the yellow, etc.

original: atrocyate / sthirasvabhāvatve hi bhāvasyottarakālamevedaṃ kāryaṃ na pūrvakālamiti kuta etat /
analyzed: atrā ucyate sthira svabhāva tve hi bhāvasya uttara kālam eva idam kāryam na pūrva kālam iti kutas etat
translated: To this it is said: If the entity has a stable nature, then how could this effect be only at a later time and not at an earlier time?

analyzed: tad abhāvāt ca kāraṇam api utara kārya karaṇa svabhāvam iti api kutas
translated: And because of that absence, how could the cause also have the nature of producing the subsequent effect?

analyzed: kim kurmaḥ
translated: What can we do?

original: uttarakālameva tasya janmeti cet /🔽astu sthiratve tadanupapadyamānamasthiratāmādiśatu /
analyzed: uttara kālam eva tasya janma iti ced  astu sthira tve tat anupapadyamānam asthira tām ādiśatu
translated: If it is said that its birth is only at a later time,🔽let it be. When that is not possible for a stable [entity], let it declare instability.

original: sthiratve 'pyeṣa eva svabhāvastasya yaduttarakṣaṇa eva karotīti cet /
analyzed: sthira tve pi eṣaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ tasya yat uttara kṣaṇe eva karoti iti ced
translated: If it is said that even in stability, this is precisely its nature, that it produces only in the subsequent moment,

analyzed: hatā idānīm pramāṇa pratyāśā
translated: then the hope for a valid means of knowledge is lost now.

original: dhūmādatrāgnirityatrāpi svabhāva evāsya yadidānīmatra niragnirapi dhūma iti vaktuṃ śakyatvāt /
analyzed: dhūmāt atra agniḥ iti atra api svabhāvaḥ eva asya yat idānīm atra niragniḥ api dhūmaḥ iti vaktum śakya tvāt
translated: Even in the case of 'here there is fire because there is smoke', it is possible to say that smoke is here even when there is no fire, because it is just the nature of smoke.

analyzed: tasmāt pramāṇa prasiddhe svabhāva ālambanam
translated: Therefore, the object of the cognition is the nature that is established by valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: na tu svabhāva avalambanena pramāṇa vyālopaḥ
translated: But it is not that valid means of knowledge are excluded by the object of the cognition being its nature.

analyzed: tasmāt yadi kāraṇasya uttara kārya kāraka tvam abhyupagamya kāryasya prathama kṣaṇa bhāvi tvam āsajyate
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that the cause produces the subsequent effect and then posits that the effect exists in the first moment,

analyzed: syāt sva vacana virodhaḥ
translated: there would be a contradiction with one's own words.

original: yadā tu kāraṇasya sthiratve kāryasyottarakālatvamevāsaṅgatamataḥ kāraṇasyāpyuttarakāryajanakatvaṃ vastuto 'sambhavi tadā prasaṅgasādhanamidam
analyzed: yadā tu kāraṇasya sthira tve kāryasya uttara kāla tvam eva asaṅgatamataḥ kāraṇasya api uttara kārya janaka tvam vastutas sambhavi tadā prasaṅga sādhanam idam
translated: But when the cause is permanent and the subsequent existence of the effect is not tenable, then the production of the subsequent effect by the cause is actually impossible, so this is an argument by reductio ad absurdum.

analyzed: janana vyavahāra gocara tvam hi jananena vyāptam iti prasādhitam
translated: It has been established that the scope of the convention of production is pervaded by production.

original: uttarakāryajananavyavahāragocaratvaṃ ca tvadabhyupagamāt prathamakāryakaraṇakāla eva ghaṭe dharmiṇi siddham /
analyzed: uttara kārya janana vyavahāra gocara tvam ca tvad abhyupagamāt prathama kārya karaṇa kāle eva ghaṭe dharmiṇi siddham
translated: And the scope of the convention of producing the subsequent effect is established in the subject, the pot, at the time of producing the first effect itself, according to your acceptance.

original: atastanmātrānubandhina uttarābhimatasta karyasya prathame kṣaṇe 'saṃbhavā deva prasaṅgaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: atas tad mātra anubandhinaḥ prathame kṣaṇe prasaṅgaḥ kriyate
translated: Therefore, the undesirable consequence is urged that the effect, which is connected only with those [causes], cannot be produced in the first moment.

original: na hi nīlakārake 'pi pītakārakatvārope pītasaṃbhavaprasaṅgaḥ svavacanavirodho nāma /
analyzed: na hi nīla kārake pi pīta kāraka tva ārope pīta saṃbhava prasaṅgaḥ sva vacana virodhaḥ nāma
translated: For, when the cause of blue is superimposed as the cause of yellow, there is no undesirable consequence of the production of yellow, which is a contradiction of one's own words.

analyzed: tat evam śaktaḥ sahakāri an apekṣita tvāt jananena vyāptaḥ
translated: Thus, the capable [cause] is pervaded by production, because it does not depend on cooperating [causes].

analyzed: ajanaryaḥ ca śakta aśakta tva viruddha dharma adhyāsāt bhinnaḥ eva
translated: And the incapable [cause] is indeed different, because it has the contradictory properties of being capable and incapable.

analyzed: nanu bhavatu prasaṅga viparyaya balāt eka kāryam prati śakta aśakta tva lakṣaṇa viruddha dharma adhyāsaḥ
translated: Now, let there be the superimposition of contradictory properties such as being capable and incapable with respect to a single effect by the power of undesirable consequence and its reverse.

analyzed: tathā api na tatas bhedaḥ sidhyati
translated: Even so, difference is not established from that [superimposition].

original: tathā hi bījamaṅkurādikaṃkurvad yadi yenaiva svabhāvenāṅkurādikaṃ karoti tenaiva kṣityādikaṃ tadā kṣityādīnāmapyaṅkurasvābhāvyāpattiḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi bījam aṅkura ādikam kurvat yadi yena eva svabhāvena aṅkura ādikam karoti tena eva kṣiti ādikam tadā kṣiti ādīnām api aṅkura svābhāvya āpattiḥ
translated: For, if the seed, while producing the sprout, produces the sprout and the earth etc. by the same nature, then the earth etc. would also naturally be sprouts.

original: nānāsvabhāvatvena tu kārakatve svabhāvānāmanyonyābhāvāvyabhicāritvādekatra bhāvābhavau parasparaviruddhau syātāmityekamapi bījaṃ bhidyeta /
analyzed: nānā svabhāva tvena tu kāraka tve svabhāvānām anyonya abhāva avyabhicāri tvāt ekatra bhāva abhavau paraspara viruddhau syātām iti ekam api bījam bhidyeta
translated: But if the causal nature of things were due to their having different natures, then, since the natures of things are invariably concomitant with each other, existence and non-existence would be mutually contradictory in one thing, and even a single seed would be divided.

analyzed: evam taila kṣaya vartti dāha ādikam
translated: Similarly, a lamp also consumes oil and burns the wick, etc.

analyzed: tathā pūrva rūpam api uttara rūpa rasa gandha ādikam anā ekaiḥ svabhāvaiḥ parikalitam karoti
translated: In the same way, a previous form also produces a later form, taste, smell, etc. by being conceived as having many natures.

original: teṣāṃ ca svabhāvānāmanyo 'nyābhāvāvyabhicārādviruddhānāṃ yoge pradīpādikaṃ bhidyeta /
analyzed: teṣām ca svabhāvānām anyaḥ nya abhāva avyabhicārāt viruddhānām yoge pradīpa ādikam bhidyeta
translated: And since those natures are invariably concomitant with each other, the combination of contradictory natures would divide the lamp, etc.

analyzed: na ca bhidyate
translated: But it is not divided.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: Bondage

analyzed: tat na viruddha dharma adhyāsaḥ bhedakaḥ
translated: Therefore, the superimposition of contradictory properties is not a divider.

original: tathā bījasyāṅkuraṃ prati kārakatvaṃ gardabhādikaṃ pratyakārakatvamiti kārakatvākārakatve api viruddho dharmau /
analyzed: tathā bījasya aṅkuram prati kāraka tvam gardabha ādikam prati akāraka tvam iti kāraka tva akāraka tve api viruddhaḥ dharmau
translated: Similarly, the seed's causal nature with respect to the sprout and its non-causal nature with respect to the donkey, etc. are also contradictory properties.

analyzed: na ca tad yoge bīja bhedaḥ
translated: And even when combined with that, the seed is not divided.

original: tadevamekatra bīje pradīpe rūpe ca vipakṣe paridṛśyamānaḥ śaktāśaktatvādirviruddhadharmādhyāso na ghaṭāderbhedaka iti /
analyzed: tat evam ekatra bīje pradīpe rūpe ca vipakṣe paridṛśyamānaḥ śakta aśakta tva ādiḥ viruddha dharma adhyāsaḥ na ghaṭa ādeḥ bhedakaḥ iti
translated: Thus, the superimposition of contradictory properties such as being able and being unable, which is seen in a single seed, a lamp, and a form, is not a divider of the pot, etc.

analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: To this we say:

analyzed: bhavatu tāvat bīja ādīnām aneka kārya kāri tvāt dharma bhūta aneka svabhāva bhedaḥ
translated: Let it be that the seed, etc., have a manifold nature consisting of the various properties of producing many effects.

analyzed: tathā api kaḥ prastāvaḥ viruddha dharma adhyāsasya
translated: Even so, what occasion is there for the superimposition of contradictory properties?

original: svabhāvānāṃ hyanyonyābhāvāvyabhicāre bhedaḥ prāptāvasaro na virodhaḥ /
analyzed: svabhāvānām hi anyonya abhāva avyabhicāre bhedaḥ prāpta avasaraḥ na virodhaḥ
translated: For difference is appropriate when the natures are invariably absent from each other, not contradiction.

original: virodhastu yadvidhāne yanniṣedho yanniṣedhe ca yadvidhānaṃ tayorekatra dharmiṇi parasparaparihārasthitatayā syāt /
analyzed: virodhaḥ tu yad vidhāne yad niṣedhaḥ yad niṣedhe ca yad vidhānam tayoḥ ekatra dharmiṇi paraspara parihāra sthita tayā syāt
translated: But contradiction is when the affirmation of one thing is the negation of another, and vice versa, and they occur in the same substratum, being mutually exclusive.

original: tadatraikaḥ svabhāvaḥ svābhāvena viruddho yukto bhāvābhāvavat /
analyzed: tat atra ekaḥ svabhāvaḥ sva abhāvena viruddhaḥ yuktaḥ bhāva abhāva vat
translated: Here, one nature is properly contradictory to another nature, like existence and non-existence,

analyzed: na tu svabhāva antareṇa ghaṭa tva vastu tva vat
translated: but not to a different nature, like pot and substance.

analyzed: evam aṅkura ādi kāri tvam tad akāri tvena viruddham na punar vastu antara kāri tvena
translated: Similarly, the production of sprouts, etc. is contradictory to non-production, but not to the production of another thing.

original: pratyakṣavyāpāraścātra yathā nānādharmairadhyāsitaṃ bhāvamabhinnaṃ vyavasthāpayati tathā tatkāryakāriṇaṃ kāryāntarākāriṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: pratyakṣa vyāpāraḥ ca atra yathā nānā dharmaiḥ adhyāsitam bhāvam abhinnam vyavasthāpayati tathā tad kārya kāriṇam kārya antara akāriṇam ca
translated: And just as perception establishes a thing as non-different even though it is superimposed with various properties, so it does with regard to the producer of that effect and the producer of another effect.

analyzed: tat yadi pratiyogi tva abhāvāt anyonya abhāva avyabhiocāriṇau api svabhāvau aviruddhau tad kāraka tva anya ākāraka tve
translated: If, on the other hand, the two natures, which are not concomitant with mutual absence, are not contradictory, because there is no relation of mutual opposition, then the two natures of being a cause and not being a cause are also not contradictory.

original: vāviṣayabhedādaviruddhe tat kimāyātamekakāryaṃ prati śaktāśaktatvayoḥ parasparapratiyoginorviruddhayordharmayīḥ /
analyzed: vā a viṣaya bhedāt aviruddhe tat kim āyātam eka kāryam prati śakta aśakta tvayoḥ paraspara pratiyoginoḥ viruddhayoḥ
translated: If, then, the two natures, which are not concomitant with mutual absence, are not contradictory, even though they are not the relation of counter-correlatives, or if the being a cause of that and the not being a cause of that are not contradictory due to the difference of objects, then what has come to be contradictory between the two, which are capable and incapable with respect to one effect, which are mutually counter-correlatives?

original: etayorapi punaravirodhe virodho nāma dattajalāñjaliḥ //🔽bhavatu tarhyekakāryāpekṣayaiva sāmarthyāsāmarthyayorvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: etayoḥ api punar avirodhe virodhaḥ nāma datta jala añjaliḥ  bhavatu tarhi eka kārya apekṣayā eva sāmarthya asāmarthyayoḥ virodhaḥ
translated: If these two are also non-contradictory, then contradiction is like one who has offered water libations.🔽Let it be that capability and incapacity are contradictory only in relation to one effect.

original: kevalaṃ yathā tadeva kāryaṃ prati kvaciddeśe śaktirdeśāntare cāśaktiriti deśabhedādaviruddhe śaktyaśaktī tathaikatraiva kāryakālabhedādapyaviruddhe
analyzed: kevalam yathā tat eva kāryam prati kvacid deśe śaktiḥ deśa antare ca aśaktiḥ iti deśa bhedāt aviruddhe śakti aśaktī tathā ekatra eva kārya kāla bhedāt api aviruddhe
translated: Only as that very effect, capability in one place and incapacity in another place, so capability and incapacity are not contradictory due to the difference of place. In the same way, they are not contradictory due to the difference of time with respect to one effect.

original: yathā pūrvaṃ niṣkriyaḥ sphaṭikaḥ sa eva paścāt sakriya iti cet /
analyzed: yathā pūrvam niṣkriyaḥ sphaṭikaḥ saḥ eva paścāt sakriyaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that just as a crystal is inactive before, it is active later,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

original: na hi vayaṃ paribhāṣāmātrādekatra kārye deśabhedādaviruddhe śaktyaśaktī brūmaḥ /
analyzed: na hi vayam paribhāṣā mātrāt ekatra kārye deśa bhedāt aviruddhe śakti aśaktī brūmaḥ
translated: We do not say that capability and incapacity are not contradictory due to the difference of place with respect to one effect, merely because of convention.

analyzed: kim tu virodha abhāvāt
translated: But because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: tad deśa kārya kāri tvam hi tad deśa kārya akāri tvena viruddham
translated: For the state of producing an effect in that place is contradictory to the state of not producing an effect in that place.

analyzed: na punar deśāntare tad kārya akāri tvena anya kārya kāri tvena vā
translated: But not to the state of not producing that effect in another place, nor to the state of producing another effect.

analyzed: yadi evam tad kāla kārya kāri tvam tad kāla kārya akāri tvena viruddham
translated: If that is so, then the state of producing an effect at that time is contradictory to the state of not producing an effect at that time.

analyzed: na punar kāla antare tad kārya akāri tvena anya kārya kāri tvena vā
translated: But not to the state of not producing that effect at another time, nor to the state of producing another effect.

analyzed: tat katham kāla bhede virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked how there can be contradiction even with a difference in time,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

analyzed: dvayoḥ hi dharmayoḥ ekatra dharmiṇi anavasthiti niyamaḥ paraspara parihāra sthiti lakṣaṇaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: For the contradiction of two properties is the restriction of non-abiding in one substratum, characterized by the state of mutual exclusion.

original: sa ca sākṣātparasparapratyanīkatayā bhāvābhāvavad vā bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca sākṣāt paraspara pratyanīka tayā bhāva abhāva vat vā bhavet
translated: And that may be either by direct mutual opposition, like existence and non-existence, or

original: ekasya vā niyamena pramāṇāntareṇa bādhanānnityatvasattvavad vā bhavediti na kaścidarthabhedaḥ /
analyzed: ekasya vā niyamena pramāṇa antareṇa bādhanāt nitya tva sattva vat vā bhavet iti na kaścid artha bhedaḥ
translated: by the restriction of one by another means of knowledge, like eternality and existence. So there is no difference in meaning.

original: tadatraikadharmiṇi tatkālatat kāryakāritvādhāre kālāntare tatkāryākāritvasyānyakāryakāritvasya vā niyamena pramāṇāntareṇa bādhanādvirodhaḥ
analyzed: tat atra eka dharmiṇi tad kāla tat kārya kāri tva ādhāre kāla antare tad kārya akāri tvasya anya kārya kāri tvasya vā niyamena pramāṇa antareṇa bādhanāt virodhaḥ
translated: Here, in one substratum, the contradiction is by the restriction of the state of not producing that effect or producing another effect at another time by another means of knowledge, based on the state of producing that effect at that time.

original: tathā hio yatraiva dharmiṇi tatkālakāryakāritvamupalabdhaṃ na tatraiva kālāntare
analyzed: tathā yatra eva dharmiṇi tad kāla kārya kāri tvam upalabdham na tatra eva kāla antare
translated: For, where the production of an effect at that time is perceived in a subject, at that very time,

For, where the existence of an effect at that time is perceived in a particular subject, there the existence of that effect at another time, or the existence of another effect, cannot be denied even by Brahmā.

analyzed: yena anayoḥ avirodhaḥ syāt
translated: By which there would be no contradiction between these two.

analyzed: kṣaṇa antare kathita prasaṅga viparyaya hetubhyām avaśyaṃbhāvena dharmi bheda prasādhanāt
translated: Because the difference of the subject is established by the necessary existence of the reason stated in the next moment, which is the opposite of the consequence.

analyzed: na ca pratyabhijñānāt eka tva siddhiḥ
translated: And the establishment of oneness is not from recognition.

analyzed: tad pauruṣasya nirmūlita tvāt
translated: Because that is human and has no basis.

analyzed: atas eva vajraḥ pi pakṣa kukṣau nikṣiptaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the thunderbolt is also thrown into the womb of the opponent's position.

original: kathamasau sphaṭiko barākaḥ kālabhedenābhedaprasādhanāya dṛṣṭāntībhavitumarhati /🔽na caivaṃ samānakālakāryāṇāṃ deśabhede 'pi dharmibhedo yukto bhedaprasādhakapramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: katham asau sphaṭikaḥ barākaḥ kāla bhedena abheda prasādhanāya dṛṣṭāntībhavitum arhati  na ca evam samāna kāla kāryāṇām deśa bhede pi dharmi bhedaḥ yuktaḥ bheda prasādhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: How can that poor crystal become an example to establish non-difference through difference in time?🔽And thus, even in different places, the difference of the subject is not proper for effects occurring at the same time, because there is no means of establishing difference.

original: indriyapratyakṣeṇa nirastavibhramāśaṅkenābhedaprasādhanācceti na kālabhede 'pi śaktyaśaktyorvirodhaḥ svasamayamātrādapahastayituṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: indriya pratyakṣeṇa nirasta vibhrama āśaṅkena abheda prasādhanāt ca iti na kāla bhede pi śakti aśaktyoḥ virodhaḥ sva samaya mātrāt apahastayitum śakyaḥ
translated: And because non-difference is established by sense perception free from doubt of error. Therefore, even in difference of time, the contradiction between ability and inability cannot be set aside merely by one's own doctrine.

analyzed: samaya pramāṇayoḥ apravṛtteḥ iti
translated: because the two, the time and the measure, do not operate.

analyzed: tasmāt sarvatra viruddha dharma adhyāsa siddhiḥ eva bheda siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the superimposition of contradictory properties everywhere is itself the establishment of difference.

original: vipratipannaṃ prati tu viruddhadharmādhyāsād bhedavyavahāraḥ sādhyate //
analyzed: vipratipannam prati tu viruddha dharma adhyāsāt bheda vyavahāraḥ sādhyate
translated: But with regard to one who disagrees, the usage of difference is established from the superimposition of contradictory properties.

analyzed: nanu tathā api sattvam idam anaikāntikam evā asādhāraṇa tvāt sandigdha vyatireki tvāt vā
translated: But even so, this is inconclusive, because of the lack of a common property, or because of the doubt regarding the difference.

original: yathā hīdaṃ kramākramanivṛttāvakṣaṇikānnivṛttaṃ tathā sāpekṣatvānapekṣatvayorekatvānekatvayorapi vyāpakayornivṛttau kṣaṇikādapi /
analyzed: yathā hi idam kramākrama nivṛttau akṣaṇikāt nivṛttam tathā sāpekṣa tva anapekṣa tvayoḥ ekatva anekatvayoḥ api vyāpakayoḥ nivṛttau kṣaṇikāt api
translated: Just as this [difference] is absent in the non-momentary when there is an absence of sequence and simultaneity, so too it is absent in the momentary when there is an absence of the two all-pervading properties of dependence and independence, unity and plurality.

original: tathā hi upasarpaṇapratyayena devadattakarapallavādinā sahacaro bījakṣaṇaḥ pūrvasmādeva puñjāt samartho jāto 'napekṣa ādyātiśayasya janaka
analyzed: tathā hi upasarpaṇa pratyayena devadatta karapallava ādinā sahacaraḥ bīja kṣaṇaḥ pūrvasmāt eva puñjāt samarthaḥ jātaḥ ādya atiśayasya janaka
translated: For instance, the seed-moment that accompanies the action of Devadatta's hand, etc., is produced from the same mass as before, capable of producing the initial excess without dependence.

original: tatra ca samānakuśūlajanmasu bahuṣu bījasantāneṣu kasmāt kiñcideva bījaṃ paramparayāṅkurotpādānuguṇamupajanayati vījakṣaṇaṃ nānye bījakṣaṇā
analyzed: tatra ca samāna kuśūla janmasu bahuṣu bīja santāneṣu kasmāt kiñcid eva bījam paramparayā aṅkura utpāda anuguṇam upajanayati vīja kṣaṇam na anye bīja kṣaṇā  /
translated: And among the many seed-series born from the same granary, why does only one seed produce the seed-moment conducive to the production of the sprout, not the other seed-moments?

analyzed: bhinna santāna antar pātinaḥ
translated: Those that are included in different series.

original: na hi upasarpaṇapratyayāt prāgeva teṣāṃ samānāsamānasantānavartināṃ bījakṣaṇānāṃ kaścit paramparātiśayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi upasarpaṇa pratyayāt prāk eva teṣām samāna asamāna santāna vartinām bīja kṣaṇānām kaścid paramparā atiśayaḥ
translated: For prior to the cognition of the approach, there is no difference in the seed-moments belonging to the same or different continua.

original: athopasarpaṇapratyayāt prāṅ na tatsantānavartino 'pi janayanti /🔽paramparayāpyaṅkurotpādānuguṇaṃ bījakṣaṇaṃ bījamātrajananāt teṣām /
analyzed: atha upasarpaṇa pratyayāt prāk na janayanti  paramparayā api aṅkura utpāda anuguṇam bīja kṣaṇam bīja mātra jananāt teṣām
translated: If it is argued that they do not produce even those belonging to the same continuum prior to the cognition of approach,🔽then the seed-moment that is conducive to the production of the sprout is the seed, because it produces the seed alone.

analyzed: kasyacid eva bīja kṣaṇasya upasarpaṇa pratyaya sahabhuvaḥ ādya atiśaya utpādaḥ
translated: The first moment of the seed-moment that co-exists with the cognition of approach has the production of a special quality.

original: hanta tarhi tadabhāve satyutpanno 'pi na janayedeva /
analyzed: hanta tarhi tad abhāve sati utpannaḥ pi na janayet eva
translated: Then, even if produced in the absence of that, it would not produce at all.

original: tathā ca kevalānāṃ vyabhicārasaṃbhavādādyātiśayotpādakamaṅkuraṃ vā pratikṣityādīnāṃ parasparāpekṣāṇāmevotpādakatvamakāmenāpi svīkarttavyam
analyzed: tathā ca kevalānām vyabhicāra saṃbhavāt ādya atiśaya utpādakam aṅkuram vā prati kṣiti ādīnām paraspara apekṣāṇām eva utpādaka tvam akāmena api svīkarttavyam
translated: And thus, because the possibility of deviation of the mere [seed] is present, one must unwillingly accept that the production of the first special quality or the sprout is the production of the mutual dependencies of the soil, etc.

analyzed: atas na tāvat anapekṣā kṣaṇikasya sambhavinī
translated: Therefore, first of all, dependence is not possible for the momentary [thing].

analyzed: na api apekṣā yujyate
translated: Nor is dependence reasonable.

analyzed: sama samaya kṣaṇayoḥ savyetara go viṣāṇayoḥ iva upakārya upakāraka bhāva ayogāt iti na asiddhaḥ prathamaḥ vyāpaka abhāvaḥ
translated: Because the relation of the one to be benefited and the benefactor is not possible for two moments that exist at the same time, like the right and left horns of a cow. Thus, the first absence of the pervader is not unestablished.

original: api cāntyo bījakṣaṇo 'napekṣāṅkurādikaṃ kurvan yadi yenaiva rūpeṇāṅkuraṃ karoti tenaiva
analyzed: api ca antyaḥ bīja kṣaṇaḥ kurvan yadi yena eva rūpeṇa aṅkuram karoti tena eva
translated: Moreover, if the final moment of the seed produces the sprout without depending on anything else, and if it produces the sprout in the same form in which it produces the sprout,

analyzed: kṣiti ādikam tadā kṣiti ādīnām api aṅkura svābhāvya āpattiḥ abhinna kāraṇatvāt iti na tāvat ekatva saṃbhavaḥ
translated: Moreover, if the last moment of the seed, without depending on anything else, produces the sprout, etc., and if it produces the sprout with the same form as that with which it produces the earth, etc., then the earth, etc. would also have the nature of a sprout, because of having the same cause. Thus, there is no possibility of oneness.

analyzed: nanu rūpa antareṇa karoti
translated: But it produces with a different form.

analyzed: tathā hi bījasya aṅkuram pratyupādāna tvam
translated: This is because the seed is the material cause in relation to the sprout.
But in relation to the earth, etc., it is the cooperative cause.

original: yadyevaṃ sahakāritvopādānatve kimekaṃ tattvaṃ nānā vā /
analyzed: yadi evam sahakāri tva upādāna tve kim ekam tattvam nānā vā
translated: If that is so, are the cooperative cause and the material cause one or different?

original: Nibandh ekaṃ cet kathaṃ rūpāntareṇa janakam /
analyzed: ekam ced katham rūpa antareṇa janakam
translated: If they are one, how can it produce with a different form?

analyzed: nānātve tu anayoḥ bījāt bhedaḥ bhedaḥ vā
translated: If they are different, are these two different from the seed or not?

analyzed: bhede katham bījasya janaka tvam tābhyām eva aṅkura ādīnām utpatteḥ
translated: If they are different, how can the seed be the producer, since the sprout, etc. arise from those two alone?

original: abhede vā kathaṃ bījasya na nānātvaṃ bhinnatādātmyāt /
analyzed: abhede vā katham bījasya na nānātvam bhinna tādātmyāt
translated: If they are not different, how can the seed not be manifold, because of having a different self-identity?

analyzed: etayoḥ vā eka tvam eka tādātmyāt
translated: These two are one, because of having the same self-identity.

original: yadyucyeta kṣityādau janayitavye tadupādānaṃ pūrvameva kṣityādibījasya rūpāntaramiti /
analyzed: yadi ucyeta kṣiti ādau janayitavye tad upādānam pūrvam eva kṣiti ādi bījasya rūpa antaram iti
translated: If it is said that in relation to the earth, etc. that are to be produced, the material cause is the different form of the seed of the earth, etc. that existed previously,

original: na tarhi bījaṃ tadanapekṣaṃ kṣityādīnāṃ janakam /
analyzed: na tarhi bījam tad anapekṣam kṣiti ādīnām janakam
translated: Then the seed is not the producer of the earth, etc. without depending on them.

analyzed: tad anapekṣa tve teṣām aṅkurāt bheda anupapatteḥ
translated: If it did not depend on them, it would be impossible for them to be different from the sprout.

analyzed: na ca anupakārakāṇi apekṣante iti tvayā eva uktam
translated: And you yourself have said that things do not depend on what does not benefit them.

analyzed: na ca kṣaṇasya upakāra saṃbhavaḥ nyatra jananāt
translated: And for a moment, there is no possibility of benefit other than production.

analyzed: tasya abhedya tvāt iti anekatvam api nā asti iti vyāpaka abhāvaḥ nā asiddhaḥ
translated: And because that is indivisible, multiplicity also does not exist. Thus the second absence of the pervasion is also not unestablished.

analyzed: tasmāt asādhāraṇa anaikāntika tvam gandhavat tva vat iti
translated: Therefore, the existence of smell is a unique inconclusive reason.

original: yadi manyetānupakārakā api bhavanti sahakāriṇo 'pekṣaṇīyāśca kāryeṇānuvihitabhāvābhāvācca sahakaraṇācca /🔽nanvanena krameṇākṣaṇiko 'pi bhāvo 'nupakārakānapi sahakāriṇaḥ kramavataḥ kramavatkāryeṇānukṛtānvayavyatirekānapekṣiṣyate /
analyzed: yadi manyeta anupakārakāḥ api bhavanti sahakāriṇaḥ upekṣaṇīyāḥ ca kāryeṇa anuvihita bhāva abhāvāt ca sahakaraṇāt ca  nanu anena krameṇa akṣaṇikaḥ pi bhāvaḥ n upakārakān api sahakāriṇaḥ kramavataḥ kramavat kāryeṇa anukṛta anvaya vyatirekān apekṣiṣyate
translated: If one were to think that even non-beneficial things become co-operating causes and are to be depended on, because their presence and absence are in conformity with the effect, and because they co-operate,

original: kariṣyate ca kramavatsahakārivaśaḥ krameṇa kāryāṇīti vyāpakānupalabdherasiddheḥ sandigdhavyatirekamanaikāntikaṃ sattvaṃ kṣaṇikatva siddhāviti
analyzed: kariṣyate ca kramavat sahakāri vaśaḥ krameṇa kāryāṇi iti vyāpaka anupalabdheḥ asiddheḥ sandigdha vyatirekam anaikāntikam sattvam kṣaṇika tva siddhau iti
translated: then in this way, even a non-momentary thing would depend on non-beneficial co-operating causes that occur in sequence, because their presence and absence are in conformity with the effect that occurs in sequence, and it would produce effects in sequence under the influence of co-operating causes that occur in sequence. Thus, because the absence of the pervasion is not established, existence is a doubtful counter-pervasion inconclusive reason in establishing momentariness.

analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: To this we say:

analyzed: kīdṛśam punar apekṣā artham ādāya kṣaṇike sāpekṣa anapekṣa tva nivṛttiḥ ucyate
translated: But what is the meaning of 'dependence' that is taken to mean that the denial of being dependent or independent applies to the momentary [thing]?

analyzed: kim sahakāriṇam apekṣate iti sahakāriṇā asya upakāraḥ karttavyaḥ
translated: Is it that it depends on auxiliaries, so that the auxiliary must perform a service for it?

original: atha pūrvāvasthitasyaiva bījādeḥ sahakāriṇā saha saṃbhūyakaraṇam /
analyzed: atha pūrva avasthitasya eva bīja ādeḥ sahakāriṇā saha saṃbhūyakaraṇam
translated: Or is it that the seed, etc., which existed previously, are produced together with the auxiliaries?

analyzed: yat vā pūrva avasthitasya iti an apekṣya milita avasthasya karaṇa mātram apekṣā arthaḥ
translated: Or is the meaning of 'dependence' merely that it depends on the mere production of the combined state, without regard to the existence of the seed, etc., in the previous state?

analyzed: atra prathama pakṣasya asaṃbhavāt anapekṣā eva kṣaṇikasya
translated: Here, since the first alternative is impossible, the momentary [thing] is indeed independent.

analyzed: katham ubhaya vyāvṛttiḥ
translated: How is there the exclusion of both [dependence and independence]?

analyzed: yadi anapekṣaḥ kim iti upasarpaṇa pratyaya abhāve pi na karoti
translated: If it is independent, why does it not produce even when the conditions for approaching [it] are absent?

analyzed: karoti eva yadi syāt
translated: It would produce if it existed.

analyzed: svayam asaṃbhavī tu katham karotu
translated: But how can something that is itself impossible produce?

analyzed: atha tat vā tādṛś vā āsīt iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: Or if it existed in that way or in such a way, there is no difference at all.

original: tatastādṛksvabhāvasaṃbhave 'yakaraṇaṃ sahakāriṇi nirapekṣatāṃ na kṣamata iti cet /
analyzed: tatas tādṛś svabhāva saṃbhave sahakāriṇi nirapekṣa tām na kṣamate iti ced
translated: If it is argued that when such a nature is possible, the non-production in the auxiliary is not tenable as independence,

analyzed: asaṃbaddham etat
translated: that is irrelevant.

analyzed: varṇa saṃsthāna sāmye pi akartṛn tad svabhāva tāyāḥ virahāt
translated: Even when the color and shape are the same, there is no absence of the nature of the non-producer.

original: sa cādyātiśayajanakatvalakṣaṇaḥ svabhāvaviśeṣo na samānāsamānasantānavartiṣu bījakṣaṇeṣu sarveṣveva saṃbhavī /
analyzed: sa ca ādya atiśaya janaka tva lakṣaṇaḥ svabhāva viśeṣaḥ na samāna asamāna santāna vartiṣu bīja kṣaṇeṣu sarveṣu eva saṃbhavī
translated: And that special nature consisting in the production of the highest excellence is possible in all the seed-moments occurring in the same or different continua.

analyzed: kim tu keṣucid eva karmakara karapallava sahacareṣu
translated: But it is only in some of them that are co-existent with the working of the earth, water, etc.

original: nanvekatra kṣetre niṣpattilavanādipūrvakamānīyaikatra kuśūle kṣiptāni sarvāṇyeva bījāni sādhāraṇarūpāṇyeva pratīyante /
analyzed: nanu ekatra kṣetre niṣpatti lavana ādi pūrvakam ānīya ekatra kuśūle kṣiptāni sarvāṇi eva bījāni sādhāraṇa rūpāṇi eva pratīyante
translated: But in a single field, all the seeds that are brought in after the previous production of sprouts, etc., and are thrown into a single granary are perceived to be of a common form.

analyzed: tat kutastyaḥ yam eka bīja saṃbhavī viśeṣaḥ nyeṣām iti ced
translated: So how can this special nature belonging to a single seed arise in the others?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: kāraṇaṃ khalu sarvatra kārye dvividham dṛṣṭamadṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇam khalu sarvatra kārye dvividham dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭam
translated: Indeed, the cause is of two kinds in every effect: seen and unseen,

analyzed: nibandh ca iti sarva āstika prasiddham etat
translated: and binding. This is well-known to all realists.

analyzed: tatas pratyakṣa parokṣa sahakāri a pratyaya sākalyam asarva vidā pratyakṣataḥ na śakyam pratipattum
translated: Therefore, the completeness of the totality of co-operating conditions, both perceptible and imperceptible, cannot be directly perceived by one who knows not all.

original: tato bhavedapi kāraṇasāmagrīśaktibhedāttādṛśaḥ svabhāvabhedaḥ keṣāñcideva bījakṣaṇānāṃ yena ta eva bījakṣaṇā ādyātiśayamaṅkuraṃ vā paramparayā
analyzed: tatas bhavet api kāraṇa sāmagrī śakti bhedāt tādṛśaḥ svabhāva bhedaḥ keṣāñcid eva bīja kṣaṇānām yena te eva bīja kṣaṇāḥ ādya atiśayam aṅkuram vā paramparayā
translated: Therefore, even if there were a difference in the power of the assemblage of causes, there could arise such a difference in the nature of only some of the seed-moments by which those very seed-moments would, by a series,

analyzed: janayeyuḥ
translated: produce the highest excellence or the sprout.

analyzed: na anye ca bīja kṣaṇāḥ
translated: And not other seed-moments.

original: nanu yeṣūpasarpaṇapratyayasahacareṣu svakāraṇaśaktibhedādādyātiśayajanakatvalakṣaṇo viśeṣaḥ saṃbhāvyate sa tatrāvaśyamastīti kuto labhyamiti 🔽cet /
analyzed: nanu yeṣu upasarpaṇa pratyaya sahacareṣu sva kāraṇa śakti bhedāt ādya atiśaya janaka tva lakṣaṇaḥ viśeṣaḥ saṃbhāvyate sa tatra avaśyam asti iti kutas labhyam iti  ced
translated: But if it is asked how it is known that the difference characterized by the production of the initial excess due to the diversity of the power of its cause is possible in those that accompany the conditions of approach,

analyzed: aṅkura utpādāt anumitāt ādya atiśaya lakṣaṇāt kāryāt iti brūmaḥ
translated: we say that it is known from the effect characterized by the initial excess, which is inferred from the production of the sprout.

original: kāraṇānupalabdhestarhi tadabhāva eva bhaviṣyatīti cet / na /
analyzed: kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ tarhi tad abhāvaḥ eva bhaviṣyati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that then its absence will be due to the non-apprehension of the cause, it is not so.

analyzed: dṛśya adṛśya samudāyasya kāraṇasya adarśane pi abhāva asiddheḥ kāraṇa anupalabdheḥ sandigdha asiddha tvāt
translated: Because even when the cause, which is a collection of visible and invisible [factors], is not seen, its absence is not established. The non-apprehension of the cause is inconclusive due to the uncertainty.

original: tadayamarthaḥ🔽pāṇisparśavataḥ kṣaṇasya na bhidā bhinnānyakālakṣaṇād🔽bhedo veti matadvaye mitibalaṃ yasyāstvasau jitvaraḥ /🔽tatraikasya balaṃ nimittavirahaḥ kāryāṅgamanyasya vā
analyzed: tat ayam arthaḥ  pāṇi sparśavataḥ kṣaṇasya na bhidā bhinna anya kāla kṣaṇāt  bhedaḥ vā iti mata dvaye miti balam yasyāḥ tu asau jitvaraḥ  tatra ekasya balam nimitta virahaḥ kārya aṅgam anyasya vā
translated: The meaning of this is:🔽He who has the power of cognition in the two views - whether there is no difference in the moment that has contact with the hand, or there is difference from the different moments of time,

original: sāmagrī tu na sarvathekṣaṇasahā kāryaṃ tu mānānugam // iti //
analyzed: sāmagrī tu na sarvathā īkṣaṇa sahā kāryam tu māna anugam iti
translated: is quick to win. There, the strength of one is the absence of a cause, and of the other, the collection of causes. But the collection is never capable of being seen. The effect follows the means of valid knowledge.

original: tadevaṃ nopakāro 'pekṣārtha ityanapekṣaiva kṣaṇikasya sahakāriṣu nobhayavyāvṛtiḥ //
analyzed: tat evam na upakārā upekṣā arthaḥ iti anapekṣā eva kṣaṇikasya sahakāriṣu na ubhaya vyāvṛtiḥ
translated: Thus, help is not the meaning of dependence. Therefore, the momentary [entity] is indeed independent with respect to the auxiliaries. There is no exclusion of both [dependence and independence].

original: atha saṃbhūyakaraṇamapekṣārthaḥ /🔽tadā yadi pūrvasthitasyeti viśeṣaṇāpekṣā tadā kṣaṇikasya naivaṃ kadācidityanapekṣaivākṣīṇā /
analyzed: atha saṃbhūya karaṇam apekṣā arthaḥ  tadā yadi pūrva sthitasya iti viśeṣaṇa apekṣā tadā kṣaṇikasya na evam kadācid iti anapekṣā eva akṣīṇā
translated: If, on the other hand, the meaning of ‘apeksā’ is that of the operation of the thing in combination, then, if the qualification ‘of the previously existing thing’ is necessary, then, in the case of the momentary thing, the operation is not dependent upon anything else; as it is always there.

original: atha pūrvasthitasyetyanapekṣya militāvasthitasyaiva karaṇamapekṣārthastadā sāpekṣataiva / nānapekṣā /
analyzed: atha pūrva sthitasya iti an apekṣya milita avasthitasya eva karaṇam apekṣā arthaḥ tadā sāpekṣa tā eva na anapekṣā
translated: If, on the other hand, the meaning of ‘apeksā’ is that of the operation of the thing in the combined state, without reference to the previously existing thing, then the thing is dependent upon something else, and not independent.

original: tathā ca nobhayavyāvṛttirityasiddhaḥ prathamo vyāpakānupalambhaḥ /🔽tathaikatvānekatvayorapi vyāpakayoḥ kṣaṇikād vyāvṛttirasiddhā /🔽tattadvyāvṛttibhedamāśrityopādānatvādikālpanikasvabhāvabhede 'pi paramārthata ekenaiva svarūpeṇānekakāryaniṣpādanādubhayavyāvṛtterabhāvāt /
analyzed: tathā ca na ubhaya vyāvṛttiḥ iti asiddhaḥ prathamaḥ vyāpaka anupalambhaḥ  tathā ekatva anekatvayoḥ api vyāpakayoḥ kṣaṇikāt vyāvṛttiḥ asiddhā  tad tad vyāvṛtti bhedam āśritya upādāna tva ādi kālpanika svabhāva bhede pi paramārthataḥ ekena eva svarūpeṇa aneka kārya niṣpādanāt ubhaya vyāvṛtteḥ abhāvāt
translated: And in that case, there would be no ‘exclusion of both’ (i.e. of dependence and independence); so that the first premiss (of the Buddhist) that ‘the momentary thing cannot be the cause of anything’ is not admitted.🔽Similarly, the ‘exclusion of both’ (dependence and independence) is not admitted in the case of the two all-embracing characters of ‘one-ness’ and ‘many-ness’ (as residing in the momentary thing).🔽Because even though the thing has several assumed forms, based upon the various exclusions of the various exclusions of the thing, yet in reality, it produces several effects by means of a single form; and hence there is no ‘exclusion of both’ (dependence and independence).

original: yacca bījasyaikenaiva svabhāvena kārakatve kṣityādīnāmaṅkurasvābhāvyāpattiranyathā kāraṇābhede 'pi kāryabhede 'pi kāryasyāhetukatvaprasaṅgādityuktam
analyzed: yat ca bījasya ekena eva svabhāvena kāraka tve kṣiti ādīnām aṅkura svābhāvya āpattiḥ anyathā kāraṇā bhede pi kārya bhede pi kāryasya ahetuka tva prasaṅgāt iti uktam
translated: It has been argued (under Text 2191) that “if the seed produces the sprout by its own mere existence, then earth and other things should also produce the sprout”.

analyzed: tat asaṅgatam
translated: This is not relevant.

analyzed: kāraṇa eka tvasya kārya bhedasya ca paṭunā indriya pratyakṣeṇa prasādhanāt
translated: Because the oneness of the cause and the difference of the effects are established by the perception of a keen sense organ.

analyzed: eka kāraṇa janya tva eka tvayoḥ vyāpteḥ pratihata tvāt
translated: Because the pervasion between being produced by a single cause and being one is obstructed.

original: prasaṅgasyānupadatvāt /🔽yacca kāraṇābhede kāryābheda ityuktaṃ tatra sāmagrīsvarūpaṃ kāraṇamabhipretam /
analyzed: prasaṅgasya anupada tvāt  yat ca kāraṇa abhede kārya abhedaḥ iti uktam tatra sāmagrī svarūpam kāraṇam abhipretam
translated: Because the reductio is not immediate.🔽And what is said there, that when there is no difference in the cause there is no difference in the effect, the nature of the assemblage is intended as the cause.

analyzed: sāmagrī sajātīya tve na kārya vijātīya tā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when the assemblage is of the same kind, the effect is not of a different kind.

original: na punaḥ sāmagrīmadhyagatenaikenānekaṃ kāryaṃ na kartavyaṃ nāma /
analyzed: na punar sāmagrī madhya gatena ekena anekam kāryam na kartavyam nāma
translated: But it is not that a single thing included in the assemblage should not produce many effects.

analyzed: ekasmāt aneka utpatteḥ pratyakṣa siddha tvāt
translated: Because the production of many from one is established by perception.

original: na caivaṃ pratyabhijñānāt kālabhede 'pyabhedasiddhirityuktaprāyam /🔽na cendriyapratyakṣaṃ bhinnadeśaṃ sapratighaṃ
analyzed: na ca evam pratyabhijñānāt kāla bhede pi abheda siddhiḥ iti ukta prāyam  na ca indriya pratyakṣam bhinna deśam sa pratigham
translated: And it has been said that in this way, from recognition, non-difference is established even in the case of temporal difference.🔽And sense perception does not perceive two objects that are different in place and are resistant.

original: Nibandh dṛśyamarthadvayamekamevopalambhayatīti kvacidupalabdham yena tatrāpi bhede śaṅkā syāt /
analyzed: nibandh dṛśyam artha dvayam ekam evā upalambhayati iti kvacid upalabdham yena tatra api bhede śaṅkā syāt
translated: It is not observed anywhere that a single object is perceived as one. By which there could be doubt even there regarding difference.

analyzed: śaṅkāyām vā paṭu pratyakṣasya api apalāpe sarva pramāṇa uccheda prasaṅgāt iti
translated: Or if there is doubt, then because of the undesirable consequence of the destruction of all means of knowledge due to the denial of even keen perception.

analyzed: nā api sattva hetoḥ sandigdha vyatireki tvam
