translated: Otherwise there would be an absurd extension [of the definition of error]. This has been said already.

analyzed: bāhya vastu svarūpa sphuraṇe tu pratyakṣa pratipattiḥ eva asau iti kaḥ dhyavasāyaḥ
translated: But if the form of an external object appears, then that is perception itself. What is there to be determined?

analyzed: avastu sphuraṇam punar tridhā vikalpya prāk eva pratyākhyātam
translated: Moreover, the appearance of a non-existent object has been refuted earlier in three ways.

analyzed: sva ākāre tu bāhya āropaḥ na saṃbhavati eva
translated: But the superimposition of an external object on one's own form is simply impossible.

original: tathā hi jñānaṃ kenacidākāreṇa satyenālīkena vopajātaṃ nāma /
analyzed: tathā hi jñānam kenacid ākāreṇa satyena alīkena vā upajātam nāma
translated: For thus, a cognition arises with some form, whether real or unreal.

analyzed: bāhya āropaḥ tu tad ākāre tad kṛtaḥ nyakṛtaḥ vā syāt
translated: But the superimposition of an external object would be either produced by that [cognition] or produced by something else, with regard to that form.

original: tatkṛtatve na tāvat tatkāla eva vyāpārāntaramanubhūyata iti kutastadāropaḥ /
analyzed: tad kṛta tve na tāvat tad kāle eva vyāpāra antaram anubhūyate iti kutas tad āropaḥ
translated: If it is produced by that [cognition], then first of all, another operation is not experienced at that time. So how can there be that superimposition?

original: kālāntare ca svayamevāsat kasya vyāpāraḥ syāt /
analyzed: kāla antare ca svayam eva asat kasya vyāpāraḥ syāt
translated: And at another time, being itself non-existent, whose operation could it be?

original: dvitīyapakṣe jñānāntaramapi nākārāroparāgasaṅginīmutpattimantareṇa vyāpārāntareṇa kvacit kiñcitkaraṃ nāma /
analyzed: dvitīya pakṣe jñāna antaram api na ākāra āropa rāga saṅginīm utpattim antareṇa vyāpāra antareṇa kvacid kiñcitkaram nāma
translated: In the second case, another cognition also does not have any other operation apart from the arising connected with the superimposition of a form, in producing something somewhere.

analyzed: tat etat arvācīna jñāna sadṛśa ākāra gocarīkaraṇe na bāhya āropa vyāpāram aparam spṛśati tad ākāra leśa anukāram apahāya
translated: Even when it makes the form similar to the knowledge of the external object, it does not touch any other operation of superimposing the external object, except for imitating a part of that form.

analyzed: na ca śabda amukhīkaraṇam atiriktaḥ vyāpāraḥ
translated: And the operation of making the word manifest is not a separate operation.

analyzed: śabda ākārasya api svarūpe eva antarbhāvāt iti na ākārāt anyaḥ jñāna vyāpāraḥ
translated: Because even the form of the word is included in its own nature. Thus, the operation of knowledge is not different from the form.

analyzed: āropyamāṇaḥ ca asau arthaḥ bāhyaḥ
translated: And that object which is superimposed is external.

original: tatra buddhau yadi svarūpeṇa sphurati satyapratītirevāsau / ka āropaḥ /
analyzed: tatra buddhau yadi sva rūpeṇa sphurati satya pratītiḥ eva asau kaḥ āropaḥ
translated: If it shines in the form of its own nature in the cognition, then it is indeed true cognition. What is the superimposition?

original: atha na parisphurati tathāpi ka āropaḥ /
analyzed: atha na parisphurati tathā api kaḥ āropaḥ
translated: Even if it does not shine, still what is the superimposition?

analyzed: sphuraṇe vā adhikaraṇa bhūta sva ākāra atiriktasya āropyamāṇa ākārasya api pratibhāsa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If it shines, then there would be the appearance of the superimposed form, which is different from the form of the cognition that is the substratum.

analyzed: tad ākāra sphuraṇam eva tasya sphuraṇam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the shining of that is the shining of its form, it is not so.

analyzed: tasya āropa viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because that is the object of superimposition.

original: na hi marīcisphuraṇameva jalasphuraṇamiti na svākāre bāhyāropaḥ /
analyzed: na hi marīci sphuraṇam eva jala sphuraṇam iti na sva ākāre bāhya āropaḥ
translated: For the shining of the mirage is not the shining of water. Therefore, there is no superimposition of the external on one's own form.

analyzed: atas eva bāhye sva ākāra āropaḥ na asti
translated: For this very reason, there is no superimposition of one's own form on the external.

analyzed: āropa viṣayasya bāhyasya asphuraṇāt
translated: Because the external object, which is the object of superimposition, does not shine.

analyzed: tatas eva sva ākāra bāhyayoḥ yojanā api asaṃbhavinī
translated: For this very reason, the connection between one's own form and the external is also impossible.

analyzed: yogyayoḥ apratibhāsāt
translated: Because the two [objects] are not cognized as one.

analyzed: na ca ekīkaraṇam adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: And the determination is not the unification [of the two].

analyzed: kaḥ yam ekīkaraṇa arthaḥ
translated: What is the meaning of unification?

analyzed: yadi ekatā āpattau prayojaka tvam tadā āropya āropa viṣayayoḥ kadācid ekībhāva abhāvāt asaṃbhavaḥ eva
translated: If it means being the cause of attaining oneness, then it is impossible, because the superimposed and the object of superimposition are never unified.

analyzed: na hi śaśaviṣāṇe kāraṇam kiñcid
translated: For there is no cause at all for the horn of a rabbit.

analyzed: na ca pūrvam anekam ekatām eti iti kṣaṇika vādinaḥ sāṃpratam
translated: And it is not tenable for the proponents of momentariness that many things become one before [becoming many again].

analyzed: artha antara utpatti mātram tu syāt
translated: It would just be the arising of something different.

analyzed: na ca tad upalabdhi gocaraḥ nyatra āropa viṣayāt sva ākārāt
translated: And that is not the object of perception, except for one's own form which is the object of superimposition.

analyzed: na ca tāvatā api arthasya kiñcid iti katham ekīkaraṇam
translated: And even with that, there is nothing at all for the object. So how is there unification?

analyzed: atha eka pratītiḥ adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: If determination is the cognition of one,

analyzed: tathā api na dvayoḥ eka pratipattiḥ adhyavaseya anubhava abhāvāt
translated: then even so, there is no determination of two as one, because there is no experience of what is to be determined.

original: na ca dvayoḥ pratītirityevādhyavasāyaḥ nīlapītavat /🔽na cābhedena pratītiradhyavasāyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca dvayoḥ pratītiḥ iti eva adhyavasāyaḥ nīla pīta vat  na ca abhedena pratītiḥ adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: And it is not that the determination is just the cognition of two, like blue and yellow.🔽And the cognition of non-difference is not the determination.

analyzed: yatas paryudāsa pakṣe aikya pratītiḥ uktā bhavati
translated: Because in the case of exclusion, the cognition of oneness is said to occur.

analyzed: sā ca pratyuktā
translated: And that has been refuted.

analyzed: adhyavaseya pratipatti abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no cognition of what is to be determined.

original: bhedena pratītiniṣedhamātre 'pi na bāhyasya pratītirukteti kutastadadhyavasāyaḥ /
analyzed: bhedena pratīti niṣedha mātre na bāhyasya pratītiḥ uktā iti kutas tad adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: Even in the mere negation of cognition as different, it is not said that there is no cognition of the external. So how can there be the determination of that?

original: yadi hi bāhyaṃ prakāśeta ekatvenānekatvena vā satā asatā vā pratītiriti yuktam /
analyzed: yadi hi bāhyam prakāśeta ekatvena anekatvena vā satā asatā vā pratītiḥ iti yuktam
translated: For if the external were manifested, either as one or as many, as existent or as non-existent, cognition would be appropriate.

analyzed: sarva ākāra tad svarūpa tiraskāreṇa sā pratītiḥ iti eka pratītiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that cognition is of one kind because that cognition is of the form of the negation of all aspects of that [external object],

analyzed: tad svarūpa tiraskāre tarhi tad apratibhāsanam eva
translated: then, if there is the negation of the form of that [external object], then there is indeed the non-appearance of that [external object].

analyzed: kasyacid aṃśasya pratibhāsanāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is because of the appearance of some part [of the external object], no.

original: niraṃśatvādvastunaḥ sarvātmanā pratibhāso 'pratibhāso veti śāstramevātra vistareṇa parīkṣyate /
analyzed: niraṃśa tvāt vastunaḥ sarva ātmanā vā iti śāstram eva atra vistareṇa parīkṣyate
translated: Because of the partlessness of the object, there is either the appearance of the whole or the non-appearance [of the object]. This is examined in detail in the treatise.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: Bondage

analyzed: na ca bheda agrahaḥ dhī avasāyaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: And the non-apprehension of difference should not be stated as determination.

original: tathā hi kiṃ bāhye gṛhyamāṇe 'gṛhyamāṇe vā /
analyzed: tathā hi kim bāhye gṛhyamāṇe gṛhyamāṇe vā
translated: Thus, is the external apprehended or not apprehended?

analyzed: na ca prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: And the first alternative is not so.

analyzed: bāhya grahaṇasya pratikṣipta tvāt  grahaṇe vā adhyavasāyasya pratyakṣa tā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because the apprehension of the external has been rejected.🔽Or if there is apprehension, then determination would be a form of perception.

original: agṛhyamāṇe tu bāhye pravṛttiniyamo na syāt /
analyzed: agṛhyamāṇe tu bāhye pravṛtti niyamaḥ na syāt
translated: But if the external is not apprehended, there would be no restriction of activity.

analyzed: anyeṣām api tadānīm agrahaṇāt anyatra api pravṛtti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that it would operate even with respect to other objects, since it does not apprehend those either at that time.

analyzed: trilocanaḥ pi ittham adhyavasāyam dūṣayati  kaḥ yam adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: Trilocana also criticizes this conception in the following way.🔽What is this conception?

analyzed: kim grahaṇam
translated: Is it apprehension?

analyzed: ahosvit karaṇam  uta yojanā
translated: Or is it a cause?🔽Or is it a combination?

analyzed: atha samāropaḥ  tatra su ābhāsam anartham artha katham gṛhṇīyāt
translated: Or is it superimposition?

analyzed: kuryāt vā vikalpaḥ
translated: How could an option apprehend or produce an object that does not have its own appearance?

original: na hi nīlaṃ pītaṃ śakyaṃ grahītuṃ kartuṃ vā śilpakuśalenāpi /🔽nāpyagṛhītena svalakṣaṇena svākāraṃ yojayitumarhati vikalpaḥ /
analyzed: na hi nīlam pītam śakyam grahītum kartum vā śilpa kuśalena api  na api agṛhītena sva lakṣaṇena sva ākāram yojayitum arhati vikalpaḥ
translated: For even a skilled craftsman cannot apprehend or produce blue as yellow.🔽Nor can an option combine its own form with an object that has not been apprehended.

analyzed: na ca sva lakṣaṇam vikalpa grahaṇa gocaraḥ
translated: And the specific characteristic is not the domain of apprehension by an option.

analyzed: na ca sva ākāram anartham artham āropayati
translated: And it does not superimpose an object that does not have its own form onto its own form.

analyzed: na tāvat agṛhīta sva ākāraḥ śakyaḥ āropayitum iti tad grahaṇam eṣitavyam
translated: First, it is not possible to superimpose what has not been apprehended as its own form, so its apprehension must be sought.

analyzed: tatra kim gṛhītvā āropayati
translated: Having apprehended what there, does it superimpose?

analyzed: atha yadā eva sva ākāram gṛhṇāti tadā eva āropayati
translated: Or when it just apprehends its own form, then it superimposes?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

original: na hi kṣaṇikaṃ vikalpavijñānaṃ kramavantau grahaṇasamāropau kartumarhati /
analyzed: na hi kṣaṇikam vikalpa vijñānam kramavantau grahaṇa samāropau kartum arhati
translated: For an option consciousness, which is momentary, cannot perform the two acts of apprehending and superimposing in sequence.

original: uttarasmiṃstu kalpe 'vikalpasvasaṃvedanapratyakṣādvikalpākārādahaṅkārāspadādanahaṅkārāspadaḥ samāropyamāṇo vikalpena svagocaro na śakyo 'bhinnaḥ 🔽pratipattum /
analyzed: uttarasmin tu kalpe vikalpa sva saṃvedana pratyakṣāt vikalpa ākārāt ahaṅkāra āspadāt anahaṅkāra āspadaḥ samāropyamāṇaḥ vikalpena sva gocaraḥ na śakyaḥ bhinnaḥ  / pratipattum
translated: But in the latter interpretation, what is superimposed by conceptual cognition, which is not the basis of ego-consciousness, is not able to be apprehended as non-different from the object of its own [cognition], which is the basis of ego-consciousness and is the direct perception of non-conceptual self-awareness.

analyzed: nā api bāhya sva lakṣaṇaka tvena śakyaḥ pratipattum
translated: Nor is it possible to apprehend it as external and having its own characteristic.

analyzed: vikalpa ākāre sva lakṣaṇasya bāhyasya apratibhāsanāt iti
translated: Because the external thing, which is the own characteristic, does not appear in the form of conceptual cognition.

analyzed: bācaspatiḥ api adhyavasāyam pratikṣipati  anartham su ābhāsam artham adhyavasyati iti nirvacanīyam etat
translated: Vācaspati also rejects ascertainment.🔽This statement it ascertains a non-existent object as existent is inexplicable.

analyzed: nanu ayam āropayati iti kim vikalpasya svarūpa anubhavaḥ eva āropaḥ
translated: But if it superimposes this [object], is superimposition the mere experience of the form of conceptual cognition?

analyzed: uta vyāpāra antaram svarūpa anubhavāt
translated: Or is it a different operation from the experience of its own form?

analyzed: na tāvat pūrvaḥ kalpaḥ
translated: The first alternative is not correct.

analyzed: anubhava samāropayoḥ vikalpa avikalpa rūpa tayā drava kaṭhina vat tādātmya anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the experience and superimposition are not possible as having the same nature as fluidity and solidity, due to their being in the form of conceptual and non-conceptual [cognitions].

analyzed: vyāpāra antara tve tu kramaḥ samāna kālatā vā
translated: If [superimposition] is a different operation, then is it sequential or simultaneous?

analyzed: na tāvat kramaḥ
translated: It is not sequential.

analyzed: kṣaṇikasya vijñānasya kramavat vyāpāra ayogāt
translated: Because for momentary consciousness, a sequential operation is not possible.

original: akṣaṇikavādināmapi buddhikarmaṇorviramya vyāpārānupapatteḥ na kramavadvyāpārasaṃbhavaḥ /🔽anubhavasamāropau samānakālāviti cet /
analyzed: akṣaṇika vādinām api buddhi karmaṇoḥ viramya vyāpāra anupapatteḥ na krama vat vyāpāra saṃbhavaḥ  anubhava samāropau samāna kālau iti ced
translated: Even for the proponents of the non-momentary, the operation of cognition and action cannot occur after cessation, so the operation cannot occur in sequence.🔽If it is argued that experience and superimposition occur simultaneously,

analyzed: bhavatu samāna kāla tvam kevalam
translated: let them be simultaneous.

analyzed: ātmā svabhāva sthitaḥ eva vedyaḥ
translated: The self is known while remaining in its own nature.

analyzed: para bhāvena vedane svarūpa vedanā anupapatteḥ
translated: If it were known through another's nature, the knowledge of its own nature would be impossible.

analyzed: tathā ca ātmā jñānasya grāhya grāhaka ākāraḥ nubhūtaḥ rthaḥ ca samāropitaḥ
translated: Thus, the self is experienced in the form of the object of knowledge and the knower, and the object is superimposed.

original: na tvātmā vedyamānaḥ samāropito nārthaḥ samāropyamāṇaḥ pratyakṣavedyaḥ /
analyzed: na tu ātmā vedyamānaḥ samāropitaḥ na arthaḥ samāropyamāṇaḥ pratyakṣa vedyaḥ
translated: But the self, while being known, is not superimposed, and the superimposed object is not directly perceptible.

original: sa ca samāropaḥ sato 'sato vā grahaṇameva /
analyzed: sa ca samāropaḥ sataḥ sataḥ vā grahaṇam eva
translated: And that superimposition is just the apprehension of what exists or does not exist.

analyzed: na ca jñāna atiriktasya grahaṇam saṃbhavati iti upapāditam
translated: And it has been explained that the apprehension of anything other than cognition is impossible.

original: svapratibhāsasya bāhyādbhedāgraho bāhyasamāropastato bāhye vṛttiriti cet /
analyzed: sva pratibhāsasya bāhyāt bheda agrahaḥ bāhya samāropaḥ tatas bāhye vṛttiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the non-apprehension of the difference between one's own appearance and the external is the superimposition of the external, and from that there is activity towards the external,

original: sa kiṃ gṛhyamāṇe bāhye na vā /
analyzed: sa kim gṛhyamāṇe bāhye na vā
translated: is that when the external is being apprehended or not?

analyzed: na tāvat gṛhyamāṇe
translated: First, not when it is being apprehended.

analyzed: uktam hi etat na tad grahaṇam saṃbhavati iti
translated: For it has been said that the apprehension of that is impossible.

original: agṛhyamāṇe tu bhedāgrahe na pravṛttiniyamaḥ syāt /
analyzed: agṛhyamāṇe tu bheda agrahe na pravṛtti niyamaḥ syāt
translated: But if the non-apprehension of difference is when it is not being apprehended, there would be no restriction of activity.

analyzed: anyeṣām api tadānīm agrahāt anyatra api pravṛtti prasaṅgāt iti
translated: Because, even for others, there would be the undesirable consequence of engagement elsewhere due to non-apprehension at that time.

original: tasmād yathā yathāyamadhyavasāyaścintyate tathā tathā viśīryata eva /🔽tathā vikalpāropābhimānagrahaniścayādayo 'pyadhyavasāyavat svākāraparyavasitā eva sphuranto bāhyasya vārtāmātramapi na
analyzed: tasmāt yathā yathā ayam adhyavasāyaḥ cintyate tathā tathā viśīryate eva  tathā vikalpa āropa abhimāna graha niścaya ādayaḥ pi adhyavasāya vat sva ākāra paryavasitāḥ eva sphurantaḥ bāhyasya vārtā mātram api na
translated: Therefore, as this determination is contemplated in various ways, it falls apart in various ways.🔽Similarly, conceptualization, superimposition, conceit, apprehension, ascertainment, etc., like determination, manifest as confined to their own forms, and do not even know the mere existence of an external object.

original: Nibandh jānantītyadhyavasāyasvabhāvā eva śabdapravṛttimittabhede 'pi tatkathaṃ yuktyāgamabahirbhūto 'nātmasphuraṇamācakṣīta /
analyzed: jānanti iti adhyavasāya svabhāvāḥ eva śabda pravṛtti mitta bhede tat katham yukti āgama bahis bhūtaḥ na ātma sphuraṇam ācakṣīta
translated: Thus, they are of the nature of determination itself. Even in the difference of the basis for the application of words, how can one who is outside of reasoning and scripture speak of the manifestation of what is not the self?

original: nanvevaṃ vikalpādīnāmasaṃbhave saṃbhave 'pyanātmaprakāśakatvānabhyupagame sarvajanaprasiddhavidhipratiṣedhavyavahārocchedaprasaṅga iti lokavirodhaḥ🔽vikalpa ityadhyavasāyaityāropa ityabhimāna iti graha iti niścaya ityādikaṃ śāstre pratipadaṃ pratipāditam /
analyzed: nanu evam vikalpa ādīnām asaṃbhave saṃbhave pi anātma prakāśaka tva anabhyupagame sarva jana prasiddha vidhi pratiṣedha vyavahāra uccheda prasaṅgaḥ iti loka virodhaḥ  vikalpaḥ iti adhyavasāya eti āropaḥ iti abhimānaḥ iti grahaḥ iti niścayaḥ iti ādikam śāstre pratipadam pratipāditam
translated: If conceptualization, etc. are impossible in this way, or even if they are possible, and if it is not accepted that they illuminate what is not the self, then there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of the well-known practical usage of injunctions and prohibitions for all people. Thus, there is contradiction with the world.🔽In the scriptures, terms like conceptualization, determination, superimposition, conceit, apprehension, ascertainment, etc. are taught at every step.

analyzed: tat siddham ca bahis artha ādikam abhyupagatam iti ācārya virodhaḥ
translated: And it is established that external objects, etc. are accepted. Thus, there is contradiction with the teacher.

analyzed: nyāya virodhaḥ ca
translated: And there is contradiction with logic.

original: tathā hi savareva prakārairaviparītasvarūpasaṃvedanād bhrānteratyantamabhāvaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā hi prakāraiḥ aviparīta sva rūpa saṃvedanāt bhrānteḥ atyantam abhāvaḥ syāt
translated: For thus, because of the non-erroneous cognition of one's own nature by all means, error would be absolutely absent.

original: tataśca sarvasattvāḥ sadaiva samyaksambuddhā bhaveyuḥ /🔽vikalpitā buddhirbhrāntiḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca sarva sattvāḥ sadā eva samyaksambuddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ  vikalpitā buddhiḥ bhrāntiḥ
translated: And from that, all beings would always be perfectly enlightened Buddhas.

analyzed: sva pratibhāse na ṛthe rtha adhyavasāyāt iti ced  katham avasīyamānaḥ tayā saḥ rthaḥ na prakāśate
translated: If it is said that the conceptual cognition is error,🔽if so, how is that object which is being ascertained by it not manifested?

original: prakāśamāno vā kathamasau tasyāṃ na prakāśate /
analyzed: prakāśamānaḥ vā katham asau tasyām na prakāśate
translated: Or if it is manifested, how is it not manifested in that [conceptual cognition]?

analyzed: atha prakāśate eva
translated: But if it is indeed manifested,

analyzed: tadā arthasya tādātmya prasaṅgaḥ  asati ca arthe sārasyāt abhūt māndhātā
translated: there would be the consequence that the object is of the same nature as that [conceptual cognition].

analyzed: bhaviṣyati śaṅkhaḥ sti ātmā
translated: And if the object does not exist, there would be the cognition of what did not exist, such as Māndhātṛ existed, Śaṅkha will exist, the self exists,

original: nityaḥ śabda iti sarvātmanā ca niścayaḥ syāt /
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ iti sarva ātmanā ca niścayaḥ syāt
translated: and sound is eternal, and there would be the ascertainment of all aspects.

original: gauriti spaṣṭena ca svena lakṣaṇena prakāśeta /
analyzed: gauḥ iti spaṣṭena ca svena lakṣaṇena prakāśeta
translated: And cow would be manifested by its own clear characteristic.

original: svalakṣaṇe ca saṅketāyogāt vikalpikaiva sā buddhirna syāt /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇe ca saṅketa ayogāt vikalpikā eva sā buddhiḥ na syāt
translated: And because it is impossible to make a convention regarding its own characteristic, that cognition would be only conceptual, not perception.

original: tasmādaśeṣagovyaktisādhāraṇena gotvena gobuddhiralīkena sābhilāpena viplavāt prakhyātīti tathā prakāśanamasyā gavārthāvasāya ityeṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt aśeṣa go vyakti sādhāraṇena go tvena go buddhiḥ alīkena sa abhilāpena viplavāt prakhyāti iti tathā prakāśanam asyāḥ gava artha avasāye iti eṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, because the cognition of a cow is erroneous due to the unreal verbal designation by the universal cowness, which is common to all individual cows, it should be accepted that the manifestation of that [cognition] as such is the ascertainment of the object cow.

analyzed: evam hi ete doṣāḥ na syuḥ
translated: For in this way, these faults would not occur.

analyzed: apratibhāsamānasya api sva lakṣaṇasya bhrāntyā avasāyāt iti
translated: Because even the non-appearing specific characteristic is ascertained by error.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this, we reply:

analyzed: na tāvat loka śāstra virodhau
translated: First, there is no contradiction with worldly convention or scripture.

analyzed: agṛhīte pi bāhye pravṛtti nivṛtti ādi samarthanāt sva para vādi duratikrama adhyavasāya svarūpa nirvacanāt
translated: Because even without apprehending the external, engagement, disengagement, etc. are possible, and because the nature of the determination that is difficult to surpass for one's own and others' positions is defined.

analyzed: nyāya virodhasya tu na asti
translated: There is not even a trace of contradiction with logic.

original: tathā hi kā punariyaṃ bhrāntirasatkhyātiratasmiṃstadgraho vā yadabhāvādidānīmeva muktirāsajyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kā punar iyam bhrāntiḥ asat khyātiḥ a tasmin tad grahaḥ vā yad abhāvāt idānīm eva muktiḥ āsajyate
translated: For, what is this error, the appearance of the non-existent or the apprehension of that as something else, due to the absence of which liberation is now being claimed?

analyzed: na tāvat ādyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: First, this position is not tenable.

analyzed: asat khyāteḥ pratyākhyānāt
translated: Because the appearance of the non-existent has been refuted.

original: yadāhurguravaḥ🔽yasya svarūpanirbhāso bādhakād yadi tanna sat /🔽bādhake 'pi ka āśvāsaḥ svarūpāntarabhāsini //
analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ  yasya sva rūpa nirbhāsaḥ bādhakāt yadi tat na sat  bādhake pi kaḥ āśvāsaḥ sva rūpa antara bhāsini
translated: As the teachers have said:🔽If the appearance of one's own nature is not real due to contradiction,🔽even in the appearance of another form, what assurance is there?

analyzed: anya sva rūpa upanayāt tad sva rūpa nivāraṇam
translated: The exclusion of one's own nature by the superimposition of another nature,

original: tatrāpi saṃśayo jātaḥ pūrvabādhopalabdhitaḥ //🔽iyamevāgrahe bādhā nādyajasyāparā yadi /
analyzed: tatra api saṃśayaḥ jātaḥ pūrva bādhā upalabdhitaḥ  iyam eva agrahe bādhā na ādi ajasya aparā yadi
translated: Even there, doubt arises due to the perception of the contradiction of the prior [cognition].

analyzed: asya pūrvā eva bhavatu rūpa nirbhāsanam samam
translated: If there is no other contradiction in the apprehension of this [object], then let the prior [cognition] be of the same form as this [later cognition].

original: nānyā va bhāvinītyatra pramāṇaṃ kiñcidasti vaḥ /
analyzed: na anyā vaḥ bhāvinī iti atra pramāṇam kiñcid asti vaḥ
translated: There is no evidence whatsoever that the future [cognition] is different [from the present one].

original: api svarūpanirbhāse yadā bādhakasaṃbhavaḥ // 🔽Nibandh 🔽anirbhāse svarūpasya hetuśodhanaviplave /
analyzed: api sva rūpa nirbhāse yadā bādhaka saṃbhavaḥ  nibandh  a nirbhāse sva rūpasya hetu śodhana viplave
translated: Even when there is a possibility of contradiction in the appearance of one's own form,

analyzed: bādha śaṅkā vinirbhāse pi evam ced viplavaḥ mahān iti
translated: [The opponent says:] If there is a doubt of contradiction even in the appearance of one's own form, which is free from the disturbance of the cause of the appearance of the form, then there is a great disturbance.

original: śāstre ca atasmiṃstadgrahāt svapratibhāse 'narthe 'rthādhyavasāyād dṛśyavikalpyayorekīkaraṇād bhrāntiruktā /
analyzed: śāstre ca a tasmin tad grahāt sva pratibhāse na arthe rtha adhyavasāyāt dṛśya vikalpyayoḥ ekīkaraṇāt bhrāntiḥ uktā
translated: And in the treatise, it is said that error is due to grasping that as this which is not that, due to the ascertainment of an object in one's own appearance which is not an object, and due to making one of what is seen and what is imagined.

original: tāmayaṃ samarthayitumasamarthaḥ svātantryeṇālīkasphuraṇaṃ bhrāntiriti kāvyaṃ viracayya vistārayati //
analyzed: tām ayam samarthayitum asamarthaḥ svātantryeṇa alīka sphuraṇam bhrāntiḥ iti kāvyam viracayya vistārayati
translated: Being unable to establish that, he composes and elaborates the following poetry: The appearance of an illusion is error.

original: nanvatasmiṃstadgraho 'pi bhramaḥ svākāraparyavasitajñānādatirikto bahubhirbahudhā vicāryaṃ pratyākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: bhramaḥ sva ākāra paryavasita jñānāt atiriktaḥ bahubhiḥ bahudhā vicāryam pratyākhyātaḥ
translated: [The opponent says:] But the grasping of that as this which is not that is also an error, which has been refuted by many in many ways as being different from cognition that ends with its own form.🔽[The author says:]

original: tat kathaṃ tasminnapi pakṣe na bhrāntikṣatiryenedānīmeva muktiprasaṅgo na syāditi cet /
analyzed: tat katham tasmin api pakṣe na bhrānti kṣatiḥ yena idānīm eva mukti prasaṅgaḥ na syāt iti ced
translated: If it be asked, how then, even in that case, is there no defect in error, by which there would not be the contingency of liberation even now?

analyzed: tat etat bhagavataḥ bhāṣyakārasya mata vidveṣa viṣa vyākula vikrośita mati kātarayati kṛpā paravaśa dhiyaḥ
translated: This, indeed, the revered commentator's opinion, agitated by the poison of hatred of other views, greatly afflicts the mind of him who is devoted to compassion.

analyzed: tathā hi samanantara pratyaya bala āyāta sva pratibhāsa viśeṣa vedana mātrāt agṛhīte pi paratra pravṛtti ākṣepaḥ dhī avasāyaḥ
translated: For thus, from the mere experience of a particular appearance coming from the power of the immediately antecedent condition, even when not grasped in another, there is the projection of activity, which is determination.

analyzed: na ca asau pūrva ukta vāc jālaiḥ pratihantum śakyaḥ
translated: And that cannot be countered by the aforementioned nets of words.

analyzed: sarva prāṇabhṛtām pratyātma vidita tvāt
translated: Because it is known by every living being in one's own self.

analyzed: kaiścid api an udbhinna tvāt
translated: And because it is not manifested by anyone.

original: ayameva ca saṃsārastatkṣayo mokṣa iti kvedānīmeva tadvārtāpi /
analyzed: ayam eva ca saṃsāraḥ tad kṣayaḥ mokṣaḥ iti kva idānīm eva tad vārtā api
translated: And this very saṃsāra, its destruction is liberation - where is there even the news of that now?

original: tathā hi vicitrānādivāsanāvaśāt prabodhakapratyayaviśeṣāpekṣayā vikalpaḥ kenacidākāreṇopajāyamāna eva bahirmukhapravṛttyanukūlamarthakriyāsmaraṇābhilāṣādiprabandhamādhatte
analyzed: tathā hi vicitra anādi vāsanā vaśāt prabodhaka pratyaya viśeṣa apekṣayā vikalpaḥ kenacid ākāreṇa upajāyamānaḥ eva bahirmukha pravṛtti anukūlam arthakriyā smaraṇa abhilāṣa ādi prabandham ādhatte
translated: For thus, from the power of various beginningless latent impressions, depending on particular awakening conditions, imagination arises with some form, and immediately establishes a series of recollections and desires for the accomplishment of external activity that is favorable.

analyzed: tatas puruṣa artha kriyā arthinaḥ bahis artha anurūpāṇi pravṛtti nivṛtti avadhāraṇāni bhavanti
translated: Then, those who seek to accomplish human goals have determinations to engage in or desist from actions that correspond to external objects.

analyzed: pṛthagjana santāna jñāna kṣaṇānām tādṛśaḥ hetu phala bhāvasya niyata tvāt
translated: Because the relation of cause and effect between the moments of knowledge in the continuum of an ordinary person is determined in that way.

analyzed: aniścita artha saṃbandha vikalpa kāle pi sat asat tā nirṇaya ādi pravṛtti prasavaḥ
translated: Even at the time of conceptual cognition, which is uncertain about the connection with the object, there is the occurrence of engagement in determining existence or non-existence, etc.

analyzed: tatra yat ubhayathā pravṛtti sādhana sāmarthyam asya sva hetu bala āyātam ayam eva pravṛtti viṣaya tva āropaḥ dhyavasāya apara nāmā
translated: There, that which has the capacity to accomplish engagement in both ways, which arises by the power of its own cause, is itself the superimposition of the object of engagement, known by another name as ascertainment.

original: yathā candrādijñānasya bhrāntasyābhrāntasya vā taddarśanāvasāyajananameva grahaṇavyāpāraḥ /
analyzed: yathā candra ādi jñānasya bhrāntasya abhrāntasya vā tad darśana avasāya jananam eva grahaṇa vyāpāraḥ
translated: And just as the function of apprehending for the cognition of the moon, etc., whether mistaken or non-mistaken, is the generation of the ascertainment of seeing that,

analyzed: sva vid api iyam artha vid eva kāryataḥ draṣṭavyā iti
translated: according to the principle that even one's own cognition should be seen as an object-cognizer from the point of view of its effect,

analyzed: nyāyāt tathā vikalpasya api agniḥ atra ityādinā ākāreṇa utpadyamānasya pravṛtti ākṣepaka tvam eva bāhyāvasānam nāma
translated: in the same way, for a conceptual cognition also, which arises in the form fire is here, etc., the projection of engagement is itself the external ascertainment.

analyzed: yathā ca nirvikalpa dvi candra ādi ākāra tā eva tathā avasāya sādhanī
translated: And just as the form of non-conceptual cognition of two moons, etc., is itself the means of establishing ascertainment,

analyzed: evam avasāyasya api tādṛśa ākāra tā eva viṣaya antara vimukha pravṛtti sādhanī
translated: Thus, even the cognition of an object, which has such a form, is capable of producing activity that is averse to other objects.

original: nanu tathā ca tacca tena pratipādyate na ca tajjñāne tat prakāśata iti śapathenāpi na saṃpratyaya iti cet /
analyzed: nanu tathā ca tat ca tena pratipādyate na ca tad jñāne tat prakāśate iti śapathena api na saṃpratyayaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even under oath, there is no conviction that it is so, and that is conveyed by that, and that does not appear in the cognition of that,

original: asaṃbaddhametat /🔽na hyadhyavasāyād bāhyasya paṭādervastuno bādhakāvatārāt pūrvasandigdhavastubhāvasya
analyzed: asaṃbaddham etat  na hi adhyavasāyāt bāhyasya paṭa ādeḥ vastunaḥ bādhaka avatārāt pūrva sandigdha vastu bhāvasya
translated: this is irrelevant.🔽For, even if the external object like a cloth, which is doubtful as an object before the appearance of a sublating cognition,

original: kṣaṇikāderavastuno vā śaśaviṣāṇāderasphuraṇe 'pi siddhipratibandho brahmaṇāpi pratividhātuṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇika ādeḥ avastunaḥ vā śaśaviṣāṇa ādeḥ asphuraṇe siddhi pratibandhaḥ brahmaṇā api pratividhātum śakyaḥ
translated: or a non-entity like momentariness etc., or an unreal object like the horn of a hare etc., do not appear in the cognition of ascertainment, it is not possible for even Brahmā to obstruct the establishment of that object.

analyzed: dvividhaḥ hi viṣaya vyavahāraḥ
translated: For, the usage of an object is of two kinds.

analyzed: pratibhāsāt adhyavasāyāt ca
translated: From appearance and from ascertainment.

analyzed: tat iha pratibhāsa abhāve pi para apoḍha sva lakṣaṇa ādeḥ adhyavasāya mātreṇa viṣaya tvam uktam
translated: Here, even in the absence of appearance, the object is said to be only ascertained as the specific individuality excluded from others.

analyzed: sarvathā nirviṣaya tve pravṛtti nivṛtti ādi sakala vyavahāra uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: And if it were entirely devoid of an object, there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of all usage such as activity, inactivity etc.

original: tataśca tena ca tat pratipādyate na ca jñāne tatprakāśa iti saṅgatirastyeva /
analyzed: tatas ca tena ca tat pratipādyate na ca jñāne tad prakāśaḥ iti saṅgatiḥ asti eva
translated: Therefore, there is no connection at all with the statement that is conveyed by that, and that does not appear in the cognition of that.

analyzed: prakāśya prakāśaka bhāva abhāve pi adhyavasāya adhyavasāyaka bhāvena api viṣaya viṣayi bhāva upapatteḥ
translated: Even in the absence of the relation of the manifested and the manifester, the relation of the object and the subject is possible by the relation of the object of determination and the determiner.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: binding

original: nanu yadi nādhyavaseyapratītistadāgṛhīte 'pi svalakṣaṇādau pravṛttiriti sarvatrāviśeṣeṇa prasajyeta /
analyzed: nanu yadi na adhyavaseya pratītiḥ tadā agṛhīte sva lakṣaṇa ādau pravṛttiḥ iti sarvatra aviśeṣeṇa prasajyeta
translated: But if there is no cognition of the object of determination, then activity would occur even in the case of the unapprehended specific individuality, etc., and it would follow that there is no distinction anywhere.

analyzed: sarvatra agṛhīta tvena viśeṣa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no distinction in being unapprehended everywhere.

analyzed: tatas ca prāptiḥ api na abhimatasya niyamena iti anumānam api viplutam
translated: And therefore, even attainment would not occur invariably with respect to the desired object, and inference would also be overturned.

analyzed: atra brūmaḥ  yadi adhyavaseyam agṛhītam viśvam api agṛhītam
translated: To this we reply:🔽Even if the object of determination is unapprehended, and the entire universe is also unapprehended,

analyzed: tathā api niyata viṣayā eva pravṛttiḥ na sarvatra
translated: still activity occurs with respect to a specific object only, not everywhere.

analyzed: tathābhūta samanantara pratyaya bala āyāta niyata ākāra tayā niyata śakti tvāt vikalpasya
translated: Because imagination has a specific power due to the specific form determined by the force of the immediately preceding condition that is such.

analyzed: niyata śaktayaḥ bhāvāḥ hi pramāṇa pariniṣṭhita svabhāvāḥ
translated: For things with specific powers are the nature determined by valid cognition.

analyzed: na śakti sāṅkarya paryanuyoga bhājaḥ
translated: They do not fall under the objection of confusion of powers.

analyzed: asat utpatti vat sarvatra asattve hi bījāt aṅkurasya eva utpattiḥ
translated: Even though there is non-existence everywhere, like the production of what is non-existent, the sprout is produced only from the seed.

analyzed: tatra eva tasya śakteḥ pramāṇena nirūpaṇāt
translated: Because its power is determined there by valid cognition.

original: tathehāpi hutavahākārasya vikalpasya dāhapākādyarthakriyārthinastatsmaraṇavato hutavahaviṣayāyāmeva pravṛttau sāmarthyaṃ pramāṇapratītaṃ kathamatiprasaṅgabhāgi
analyzed: tathā iha api hutavaha ākārasya vikalpasya dāha pāka ādi arthakriyā arthinaḥ tad smaraṇavataḥ hutavaha viṣayāyām eva pravṛttau sāmarthyam pramāṇa pratītam katham atiprasaṅga bhāgi
translated: Similarly, here too, the capacity of the cognition having the form of fire, which is desirous of performing the function of burning, cooking, etc., and which is remembered, to operate only in relation to fire, is established by valid means of knowledge. How can there be over-extension?

analyzed: pratyāsatti cintāyām ca tāttvikasya api vahneḥ jvalat bhāsvara ākāra tvam vikalpa ullikhitasya api iti
translated: And in the consideration of proximity, even the real fire has the form of blazing and shining, and the form outlined by the cognition also has that form.

analyzed: tāvatā tatra eva pravartana śaktiḥ jvalana vikalpasya na jala ādau
translated: To that extent, the cognition of fire has the power to operate only in relation to fire, not in relation to water etc.

original: nanu ca sādṛśyāropeṇa kiṃ svākārasya bāhye svākāre vā bāhyasyāropaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca sādṛśya āropeṇa kim sva ākārasya bāhye sva ākāre vā bāhyasya āropaḥ
translated: But in the superimposition of similarity, is there the superimposition of one's own form on the external, or of the external on one's own form?

analyzed: ubhayathā api asaṅgati
translated: In both cases, there is incoherence.

analyzed: āropya āropa viṣayayoḥ su ākāra bāhayayoḥ dvayoḥ grahaṇa asaṃbhavāt iti ced
translated: Because it is not possible to apprehend both one's own form and the external, which are the superimposed and the basis of superimposition, respectively. If this is argued,

analyzed: na vayam āropeṇa pravṛttim brūmaḥ
translated: we do not say that there is operation by superimposition.

original: kiṃ tarhi / svavāsanāparipākavaśādupajāyamānaiva sā buddhirapaśyantyapi bāhayaṃ bāhaye pravṛttimātanotīti viplutaiva saṃsārātmikā ca /
analyzed: kim tarhi sva vāsanā paripāka vaśāt upajāyamānā eva sā buddhiḥ apaśyantī api bāhayam bāhaye pravṛttim ātanoti iti viplutā eva saṃsāra ātmikā ca
translated: Then what? That cognition, which arises by the ripening of one's own latent impressions, even without seeing the external, produces operation in relation to the external. Thus, it is deluded and has the nature of worldly existence.

analyzed: yat śāstram
translated: The scripture says:

analyzed: na jñāne tulyam utpattitaḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: The cognitions do not arise equally with knowledge.

analyzed: tathāvidhāyāḥ
translated: Of such a kind,

analyzed: iti tasmāt na rūpya ādi vat āropa dvāreṇa pravṛttiḥ api tu tathāvidha ākāra utpatti pratibaddha śakti niyamāt
translated: Therefore, the engagement is not by way of superimposition like silver, but rather by the restriction of the power to arise in such a form.

analyzed: na ca vicārakasya vastu adarśana niścayāt apravṛttiḥ saṅgacchate
translated: And it is not proper for the investigator to refrain from engagement due to the certainty of not seeing the object.

analyzed: darśane hi pravṛttiḥ artha kriyā arthi tayā
translated: Even in seeing, engagement is for the sake of the desired result.

analyzed: arthakriyā prāptiḥ ca vastu sattā niyame
translated: And the attainment of the result is due to the restriction of the existence of the object.

original: sa ca niyamo yathā darśanād vastupratibandhakṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca niyamaḥ yathā darśanāt vastu pratibandha kṛtaḥ
translated: And that restriction is like the restriction created by the connection with the object due to seeing.

original: tathā vikalpaviśeṣādapi pāramparyeṇa vastuprativastupratibandhakṛta ityadarśane 'pi adhyavasāyāt pravṛttiryujyata iti nānumānamanavasthitam
analyzed: tathā vikalpa viśeṣāt api pāramparyeṇa vastu prativastu pratibandha kṛtaḥ iti adarśane adhyavasāyāt pravṛttiḥ yujyate iti na anumānam anavasthitam
translated: In the same way, even from a particular conceptualization, it is created by the restriction of the object to the object through a series. Thus, engagement is proper even without seeing, due to ascertainment. Therefore, inference is not unestablished.🔽By this, it is shown that the objection that it is not cognized by that,

analyzed: etena tat ca na pratīyate  tena ca abheda ābhāsanam iti upālambho saṃbhavi iti upadarśitam
translated: and it appears as non-different is impossible.

analyzed: apratibhāse pi pravṛtti viṣayīkaraṇam iti abheda ādi niṣṭhāyāḥ darśita tvāt
translated: Because it has been shown that even without appearance, it is made the object of engagement by the ascertainment of non-difference, etc.

analyzed: tasmāt avicāra ramaṇīyaḥ tasmin tad grahe eva bhrāntiḥ āropa apara nāmā
translated: Therefore, the mere apprehension of that as this, which is delightful to the unreflective, is indeed error, otherwise known as superimposition.

analyzed: tad kṣayaḥ ca mokṣaḥ iti yuktam
translated: And the destruction of that is liberation. This is proper.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ
translated: As the teachers have said:

analyzed: tasmāt pravṛtteḥ ākṣepe vikalpa ākāra janmani
translated: Therefore, in the arising of the option form due to the projection of activity,

analyzed: mataḥ jala ādi āropaḥ satya asatya samaḥ ca saḥ
translated: The superimposition of water etc. is also considered to be the same in terms of truth and falsity.

original: tato yadyapi tattvena nāropo nāma kasyacit /
analyzed: tatas yadi api tattvena nā āropaḥ nāma kasyacid
translated: Therefore, even though in reality there is no superimposition of anything,

analyzed: vyavahāra kṛtaḥ tu eṣa pratiṣeddhum na śakyate
translated: This [superimposition] created by convention cannot be refuted.

analyzed: marīcau jala vat yāvat anātmani ātma kalpanam
translated: Just as water is superimposed on a mirage, the conception of self in what is non-self,

original: bhrama eva hi saṃsāro nirvāṇaṃ tattvasaṃsthitiḥ //
analyzed: bhramaḥ eva hi saṃsāraḥ nirvāṇam tattva saṃsthitiḥ
translated: Saṃsāra is indeed a delusion, Nirvāṇa is the state of reality.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: Bondage

original: tataśca yāvanna vicārasaṃbhavo bhavo 'yamanyaḥ śama ityayaṃ nayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca yāvat na vicāra saṃbhavaḥ bhavaḥ yam anyaḥ śamaḥ iti ayam nayaḥ
translated: And therefore, as long as there is no possibility of investigation, this existence is one, and this peace is another.

original: vicāralīlālalite tu mānase bhavaḥ śamo vā ka iheti kathyatām //
analyzed: vicāra līlā lalite tu mānase bhavaḥ śamaḥ vā kaḥ iha iti kathyatām
translated: But when the mind is delighted by the play of investigation, tell me, what is existence or peace here?

analyzed: tathā ārya maitreya nāthapādāḥ api
translated: Similarly, the venerable Maitreyanātha also

original: na cāntaraṃ kiṃcana vidyate 'nayoḥ sadarthavṛttyā śamajanmanoriha /
analyzed: na ca antaram kiṃcana vidyate nayoḥ sat artha vṛttyā śama janmanoḥ iha
translated: And there is not the slightest difference between these two in terms of the true meaning, between peace and birth here.

original: tathāpi janmakṣayato vidhīyate śamasya lābhaḥ śubhakarmakāriṇām //
analyzed: tathā api janma kṣayataḥ vidhīyate śamasya lābhaḥ śubha karma kāriṇām
translated: Nevertheless, the attainment of peace is enjoined for those who perform good actions due to the destruction of birth.

original: āryanāgārjunapādāśca🔽nirvāṇaṃ ca bhavaścaiva dvayameva na vidyate /
analyzed: ārya nāgārjuna pādāḥ ca  nirvāṇam ca bhavaḥ ca eva dvayam eva na vidyate
translated: And the venerable Nāgārjuna also🔽Nirvāṇa and existence - these two do not exist at all.

analyzed: parijñānam bhavasya eva nirvāṇam iti kathyate
translated: The thorough knowledge of existence itself is called Nirvāṇa.

analyzed: iti sarvaiḥ eva prakāśaiḥ aviparīta sva rūpa saṃvedane pi bhrānti vyavasthā saṃbhavāt asti saṃsāraḥ
translated: Thus, even though all cognitions perceive their own nature without error, the establishment of error is possible, so there is samsara.

original: yadapyuktaṃ vikalpasyāviṣayaśca bāhyam grahaṇaṃ cāsya śabdena saṃyojyeti vikalpatvamapi duryojam /
analyzed: yat api uktam vikalpasya aviṣayaḥ ca bāhyam grahaṇam ca asya śabdena saṃyojya iti vikalpa tvam api duryojam
translated: And what was said - that the external object is not the content of conceptual cognition, and that it is connected with sound - the nature of conceptual cognition is also difficult to connect.

original: ātmani ca śabdayojanā nāstīti vikalpo nāma nāstyeva /
analyzed: ātmani ca śabda yojanā nā asti iti vikalpaḥ nāma nā asti eva
translated: And there is no connection with sound in the self, so conceptual cognition does not exist at all.

analyzed: tat kasya vikalpa cintā iti
translated: Then what is the point of thinking about conceptual cognition?

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this we reply:

original: ihāgniratretyadhyavasāyo yathā kāyikīṃ vṛttiṃ prasūte tathāgnirmayā pratīyata iti vācikīmapi prasūte /
analyzed: iha agniḥ atrā iti adhyavasāyaḥ yathā kāyikīm vṛttim prasūte tathā agniḥ mayā pratīyate iti vācikīm api prasūte
translated: Just as the determination fire is here gives rise to bodily activity, so too does fire is cognized by me give rise to verbal activity.

analyzed: etad ākāra anuvyavasāya rūpām mānasīm api prasavati
translated: And it also gives rise to mental activity in the form of a subsequent determination with that form.

original: evaṃ ca sati yathā vikalpenāyamartho gṛhīta iti niścayaḥ /🔽tathā śabdena saṃyojya gṛhīta ityapi /
analyzed: evam ca sati yathā vikalpena ayam arthaḥ gṛhītaḥ iti niścayaḥ  tathā śabdena saṃyojya gṛhītaḥ iti api
translated: And in this case, just as there is the certainty this object is grasped by conceptual cognition,🔽so too is there the certainty it is grasped by being connected with sound.

analyzed: artha ākāra leśa vat śabda ākārasya api sphuraṇāt
translated: Because even a part of the form of the object appears in the form of sound.

analyzed: tasmāt artha graha abhimānavān mānavaḥ tāvat abhidhāna saṃyukta grahaṇa abhimānavān api iti avasāya anurodhāt eva vikalpa vyavasthā na tattvataḥ
translated: Therefore, a human being who has the conceit of apprehending an object, even though he has the conceit of apprehending an object connected with a word, the determination of conceptual cognition is only in accordance with the ascertainment, not in reality.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ
translated: As the teachers say:

original: na śabdaiḥ saṃsargaḥ kvacidapi bahirvā manasi vā
analyzed: na śabdaiḥ saṃsargaḥ kvacid api bahis vā manasi vā
translated: Nowhere, either externally or in the mind, is there any connection with words.

analyzed: kṣara ākāra ākīrṇaḥ sphurati punar artha ākṛti lavaḥ
translated: Again, a mere form of the object appears, filled with the form of letters.

analyzed: ubhau api ākārau yat api dhiyaḥ eva adhyavasitiḥ
translated: Even though both forms are determined only by the cognition itself,

original: vidhatte tau bāhye vacasi ca vikalpasthitirataḥ //
analyzed: vidhatte tau bāhye vacasi ca vikalpa sthitiḥ atas
translated: it establishes them as external and in speech. Thus, conceptual cognition is established.

original: abhāne pratibhāne vā na cāropo 'pi kasyacit /
analyzed: a bhāne pratibhāne vā na kasyacid
translated: Even in the absence or appearance of something, there is no superimposition of anything.

original: pratītyotpādabhedena vyavasthāmātramīdṛśam //🔽nirvikalpādvikalpasya bhāve leśānukāriṇaḥ /🔽saṅketakārivacanād buddhyākāre viśeṣiṇi //
analyzed: pratītya utpāda bhedena vyavasthā mātram īdṛśam  nirvikalpāt vikalpasya bhāve leśa anukāriṇaḥ  saṅketa kāri vacanāt buddhi ākāre viśeṣiṇi
translated: This kind of establishment is only by the distinction of dependent origination.🔽When there is the appearance of conceptual cognition, which is slightly similar to the non-conceptual,

original: Nibandh 🔽saṅketaḥ kṛta ityāsthā tādṛk śabdaśrutau punaḥ /
analyzed: nibandh  saṅketaḥ kṛtaḥ iti āsthā tādṛś śabda śrutau punar
translated: in the particular form of cognition, due to the statement of the one who makes the convention,🔽The convention is made - this is the belief. Upon hearing such a word again,
the determination of the expressible entity is in the form of the cognition that is impelled by engagement.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: tasmād vastu vā ghaṭapaṭādi sandigdhavastu vā sādhakabādhakātikrāntam /
analyzed: tasmāt vastu vā ghaṭa paṭa ādi sandigdha vastu vā sādhaka bādhaka atikrāntam
translated: Therefore, either an object such as a pot or cloth, or a doubtful object beyond proof and refutation,

analyzed: avastu vā ātma diś kāla akṣaṇika ādikam adhyavasitam iti
translated: The non-existent is that which is determined as not having the characteristics of self, direction, time, etc.

analyzed: apratibhāse pi pravṛtti viṣayīkṛtam iti arthaḥ
translated: Even when there is no appearance, it is the object of engagement. This is the meaning.

analyzed: ayam eva ca āropa ekīkaraṇa adhyavasāya abheda graha ādīnām arthaḥ sarvatra śāstre boddhavyaḥ
translated: And this meaning of superimposition, determination, non-distinction, grasping, etc. should be understood everywhere in the treatise.

original: tasmādadhyavasāyasyākāraviśeṣayogādagṛhīte 'pi pravartanayogyatā nāma yo dharmastayā bāhyādhyavasāyayorgrāhyagrāhakabhāvaścet saṃvṛttyā duṣpariharaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt adhyavasāyasya ākāra viśeṣa yogāt agṛhīte pi pravartana yogya tā nāma yaḥ dharmaḥ tayā bāhya adhyavasāyayoḥ grāhya grāhaka bhāvaḥ ced saṃvṛttyā duṣpariharaḥ
translated: Therefore, because of the connection with a specific form of determination, even when not grasped, there is a property called suitability for engagement. If there is the relation of grasped and grasper between the external determination and that [suitability], it is difficult to avoid in terms of conventional truth.

original: tadā viṣayiviṣayabhāvo 'pi labdha ityadhyavasāyamātreṇa viṣayaviṣayitvamuktamiti yuktam /
analyzed: tadā viṣayi viṣaya bhāvaḥ labdhaḥ iti adhyavasāya mātreṇa viṣaya viṣayi tvam uktam iti yuktam
translated: Then, the relation of object and subject is also obtained. Therefore, it is appropriate to say that the object and subject relation is by determination alone.

analyzed: yat āha alaṅkāra kāraḥ
translated: As the author of the Alamkara says:

analyzed: katham tad viṣaya tvam tatra pravartanāt iti
translated: How can it be the object of that [determination]? Because it engages in that.

original: etena yaduktam kathamavasīyamānastayātmārtho na prakāśyata ityādi /
analyzed: etena yat uktam katham avasīyamānaḥ tayā ātmārthaḥ na prakāśyate ityādi
translated: By this, what was said - How is the object of that determination not manifested? etc. -

analyzed: tat nirastam
translated: is refuted.

analyzed: tad aprakāśe tad adhyavasāyasya vyavasthāpita tvāt
translated: Because even when that [object] is not manifested, determination of that [object] is established.

analyzed: asati ca arthe sā na syāt iti api ayuktam
translated: And it is also incorrect to say that if the object does not exist, that [determination] would not occur.

analyzed: ātma ādeḥ adhyavaseyasya pratibhāsa pratikṣepe buddhyā saha tādātmya abhāvāt
translated: Because when the appearance of the object to be ascertained, such as the self, is rejected, there is no identity with the intellect.

analyzed: na ca sarva ākāra niścaya prasaṅga doṣaḥ saṅgataḥ
translated: And the fault of the consequence of the ascertainment of all aspects is not relevant.

analyzed: sarva ākāra niścayaḥ hi sarveṣu ākāreṣu pravṛtti kāraka tva ātmā niruktaḥ
translated: For the ascertainment of all aspects is defined as having the nature of causing engagement in all aspects.

original: na caikākārollekhino vikalpasyākārāntare pravartanaśaktiranubhavaviṣaya iti kutaḥ śabdapramāṇāntarānapekṣeti yuktam /
analyzed: na ca eka ākāra ullekhinaḥ vikalpasya ākāra antare pravartana śaktiḥ anubhava viṣayaḥ iti kutas śabda pramāṇa antara anapekṣā iti yuktam
translated: And it is not the case that an option that manifests as a single aspect has the power to engage in another aspect, which is the object of experience. Therefore, it is reasonable that it does not depend on other means of knowledge such as words.

analyzed: tatra nirvikalpakam spaṣṭa pratibhāsa tvāt grāhakam vyavasthāpyate
translated: In that case, the non-conceptual is established as the apprehender because of its clear appearance.

analyzed: vikalpaḥ tu spaṣṭa eka vyāvṛtti ullekhāt āropaka ādi vyavahāra bhājanam
translated: But the conceptual is the basis for the usage of superimposition because of its manifestation as a clear, single exclusion.

original: yathā ca bāhye sati kvacid bhramavyavasthā tathāntarnaye 'pi sarvatra /
analyzed: yathā ca bāhye sati kvacid bhrama vyavasthā tathā antar naye sarvatra
translated: And just as there is the establishment of error somewhere when there is an external object, so it is everywhere in the internalist system as well.

original: kevalaṃ bahirmukhapravṛtyapekṣayā kriyamāṇo nātmani kaścid bhrama ityuktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kevalam bahirmukha pravṛti apekṣayā kriyamāṇaḥ na ātmani kaścid bhramaḥ iti uktam bhavati
translated: And it is said that when it is done in relation to external engagement, there is no error in the self.

analyzed: na ca go sva lakṣaṇa prakāśa avakāśaḥ
translated: And there is no opportunity for the manifestation of the individual characteristic of the cow.

analyzed: su ākārasya eva sphuraṇāt
translated: Because only its own aspect shines.

analyzed: sva lakṣaṇe ca saṃketa ayogāt
translated: And because a convention is not possible with regard to the individual characteristic.

original: vikalpikaiva na syāditi tu svarūpāpekṣayā siddhasādhanam /
analyzed: vikalpikā eva na syāt iti tu svarūpa apekṣayā siddha sādhanam
translated: But if it is argued that it would not be conceptual at all, that is a case of proving what is already established, from the point of view of its own nature.

analyzed: bāhya apekṣayā tu adhyavasāya vat vikalpikā eva sā buddhiḥ tathā
translated: But from the point of view of the external object, that cognition is conceptual, like determination, in the same way.

original: tasmādaśeṣagovyaktisādhāraṇena gotvena gobuddhiralīkena sābhilāpena viplavāt prakhyātīti tathā prakhyānamasyā gavāvasāya ityeṣṭavyamityapi🔽caraṇamardanādinā pratyavasthāne 'pi yuktiśāstrabahirbhūtatvādetadabhāve 'pi kathitadoṣapradhvaṃsāt /
analyzed: tasmāt aśeṣa go vyakti sādhāraṇena go tvena go buddhiḥ alīkena sa abhilāpena viplavāt prakhyāti iti tathā prakhyānam asyāḥ gavā avasāyaḥ iti eṣṭavyam iti api  caraṇa mardana ādinā pratyavasthāne pi yukti śāstra bahis bhūta tvāt etad abhāve pi kathita doṣa pradhvaṃsāt
translated: Therefore, because the cognition of a cow is erroneous due to the unreal verbal designation along with the universal cowness, which is common to all individual cows, it should be accepted that the manifestation of that [cognition] as a cow is the determination of a cow.🔽Even if it is refuted by arguments such as the crushing of feet, this [cognition] is outside the bounds of logic. Therefore, even in the absence of that [universal], the previously stated faults are removed.

original: na hi vikalpabuddhāvalīkākārasphuraṇameva bāhyasyādhyabasāya iti kācidarthasaṅgatiḥ /
analyzed: na hi vikalpa buddhā valīka ākāra sphuraṇam eva bāhyasya adhyabasāye iti kācid artha saṅgatiḥ
translated: For there is no logical connection between the manifestation of an unreal form in a conceptual cognition and the determination of an external object.

analyzed: arthasya iti saṃbandha anupapatte
translated: Because it is not possible to connect the cognition with the object.

analyzed: buddheḥ atra krama abhāvāt pratyakṣa tā eva
translated: Because there is no sequence in the cognition, it is itself perception.

analyzed: katham adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: How is there determination?

original: apratibhāsamānasyāpi svalakṣaṇasya bhrāntyāvasāyāditi tu na budhyāmahe /
analyzed: apratibhāsamānasya api sva lakṣaṇasya bhrāntyā avasāyāt iti tu na budhyāmahe
translated: We do not understand how there can be determination of an individual characteristic that does not appear, due to error.

analyzed: avasāyena hi pratibhāsaḥ paraḥ
translated: For if there is contact with that [individual characteristic] by determination, what other appearance is there?

analyzed: tad vittau api aspaṣṭa tvāt adhyavasāyaḥ iti api ayuktam
translated: Even if that [object] is cognized, it is not clear, so it is also unreasonable to say it is determination.

analyzed: tad rūpa vittau aspaṣṭa tvasya eva abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no lack of clarity in the cognition of that form.

analyzed: jātaḥ nāma āśrayaḥ nyonyaḥ cetasām tasya vastunaḥ
translated: The basis of the mind is said to be mutually different for each object.

analyzed: ekasya eva kutas rūpam bhinna ākāra avabhāsi yat  nibandh
translated: How can a single object have a form that appears in different aspects?🔽The author of the commentary

analyzed: iti ācāryaḥ smaryatām
translated: should be remembered.

analyzed: na ca tadā asau bhrāntiḥ bhavitum arhati
translated: And that cannot be a delusion at that time.

analyzed: vastu svarūpasya eva nirbhāsāt
translated: Because the form of the object itself appears.

analyzed: alīka vṛtteḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is because of the occurrence of the unreal,

analyzed: sā eva astu
translated: let that [unreal] be so.

analyzed: bāhyasya a sphurataḥ dhī avasāyaḥ katham
translated: How can there be determination of an external object that does not appear?

original: saiva sa iti cet /🔽alīkamidamiti viduṣo bāhyādhyavasāyavyasthābhāvāt /
analyzed: sā eva saḥ iti ced  alīkam idam iti viduṣaḥ bāhya adhyavasāya vyasthā bhāvāt
translated: If it is said that that [unreal] itself is that [external object],🔽then for one who knows this is unreal, there is no establishment of determination of an external object,

analyzed: bāhya āsphuraṇāt tad apratibaddha tvāt ca
translated: because the external object does not appear and because [the unreal] is not bound to that [external object].

analyzed: pratibandhe pi tasya ipi syāt
translated: Even if there is a connection, it would be [bound to the unreal],

analyzed: na punar tad adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: but it is not the determination of that [external object].

analyzed: tad asphuraṇa sphuraṇayoḥ api tad ayogāt iti alam ati nirbandhena
translated: Because even if there is non-appearance and appearance of that [external object], it is not possible. Thus, let us stop this insistence.

analyzed: tat evam apratibhāsinaḥ pi vipakṣāt adhyavasāya mātra siddhāt eva vyāvṛttaḥ doṣa traya nirmuktaḥ prakāśamāna tā ātmakaḥ hetuḥ yāvat prakāśa avadhi jñāna ātmaka citra ākāra cakrasya ekatvam  sādhayati eva
translated: Thus, even though it does not appear, the reason, which is free from the three faults, is established merely by the determination of the exclusion from the dissimilar class, and it proves the oneness of the wheel of variegated forms, which is of the nature of cognition limited by the extent of manifestation.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ  bhāsate yat tat ekam tat yathā citre sita ākṛtiḥ
translated: It is just as the teachers have said:🔽What appears is one, like the white form in a picture.

original: bhāsate cākhilaṃ citraṃ pītaśītasukhādikam //🔽nātrāsiddhiḥ prakāśasya citre dharmiṇi darśanāt /
analyzed: bhāsate ca akhilam citram pīta śīta sukha ādikam  na atra asiddhiḥ prakāśasya citre dharmiṇi darśanāt
translated: And the entire picture appears as yellow, cold, pleasant, etc.🔽Here there is no non-establishment, because manifestation is seen in the picture, which is the subject.

analyzed: na ca sādhya viyukta tvam dṛṣṭāntasya api dṛśyate
translated: And the example is also not seen to be devoid of the probandum.

analyzed: ekaika aṇu nimagna tvāt saṃvittiḥ na parasparam
translated: Because of being immersed in each individual atom, there is no mutual cognition.

analyzed: na ca eka aṇu prakāśaḥ sti sthūlam eva sphurati atas
translated: And there is no manifestation of a single atom. Therefore, only the gross appears.

analyzed: bāhya aṇūnām pratībhāsaḥ buddhiḥ ekā sthavīyasī
translated: The external atoms appear as a single gross cognition.

analyzed: jñāna aṇūnām kaḥ ekaḥ tu pratibhāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: But what will be the appearance of a single one among the atomic cognitions?

analyzed: tasmāt sthūla tayā vyāptaḥ nirbhāsaḥ tad nivṛttitaḥ
translated: Therefore, the appearance, which is pervaded by grossness, is removed by the removal of that.

analyzed: nivartamānaḥ na ekasmāt ekatve viniyamyate
translated: The one, which is removed from the many, is restricted to oneness.

analyzed: yathā sajātīya matāt bhāgāt bheda nirākriyā
translated: Just as the denial of difference from a part of the accepted homogeneous thing,

analyzed: anābhāsa prasaṅgena vijātīya matāt tathā
translated: And in the same way, the dissimilar opinion is due to the connection with non-manifestation.

original: tannāstu sādhyo dṛṣṭānto na ca śaṅkāviparyaye /
analyzed: tat nā astu sādhyaḥ dṛṣṭāntaḥ na ca śaṅkā viparyaye
translated: Therefore, the example is not to be proved, and there is no doubt in the opposite.

analyzed: atas nirdoṣataḥ hetoḥ citra advaita vyavasthitiḥ
translated: Therefore, due to the faultless reason, the establishment of non-duality in the variegated [appearance] is correct.

analyzed: saṃgraha ślokaḥ ca
translated: And the summarizing verse:

analyzed: eka tvena yathā āptimān abhimataḥ bhāsaḥ tathā vyāpyate
translated: As the object of attainment is accepted as one, it is pervaded in that way.

original: sthaulyenāpyaṇuśo na hi kvacididaṃ svapne 'pi nirbhāsanam /
analyzed: sthaulyena api aṇuśas na hi kvacid idam svapne nirbhāsanam
translated: In grossness, not even in a dream is this appearance seen as atomically distinct anywhere.

analyzed: tena pratyaṇu bhedanā iti uparatam tad vyāpakasya atyayāt
translated: Therefore, due to the cessation of the pervasion of that by the destruction of each atom,

analyzed: eka tvena parītam ākṛti cayaḥ ca ayam vinirbhāsate
translated: This collection of forms appears as limited by oneness.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: nanu ca atra dṛṣṭānta dārṣṭāntikayoḥ ubhaya mātra api ekatvam pratyakṣataḥ numānāt ca viruddha dharma adhyāsa lakṣaṇāt pratihatam
translated: But here, the oneness of both the example and the exemplified is contradicted by the superimposition of contradictory properties, as indicated by perception and inference.

analyzed: tat katham anumānāt eka tva siddhiḥ iti ced
translated: So how is oneness established by inference? If so,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

analyzed: yat etat pratyakṣam bheda sādhakam upanīyate  tat kim nīla ādīnām anātma bhūtam ātma bhūtam
translated: This perception that is adduced as proving difference,🔽is it non-self-existent, self-existent,

analyzed: nibandh vā prathama pakṣe
translated: or related to the blue etc.? In the first case,

analyzed: āstām tāvat eṣām atas bheda siddhiḥ
translated: let alone the establishment of their difference from this.

analyzed: sattā mātram api na sidhyet
translated: Even mere existence would not be established.

original: sa hi nīlādiko 'rtho jaḍo vijñānāntarātmālīkasvabhāvo vā svīkartavyaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi nīla ādikaḥ rthaḥ jaḍaḥ vijñāna antarātmā alīka svabhāvaḥ vā svīkartavyaḥ
translated: For that object such as blue should be accepted as inert, or as having the nature of an illusion within another consciousness.

analyzed: triṣu api pakṣeṣu prakāśya prakāśaka bhāva abhāvaḥ
translated: In all three cases, there is an absence of the relation of illuminator and illuminated.

original: tathā hi jñānasya prakāśakatvaṃ nāma kiṃ vidyamānatvaṃ vyāpārāveśo vā /
analyzed: tathā hi jñānasya prakāśaka tvam nāma kim vidyamāna tvam vyāpāra āveśaḥ vā
translated: For instance, what is called the illuminator nature of consciousness is it existence or manifestation of activity?
In the first case, it would follow that everything is seen at all times.

analyzed: sarva puruṣa jñāna vidyamāna tāyāḥ sarvam prati a viśiṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because the existence of all men's consciousnesses is not distinguished from anything else.

analyzed: tathā nīla ādibhiḥ api jñānasya grahaṇa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Similarly, it would follow that consciousness is also grasped by blue etc.

analyzed: teṣām api vidyamāna tva lakṣaṇa grāhaka tva saṃbhavāt
translated: Because for them also the nature of being grasped, which is characterized by existence, is possible.

original: atha jñānatve sati vidyamānatvamiti saviśeṣaṇaṃ lakṣaṇamucyate /
analyzed: atha jñāna tve sati vidyamāna tvam iti sa viśeṣaṇam lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: Now, if a definition with a qualifier is stated, namely, existence when it is consciousness,

analyzed: tat kim nīla ādīnām ajñāna tve kośa pānam āyuṣmatā kartavyam
translated: then why should the venerable one drink poison,

original: yena sattāmātreṇa samasamayaṃ sphuratorvijñānanīlādyoḥ pratijñāmātrādekasya jaḍatvālīkatvabādhyatvāprakāśatvādi vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: yena sattā mātreṇa samasamayam sphuratoḥ vijñāna nīla ādyoḥ pratijñā mātrāt ekasya jaḍa tva alīka tva bādhya tva aprakāśa tva ādi vyavasthāpyate
translated: since by mere existence, the simultaneous manifestation of consciousness and blue etc. is established by mere assertion, and one is established as inert, illusory, negated, non-illuminated etc.

original: atha dvitīyastadā sa kiṃ vyāpāraḥ pratyakṣasyātmā jñānāntaram /
analyzed: atha dvitīyaḥ tadā sa kim vyāpāraḥ pratyakṣasya ātmā jñāna antaram
translated: Now, if it is the second, then what is the operation of perception? Is it the self of knowledge or another cognition?

analyzed: arthasya ātma artha antaram vā syāt
translated: Or is it the self of the object or another object?
In the first case, there is a contradiction in action upon itself.

original: dvitīyapakṣe jñānāntaraṃ yadyanyaviṣayam arthasya na kiñcit /
analyzed: dvitīya pakṣe jñāna antaram yadi anya viṣayam arthasya na kiñcid
translated: In the second case, if another cognition has a different object, it does not do anything to the object.

analyzed: tad viṣaya tvam ca adya api na siddham
translated: And the fact that it has that object is not established even now.

analyzed: tad pratyāsatteḥ eva cintyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the very connection with that is being considered.

original: tṛtīye punaḥ saṅkalpe nīlādikaṃ kṛtameva syāt /
analyzed: tṛtīye punar saṅkalpe nīla ādikam kṛtam eva syāt
translated: But in the third case, if the object is different, then blue etc. would already be done.

analyzed: na prakāśitam
translated: It would not be illuminated.

analyzed: taila vartī ādibhiḥ iva pradīpaḥ
translated: Like a lamp by oil, wicks etc.

analyzed: prakāśaḥ tu svayam eva
translated: But the illumination is by itself.

analyzed: tathā ca jñāna antara tvāt santāna antara vat apratibhāsa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And in that case, because it is another cognition, there would be the consequence of non-appearance like in another continuum.

original: caturthe tu vikalpe arthāntare kṛte nīlādikaṃ tadavasthameva /
analyzed: caturthe tu vikalpe artha antare kṛte nīla ādikam tad avastham eva
translated: But in the fourth case, if the object is different, then blue etc. would remain as they are.

analyzed: na ca anātma prakāśana sāmarthyam jñānasya svīkartum ucitam
translated: And it is not proper to accept that knowledge has the ability to illuminate what is not its self.

analyzed: vyāpāra vat prakāśanasya api evam nirākartavya tvāt
translated: Because illumination, like action, should be refuted in the same way.

original: na cāgnidhūmayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāva iva jñānajñeyayorapi svābhāviko grāhyagrāhakabhāvo vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca agni dhūmayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ iva jñāna jñeyayoḥ api svābhāvikaḥ grāhya grāhaka bhāvaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: And the relation of object and subject cannot be said to be natural between knowledge and the knowable, as it is between fire and smoke.

original: pramāṇasiddhakāryakāraṇabhāvavad grāhyagrāhakasvarūpayoradyāpi nirvaktumaśakyatvāditi kva nīlādivārtāpi yadbhedasiddhipratyāśā pratyakṣataḥ
analyzed: pramāṇa siddha kārya kāraṇa bhāva vat grāhya grāhaka svarūpayoḥ adyā api nirvaktum aśakya tvāt iti kva nīla ādi vārtā api yat bheda siddhi pratyāśā pratyakṣataḥ
translated: Because the nature of object and subject, like the relation of cause and effect established by means of valid cognition, cannot yet be explained. So where is the talk of blue etc., on which the hope of establishing difference through perception rests?

analyzed: sampadyate
translated: It is fulfilled.

analyzed: atha ātma bhūtam tat pratyakṣam iti dvitīyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: If the second alternative is accepted that perception is of the nature of the self,

original: tadātmasvasaṃvedanameva bhedasādhakamabhyupagataṃ bhavet /🔽tacca yadi pratyākāraṃ bhinnaṃ tadā sarveṣāṃ svasvarūpanimagnatvāccitraprakāśapraṇāśaprasaṅga ityuktam /
analyzed: tadā ātma sva saṃvedanam eva bheda sādhakam abhyupagatam bhavet  tat ca yadi pratyākāram bhinnam tadā sarveṣām sva svarūpa nimagna tvāt citra prakāśa praṇāśa prasaṅgaḥ iti uktam
translated: then it would be admitted that self-awareness itself is the means of establishing difference.🔽And if that is different for each form, then all would be immersed in their own nature, and there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of the manifestation of the variegated. This has been stated.

analyzed: atha etad doṣa bhayāt sarveṣām ākārāṇām eka tvam eva svabhāva bhūtam sva saṃvedanam iṣyate
translated: If, out of fear of this fault, the unitary nature alone, which is self-awareness, is accepted as the nature of all forms,

analyzed: tadā etat eva citra advaitam vijñānam ucyate
translated: then this very variegated non-duality is said to be consciousness.

analyzed: yat aneka abhimatānām saha upalabdhānām nīla sukha ādi ākārāṇām svabhāva bhūta akhaṇḍa sva saṃvedana pratyakṣam nāma
translated: It is the direct perception of the unbroken self-awareness that is the nature of the many forms that are apprehended together, such as blue and pleasure.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ guravaḥ
translated: As the teachers say:

analyzed: bhrama abhrama akalpana kalpanāni  śāta asita ādīni akhila akṣa jāni
translated: The notions of error and non-error, imagination and non-imagination,🔽Sweetness and bitterness, and all other sense-based cognitions,

analyzed: jñānāni abhinnāni saha upalabdheḥ
translated: Are not different, because they are apprehended together.

analyzed: pūrva apara tvam tu na vedyam eva iti
translated: But priority and posteriority are not to be known at all.

analyzed: nibandh
translated: The Treatise

analyzed: tat evam dṛṣṭānta dārṣṭāntikayoḥ ubhayatra api sva saṃvedana pratyakṣa siddham ekatvam avidyā vaśāt vipratipattau satyām anumānataḥ sādhyate
translated: Thus, in both the example and the exemplified, oneness is established by the perception of one's own experience. When there is disagreement due to ignorance, it is established by inference.

original: ata eva svasaṃvedanapratyakṣādanumānācca ekatvasiddhau na pratyakṣāntaram /🔽nāpi viruddhadharmādhyāsalakṣaṇamanumānaṃ bhedasādhanāya prāptāvasaram /
analyzed: atas eva sva saṃvedana pratyakṣāt anumānāt ca eka tva siddhau na pratyakṣa antaram  nā api viruddha dharma adhyāsa lakṣaṇam anumānam bheda sādhanāya prāpta avasaram
translated: For this very reason, when oneness is established by the perception of one's own experience and by inference, there is no other perception.🔽Nor is inference characterized by the superimposition of contradictory properties, which is an opportunity for establishing difference.

analyzed: bheda grāhakasya bhinnasya pratyakṣasya ukta krameṇa aprāmāṇyāt
translated: Because the different perception that grasps difference is not valid according to the stated procedure.

analyzed: pakṣasya pratyakṣa ādi bādhita tvāt
translated: Because the subject is contradicted by perception and so on.

analyzed: nanu brūyāt nāma kiñcid
translated: But surely something can be said.

analyzed: tathā api pratibhāsa bhedāt bhedaḥ eva
translated: Even so, difference is established by the difference in appearance.

analyzed: na hi dṛṣṭe nupapannam nāma iti ced
translated: For what is seen is not impossible, if this is argued.

analyzed: hanta pratibhāsa śabdena kim abhipretam
translated: Well then, what is meant by the word appearance?

analyzed: kim ākāra cakram sphuraṇam vā
translated: Is it the form-circle or the manifestation?

original: tatra yadi prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ /🔽tadā bāhye 'rthe pratyetavye buddhyākāraḥ pramāṇam /
analyzed: tatra yadi prathamaḥ pakṣaḥ  tadā bāhye rthe pratyetavye buddhi ākāraḥ pramāṇam
translated: If the first alternative is accepted,🔽then the form of cognition is the means of knowing the external object.

analyzed: tathā ca ākāra bhedaḥ vyavahartavyaḥ eva
translated: And in that case, the difference in forms must be admitted in practice.

analyzed: anyathā bāhya bhedaḥ na sidhyet
translated: Otherwise, the difference in external objects would not be established.

original: yadā punarākāracakrameva prameyam svasaṃvedanaṃ ca pramāṇaṃ tadā tenaiva nīlādīnāṃ svabhāvabhūtenākhaṇḍātmanā ekīkṛtānāṃ kathamapramādī bhedamācakṣīta
analyzed: yadā punar ākāra cakram eva prameyam sva saṃvedanam ca pramāṇam tadā tena eva nīla ādīnām svabhāva bhūtena akhaṇḍa ātmanā ekīkṛtānām katham apramādī bhedam ācakṣīta
translated: But when the very circle of forms is the object of knowledge and self-awareness is the means of knowing, then how can a careful person speak of the difference of blue etc., which are unified by their indivisible nature which is their very essence?

original: dvitīyapakṣe tu sphuraṇaṃ svabhāvabhūtākhaṇḍasvasaṃvedanamevoktamiti /🔽tathāpi kathaṃ bhedastasmād yathordhvamindriyapratyakṣataḥ kṣaṇabhede pratīte 'pyavidyāvaśādekatvādhyavasāyaḥ🔽tathā tiryaksvasaṃvedanapratyakṣeṇākārābhede 'dhigate 'pyavidyāvaśādeva bhedāvasāyaḥ //
analyzed: dvitīya pakṣe tu sphuraṇam svabhāva bhūta akhaṇḍa sva saṃvedanam eva uktam iti  tathā api katham bhedaḥ tasmāt yathā ūrdhvam indriya pratyakṣataḥ kṣaṇa bhede pratīte pi avidyā vaśāt eka tva adhyavasāyaḥ  tathā tiryak sva saṃvedana pratyakṣeṇa ākāra abhede dhigate pi avidyā vaśāt eva bheda avasāyaḥ
translated: In the second alternative, it is said that the manifestation is the indivisible self-awareness which is the very essence.🔽Even so, how can there be difference? Just as above, even though the difference of moments is known by sense perception, there is the conception of unity due to ignorance.🔽Similarly, even though the non-difference of forms is known by the self-awareness of sense perception, the conception of difference is due to ignorance itself.

original: yadyevaṃ viruddhadharmādhyāsato vijñānākāracakravad vyāpto 'pi na bhidyeteti cet /
analyzed: yadi evam viruddha dharma adhyāsataḥ vijñāna ākāra cakra vat na bhidyeta iti ced
translated: If it is argued that if it is so, then even though pervaded like the circle of forms of consciousness, it is not different due to the superimposition of contradictory properties,🔽it is said that this is not so.

analyzed: na bāhye dharmiṇi aneka tvasya sādhyasya pratyakṣa ādi abādhita tvāt
translated: No, because in the external object, which is the subject, the probandum, i.e., multiplicity, is not contradicted by perception etc.

original: buddhyākārakadambake tūktakrameṇa svasaṃvedanādisiddhaikatve 'nekatvasya pratyākhyānād bādhakāvatāra eva nāsti /
analyzed: buddhi ākāra kadambake tu ukta krameṇa sva saṃvedana ādi siddha ekatve nekatvasya pratyākhyānāt bādhaka avatāraḥ eva nā asti
translated: But in the pair of forms of cognition, the multiplicity is refuted by the established oneness through self-awareness etc. in the stated manner, so there is no scope for contradiction at all.

original: tasmād vijñānatve satīti hetuviśeṣaṇaṃ kartavyam yena bāhyasyaiva bhedaḥ sidhyati //
analyzed: tasmāt vijñāna tve sati iti hetu viśeṣaṇam kartavyam yena bāhyasya eva bhedaḥ sidhyati
translated: Therefore, the reason should be qualified as being consciousness, so that only the external difference is established.

original: nanu yadi vijñānātmakaṃ vicitrākāracakramekaṃ tadā nīlākāra eva pītādyākāravṛndaṃ praviśet /
analyzed: nanu yadi vijñāna ātmakam vicitra ākāra cakram ekam tadā nīla ākāraḥ eva pīta ādi ākāra vṛndam praviśet
translated: If the variegated circle of forms is one and of the nature of consciousness, then the form of blue itself should enter the multitude of forms such as yellow.

analyzed: tathā prakāśa ākāra cakrayoḥ abhedaḥ vyakti sāmānya vat prakāśaḥ eva
translated: Similarly, the difference between the circle of forms and the circle of light, like the difference between an individual and a universal, would be only light.

analyzed: ākāra cakram eva vā syāt iti ced
translated: Or the circle of forms itself would be. If it is argued thus,

analyzed: asat etat
translated: that is not correct.

analyzed: tathā hi dvayoḥ api anayoḥ prasaṅga viparyayayoḥ bhedaḥ
translated: Because in both these cases, i.e., in the case of the undesirable consequence and its reversal, there is difference.

analyzed: sa ca bāhya artha vāde eva yujyate
translated: And that is possible only in the doctrine of external objects.

analyzed: tatra bheda grāhakasya indriya pratyakṣasya iṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because there, the perception of the senses, which apprehends difference, is accepted.

analyzed: vijñāna vāde tu anātma prakāśa abhāvāt sva saṃvedanam eva ekam pramāṇam
translated: But in the doctrine of consciousness, there is no manifestation of what is not self, so self-awareness alone is the only means of knowledge.

original: tato 'pi viparyayasya bhedasya siddheḥ prasaṅgo 'pyasaṅgataḥ ityadvaitameva /
analyzed: viparyayasya bhedasya siddheḥ iti advaitam eva
translated: Therefore, the consequence of the establishment of the difference of the contrary is also incoherent, so non-duality alone remains.

original: kiṃ ca evaṃ sthūlanīlādyākāro 'pi paramāṇumātre praviśedityapratibhāsaṃjagadāpadyeta /
analyzed: kim ca evam paramāṇu mātre praviśet iti apratibhā sam jagat āpadyeta
translated: Moreover, in this way, even the gross form of blue etc. would enter into the mere atom, and the world would be reduced to non-appearance.

analyzed: asti ca pratibhāsaḥ
translated: But there is appearance.

analyzed: tasmāt yathā avasthitānām eva ākārāṇām akhaṇḍa sva saṃvedana ātma tā eva ekatvam
translated: Therefore, the oneness of the forms as they are, is only the self-awareness of the undivided self.

analyzed: na bhedaḥ na saṃkocaḥ svīkartavyaḥ pratibhāsa prasaṅgāt
translated: Difference and contraction should not be accepted, because of the consequence of non-appearance.
